loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 45 years old and married with six children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Sally has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from furniture making and direct selling.

Sally aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Diyo

texts.en:
Diyo is 35 years old, married and has five children; four of his children attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Diyo operates an M-pesa (money float) mobile money transfer business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Diyo faces a major challenge of capital in his business. He dreams of establishing another M-pesa shop in the future. With the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy credit cards for sale, and will use the other cash to renovate his place of business.

loans.use: to buy credit cards for sale and renovate his place of business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 58 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cooking oil, candies, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store.

Luciana has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an additional income from food vending.

Luciana aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like cooking oil, candies, biscuits, canned goods and shampoo to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dhakra

texts.en: Dhakra is an 18-year-old married woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She didn`t complete her studying. She is a housewife who tries to raise her child well.  She washes her clothes by hand because she doesn't have money to buy a washing machine. So she applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Mercedita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша 20-летняя молодая женщина. Она неудачно вышла замуж и развелась с мужем. В данное время Бунафша живет у родителей вместе с сёстрами и братом в районе Бохтар. После развода Бунафша быстро справилась с трудностями и начала работать в сфере торговли. Она занимается продажей нижнего женского белья уже два года. Ее торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города Кургантюбе. Бунафша в месяц 4-раза закупает свой товар с оптового рынка города Душанбе. Сейчас Бунафша обратилась за кредитом для приобретения товара (нижнего женского белья), чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Bunafsha is a young woman of 20. She was unlucky in marriage and divorced her husband. Presently, together with her sisters and brother, she lives in her parents' home in the Bohtar region of Tajikistan. After her divorce, Bunafsha quickly overcame her difficult situation and started working in retail. She has been selling women's undergarments for the past two years. Her retail spot is located at the central market of the city of Kurgantube. Bunafsha restocks her merchandise 4 times per month at the wholesale market in the city of Dushanbe. 

Bunafsha is requesting this loan to purchase more goods (women's underwear) in order to increase the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to purchase women's undergarments in order to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Zarob

texts.ru:
Зароб житель города Куляб, расположенный на юге Таджикистана. Ему 45 лет. Он женат и у него сын и дочь, которые учатся в школе. Вместе с ними в одном доме живут еще один его брат и две племянники. 
Уже год как Зароб занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает бычков со скотного рынка города Куляб и близлежащих деревень, откармливает их в течение 30 дней и затем продает с наценкой. Заробу в его деятельности помогает жена. Одновременно Зароб и его жена занимаются земледелием. Кредит берет для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Zarob lives in the city of Kulob in the south of Tajikistan. He is 45 years old, married, and has a son and a daughter who attend school. The family shares their home with one of Zarob's brothers and two nephews. 

For the past year, Zarob has been buying and reselling cattle. He purchases calves at the livestock market that serves Kulob and nearby villages, fattens the animals for 30 days, and then resells them at a profit. Zarob's wife helps her husband in this occupation, and both of them are also engaged in farming. Zarob is taking this loan to buy cattle for subsequent resale.

loans.use: to purchase cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Jose Antono

texts.es: Don José, es un cliente que vive con su pareja quien trabaja como secretaria, ambos tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, la labor de José es el de publicista para una revista desde hace dos años trabajo que le gusta mucho y espera crecer más adelante, por ahora con sus ingresos desea invertir en la mejora del techo de su vivienda los cuales ya tienen muchos años y se están deteriorando, es por eso la solicitud de este primer crédito, para que su salario le pueda alcanzar para los otros gastos del hogar y de escuela.
texts.en:
Don José lives with his partner who works as a secretary. They have two school-age children. For the past two years, José has been working as a publicist for a magazine. He enjoys his work tremendously and hopes to keep growing in the future.

For now, he wants to invest his earnings into improvements to his home which he has owned for many years. José wants to repair the roof of his home, which has deteriorated. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan since his salary will be used for household and school expenses.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and crossbeams in order to repair the roof.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррине 29 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Все ее дети девочки. Она очень любит своих прекрасных девочек. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Заррина более 7 лет занимается купле продажи продуктов питания в продовольственном магазине. Она 7 лет назад начала этот бизнес, так как этот вид бизнеса очень прибыльный и имеет большой спрос. Заррина справляется с бизнесом сама, так как муж в России, и она сама живет с детьми. Заррина должна увеличить свой доход, так как дети растут и требуют больше благ. Она не имеет денег для покупки дополнительного оборотного капитала, чтобы расширить ассортимент товара и таким образом привлечь много клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки продуктов питания, как консервы, напитки, молочные продукты и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zarrina is 29 years old. She is married and raising 3 daughters, whom she loves very much. Zarrina's husband is a migrant worker in Russia.

For over 7 years, Zarrina has been selling food in her grocery store. She decided to open her shop because this type of business can be very profitable and is always in demand. Zarrina takes care of the store on her own since her husband is away and she is left alone with their children. Presently, she needs to increase her profits, as her children are getting older and require additional expenditures. However, Zarrina lacks the funds to purchase additional merchandise in order to expand the assortment of goods in her store and thereby attract more customers. She is requesting a loan of US$3000 to purchase foodstuffs such as preserves, beverages, dairy products, etc. Zarrina is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products such as canned goods, beverages and dairy products, and increase her working capital

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mariela en su negocio de venta de mercancía variada, porque con su anterior credikiva logró hacer compras en mayor volumen de papelería, ropa femenina, y cosméticos, que vendió a su clientela. Con esta inversión mejoró la imagen de su negocio y aumentaron sus ganancias.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el que comprará artículos de papelería, cosméticos en mayor volumen, compra que realizará por solicitud de su clientela. Mariela da las gracias a sus financiadores y espera que sigan apoyando a personas como ella, para continuar fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support for her business of selling various merchandise, Mariela used her previous Kiva loan to buy a large volume of stationery, women’s clothes, and cosmetics to sell to her customers. With this investment, she was able to improve the image of her business and increase her profits.

She is currently applying for a new loan so that she can buy stationery and cosmetics in large volumes since these items have been requested by her customers. Mariela is grateful to the Kiva lenders and hopes that they will continue supporting people like her so that they can continue to strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: to buy stationery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente  vive en Guayaquil. El empezó como ayudante en una peluquería luego se especializo y ahora tiene clientes de farándula a los cuales lo atiendo y quedan satisfechos  con su trabajo.

El trabaja solo de 10h00 a 20h00. Su dificultad es que cuando es el invierno los químicos le hacen daño y en ocasiones no puede trabajar ya que el es PVVS (paciente viviendo con Vih Sida). No es casado ni tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo va a comprar tintes, muebles, planchas, cosmeticos. Su sueño es tener primero su casa propia, tener un local grande, formar una familia y darles una buena calidad de vida y darles trabajo a otros en la misma situación.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. He started out as an assistant at a hair salon, but later he became a specialist. Now he has celebrity clients that he serves and they are satisfied with his work.

The borrower works on his own from 10:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. He experiences difficulty during the winter because the chemicals used during that time are harmful to him. On occasion he is not able to work because he is a patient living HIV/AIDS.

With this loan, he will buy dyes, furnishings, curling irons, and cosmetics. His dream is to first acquire a home of his own and then get a larger shop, start a family and provide them a good quality of life, and provide jobs to others who are in a similar situation.

loans.use: to buy dyes, furnishings, curling irons, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Felicita Ramona

texts.es: Felicita es una mujer dedicada a la enseñanza principalmente de los niños, ya que su profesión es  maestra de educación primaria, pero actualmente se desempeña como subdirector  de un núcleo educativo del sector donde habita, es soltera, actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de tubos cuadrado de ¾, hierro, varilla ¼ lisa, varilla de soldar, perlin y mano de obra. Para la construcción de verjas, la que le brindara mejores condiciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Felicita is a dedicated woman who mainly instructs children as a primary school teacher. However, she currently works as an assistant director for a basic education center in the neighborhood where she lives.

Felicita is single and currently in need of improvements to the condition of her home. For this reason, she visited CEPRODEL so that she could take advantage of a loan. She will use the money to buy ¾ square tubing, iron, ¼ smooth rods, welding rods, and crossbeams. In addition, she will pay for labor. By constructing safety railings, Felicita will improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to buy square tubing, iron, smooth rods, welding rods, crossbeams, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque son una fuente para mejorar el negocio y las condiciones de vida de su familia. Este le permitirá comprar comida para los cerdos, para pagar la mano de obra porque preparara 8 tareas de tierra para la siembra de cultivo.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a cambiar la rentabilidad y la esta estabilidad de su negocio, incrementando así sus ingresos económicos; también posee mucha cosecha para comercializarla. Edilberto, cuenta que gracias a DIOS y a Kiva que por medio de Padecomsm que le han brindado los créditos, ha crecido en las actividades de cerdos, siembra de maíz y frijol; asimismo han mejorado las condiciones de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is applying for another loan in order to improve his business and his family's living conditions.  This loan will allow him to buy feed for his pigs and to pay for labourers to prepare eight hectares of land for planting crops.

Edilberto's previous loan helped him to make his business more profitable and stable and so his own income grew.  Edilberto also has a lot from the harvest to sell.  He says that, thanks to God and Kiva, who have provided him with loans through Padecomsm, his pigs, corn and bean businesses have grown.  More than that, his family's living conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and to pay for labourers to prepare eight hectares for planting crops.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis, es un hombre que se caracteriza por su fuerza y empeño para ir en búsqueda de un mejor mañana. Desplazado por la violencia desde hace un año, este hombre se radicó en la ciudad de Medellín con la esperanza de un mejor porvenir para él y su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Sin ningún apoyo económico debió comenzar de cero y buscar los medios para generar el sustento de su hogar.
Desde hace cinco meses montó una legumbrería, con el fin de mejorar su condición económica ya que por su carencia educativa el acceso a un empleo se convirtió en una odisea para el.
Las personas del sector han respondido favorablemente, por lo cual Luis desea realizar una inversión en su negocio para incrementar las ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Su mayor sueño es poder convertir su legumbrería en una tienda autoservicio y convertirse en una fuente generadora de empleo en el sector.
texts.en:
Luis is a man characterised by his strength and dedication as he strives for a better future.  Displaced by violence a year ago, he moved to Medeillín in hope of having a better life for him and his family - he has a wife and two children, both of whom are still under 18.  With no financial support Luis was starting from zero as he looked for ways to generate an income to support the family.

Five months ago, Luis started a vegetable store in order to improve his financial situation.  Due to his lack of education, access to the job market became an incredibly difficult thing to gain.

The people in the area have responded well to Luis's new shop and so he wants to invest in the business to increase sales and improve his family's quality of life.

Luis's biggest dream is to be able to turn the vegetable shop into a self-service shop and to become a source of employment for the area.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Ada Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ada es cliente Kiva, de 58 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, casada,  de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de unos de los muchos productos derivados del maíz como es la tortilla y a la misma vez brinda el servicio de molino.
Ella dice que su primer crédito Kiva le fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo comprar toda la materia prima que necesitaba para la elaboración de sus tortillas como maíz, leña, etc.Se siente muy orgullosa porque este negocio le genera ganancias a diario. 
Es por eso que hoy en día esta solicitando de su segundo crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como piedras canteras, bloques, arena, cemento, laminas de zinc con el propósito de mejorar la infraestructura del lugar en donde tiene su molino Con el objetivo de obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Ada is a Kiva borrower.  She is 58 years old and mother to five children, all of whom are now adults.  Ada is married and a businesswoman who makes a living selling many corn-based products such as tortillas.  She also provides a flour grinding service.

Ada says that her first Kiva loan was a great help to her as she was able to buy the material she needed to make the tortillas, such as corn, firewood and more.  Ada is very proud because the business is making a profit every day.

So, because of this, Ada is today applying for her second loan to buy construction materials such as quarry rocks, bricks, sand, cement and zinc sheets  to improve the place where she has her flour grinder.  This will help her to make a better income.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as quarry rocks, bricks, sand, cement and zinc sheets

loans.name: Karol

texts.es: Karol, de 25 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 2 pequeños hijos a quienes entrega todo el amor y los cuidados que necesitan, vive a lado de su familia en la casa de sus padres y trabaja mucho para brindarles una buena educación.El trabajo de Karol consiste en la venta de golosinas como galletas, dulce, bizcochos, caramelos y queques elaborados por sus propias manos pero también vende comida, principalmente desayunos como pan con queso, pan con huevo, avenas y mazamorras de diversos productos. Su negocio esta establecido en lo que anteriormente fue un garaje de la casa de sus padres y ahí diariamente abre las puertas de su local para atenderlos cordialmente desde las 8 de la mañana. Realiza este trabajo hace 1 año y asegura que todo va marchando bien. Trabaja siempre con la ayuda de su madre para la atención de los clientes, en la preparación de los dulces trabaja sola, lo que más le pone feliz es observar a sus clientes degustar con mucho placer todo lo que ella vende y cuando le piden repetición sabe que está haciendo un buen trabajo. Espera implementar su negocio con mayor cantidad de golosinas como pasteles y chocolates para brindar mayor diversidad de productos a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1000 soles , es por eso que agradece este financiamiento ya que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado comprará caramelos, chicles, panes, lechugas, tomates, queso, leche ,huevos y otros productos que usa continuamente en su actividad laboral.
texts.en:
Karol is 25 years old and married. She has two small children and provides them all of the love and care that they need. Karol and her family live at her parents’ house. She works hard so that she can provide her children a good education. Her job consists of selling snack foods such as cookies, candy, sponge cakes, caramels, and cupcakes that she prepares with her own hands. She also sells food, mainly breakfast items such as bread with cheese, oatmeal, corn porridge, and other different products. Her business was previously located in the garage of her parents’ house, but now she opens the doors of her shop promptly at 8:00 A.M. Karol has been doing this work for one year and says that everything is going well. Her mother always works with her and helps with attending to the customers while she prepares the sweets by herself. She is happy to see her customers enjoy with great pleasure everything that she sells. Whenever they ask for more, she knows that she is doing a good job.

Karol hopes to stock her business with a larger quantity of snacks, such as pastries and chocolates, so that she can provide a wider diversity of products to her customers. She is taking this opportunity to request 1,000 PEN. For this reason, she is grateful that this financing will help her accomplish her goals. The amount she requested will be used to buy caramels, gum, bread, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, milk, eggs, and other products that she continually uses in her work.

loans.use: to buy caramels, gum, bread, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, milk, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Elsy Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Elsy de 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa faldas, blusas, ropa interior, etc, para damas caballeros y niños, asi como en la fotografia donde sale la clienta mostrando su negocio, ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 8 y 14 años que estudian actualmente, es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la calle principal del pueblo donde reside es un lugar de mucho comercio ya que se encuentran diferentes negocios y ventas ambulantes y muy transitado por una gran cantidad de personas. Doña Elsy solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y poder surtir su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden en los gastos de su hogar y poder tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Doña Elsy is 47 years old and sells all types of clothing such as skirts, blouses, undergarments, and other items for women, men, and children. In the photograph, she is shown at her business. Elsy lives with her life companion and their two children, ages 8 and 14, who are currently studying. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. Her business is located along the main street of the town where she lives. A great deal of trade takes place in this area since there are different businesses, street vendors, and a large number of people that pass through.

Doña Elsy is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise in order to restock her business. As a result, she will generate more income to help with the household expenses and to provide greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in order to restock her business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 37 años de edad , esta casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y su madre.El trabajo de Carlos consiste principalmente en el transporte de pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, diariamente se levanta muy temprano para salir en busca de sus eventuales clientes que deseen trasladarse de algún lugar hasta otro punto específico de la ciudad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 10 años y asegura que esta actividad le dio la oportunidad de crecer junto a su familia . Complementa su labor con la venta de gaseosas y gelatinas en su casa, del mismo modo tiene cuartos que ha construido en un espacio de su terreno los cuales pone en alquiler a precios muy cómodos de manera mensual. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad para trasladar a su hijo a su centro educativo, del mismo modo puede movilizar a su familia y realizar otras funciones laborales, espera que mas adelante sus negocios progresen aun mas ya que desea desarrollar otro trabajo que es la crianza de pollos, aunque para ello necesita ahorrar un poco más. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600 para la compra de piezas de su mototaxi como llantas y repuestos para su mototaxi ,para asi continuar con su trabajo sin porblemeas, además agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 7 and 2). He lives in his own house along with his wife and his mother. His work consists mainly of transporting passengers throughout the city. Every day he wakes up extremely early so that he can look for customers who need to travel from one place to another specified point within the city. Carlos has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and says that his business gives him the opportunity to grow along with his family. In addition to his job, he also sells sodas and gelatins out of his house. He also has rooms that he had built on his land so that he could rent them out on a monthly basis for an affordable price.

What he enjoys most about his job is being available to take his child to school. At the same time, he is able to take his family to different places and perform other jobs. Going forward, Carlos expects his businesses to progress, so he would like to start another venture of raising chickens. In order to do this, he will need to save a little more.

Carlos is taking this opportunity to request 600 PEN so that he can buy tires and spare parts for his motorcycle taxi. This will allow him to continue his work without any problems. He would like to thank everyone who made it possible for him to access this loan so that he can continue to accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Koagma Group

texts.fr:
Mme  EVELINE représente le groupe  KOAGMA. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Tous vont à l’école.
EVELINE  prépare et vend du dolo depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Manga et Yipelcé. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter un sac de mil germé et une barrique d’eau pour la préparation du dolo.
Elle veut aider à la scolarisation des enfants avec ses bénéfices. EVELINE ambitionne ouvrir d’autres cabarets et construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Eveline is the Koagma group representative. A married woman, she is the mother of 5 children. The eldest is 25 years old and the youngest, 6. All of her children go to school.

Eveline has been making and selling dolo (a type of beer made from millet) for 20 years. She gets her supplies in Manga and Yipelcé. Her customers are men and women. She would like to buy a bag of germinated millet and a barrel of water with which to make dolo. She wants to use her profits to contribute to her children's education. Eveline plans to open other taverns and to build a family home.

loans.use: to buy a bag of germinated millet and a barrel of water with which to make dolo.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une dame âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants de 20 et 22 ans. Comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 03 ans environ. Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 2 children aged 20 and 22. She has been running a business selling takeaway goods in a district of town for 3 years. She enjoys a good experience in this area.

She would like to use this loan to increase her inventory of crates of drinks so that she can satisfy her customer demand. This will increase both her turnover and her profit. The revenues generated by her business will allow her to better provide for her family's needs. Her business ambition is to become a drinks wholesaler.

loans.use: to increase her drinks inventory.

loans.name: Remigio Eliezer

texts.es:
Remigio Eliezer es nacido en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona  casada con  dos persona bajo su cargo, se desempeña como agente de seguridad en una empresa del estado desde hace once año.

Esta solicitando a Ceprodel un crédito para seguir mejorando su casa, en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cinc y pago de mano de obra, para la reparación del techo que esta en mal estado. 

El joven Remigio Eliezer, dice que gracia a los financiamientos que ha obtenido a través de esta financiera ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda y darle a su familia una buena condición de vida.
texts.en:
Remigio Eliezer was born in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is married with two people in his care. He has worked as a security guard for a public institution for one year.

He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL in order to continue improving his house. He will use it to buy building materials, such as corrugated galvanized iron, and pay labourers to fix his roof, which is in poor condition.

Young Remigio Eliezer says that thanks to the financing he has obtained through this institution he has been able to continue improving his home little by little and give his family good living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Victor

texts.fr: Victor est un homme âgé de 24 ans, commerçant. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Victor is a 24-year-old man and a retailer. He has a small grocery shop in a district of town which he has been running for 2 years. His small business works thanks to his warm welcome, the experience he has in his line of work and the customer base that he has built up over time. The latter is becoming large, and he is no longer able to satisfy his customers due to the small size of his capital which forces him to buy products retail. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can strengthen his little business, diversify his merchandise - by buying items like rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar and sweets - and increase his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profits into his business so that he can cover his business needs, and the other part of his profits will allow him to meet his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of basic supplies.

loans.name: Jeizon Franklin

texts.es:
Jeizon Franklin es originaria de Managua departamento de Nicaragua, donde convive con su familia desde hace once año, se desempeña como Higienista desde hace cinco años en una empresa del estado.
 
solicita a CEPRODEL un crédito, para compra de materiales de construcción tales como: perlin, cinc y pago de mano de obra, para reparación del techo que esta en mal estado ya que se avecina el invierno.

Don Jeizon Franklin dice que con estos financiamiento ha podido ir acondicionando su vivienda y da gracia adiós y a Kiva-ceprodel  por el apoyo le han brindado, así ha podido salir adelante logrando sus meta. es una persona responsable con sus repago.
texts.en:
Jeizon Franklin is from Managua in the department of Nicaragua, where he has lived with his family for 11 years.  He has been working as a hygienest for a state company for five years.

He is requesting a loan through CEPRODEL to buy construction materiales such as metal profiles and sheeting, and to hire workers to repair the roof of his house.  It is in disrepair and the winter season is approaching.

Jeizon Franklin says that with this financing he is able to renovate his house.  He thanks the Lord and is grateful to Kiva-Ceprodel for the support he is receiving so he can reach his goal.  He is a responsible person with a good credit record.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Te Agradesco Señor Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Yesenia mujer de 23 años, soltera, tiene de estar con la institución cuatro años de ser clientes quien ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, su negocio tiene de existir 4años. Hace 10 años inicia vendiendo helados, golosinas con sus esfuerzos y logros a aumentado su negocio , el crédito lo utilizara en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, huevo, leche, pan, detergentes etc. Rosa tiene 51 años de edad y su negocio venta de ropa y María tiene 62 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de hoja de chagüites.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Yesenia, 23, who is single and has been a client of the institution for four years.  She has demonstrated responsibility in her loan repayments and has been in business for four years.

Ten years ago she began selling ice cream and sweets, and with all her efforts has been able to increase business.  She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, eggs, milk, bread, detergents, etc.  

Rosa, 51, sells clothing and María, 62, sells banana leaves.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, eggs, milk, bread, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Cathérine est une jeune femme de 29 ans coiffeuse. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis 10 ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Cathérine, age 29, is a young hairdresser. After completing her training, she opened a hair salon. She's been running this business for ten years.

She often experiences problems in her beauty parlor, due to a lack of stock of cosmetics and hair extensions, which she buys retail.

Her goal is to satisfy her clientele and turn a large profit. In order to reach it, she's seeking a loan to be able to buy the products she needs in large quantities.

The profits earned thanks to this loan will be used to provide for herself and her family. She will also save some of her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair extensions

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan operates a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business from the market. 
He cites seasonality, especially during rainy season, since it becomes hard to transport during that time, as a challenge he faces. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.
With the KES 50,000 he wants to establish a vegetable stall and needs to purchase vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions. 
He decided to join Yehu because of their favorable loan policies. 
He thanks Kiva for the previous loan.

loans.use: to establish a vegetable stall by purchasing vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medical items.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from a small village in the Armavir region of Armenia where he lives with his retired father, wife and two sons, 22 and 16 years old respectively.
Artur has been involved in agriculture for many years. In particular, he keeps 2 cows, 3 calves and a pig, as well as owns an orchard where he grows peach, cherry, plum and nut trees with great love and care.
Farming helps Artur to earn a stable monthly income and sustain his family's living. Artur's wife milks cows and produces dairy products which Artur sells in the local market. They also work hard to gather good harvest and, by selling it, meet their family's basic needs.
In order to enlarge the agriculture land he needs financial support for covering cultivation costs and purchasing fertilizer. The loan that Artur has requested is very important for him to accomplish his goals. This is very important for Artur to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation costs and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: La Inmaculada De Concepcion Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA INMACULADA DE CONCEPCION” está conformado por 6 mujeres emprendedoras dedicadas a diversas actividades del comercio. Victoria es la presidenta del grupo tiene 60 años es casada. Actualmente labora en su bodega que puso en su casa hace 6 años. Años atrás trabajaba haciendo manualidades tejidos. Enseñaba tejido en la parroquia Don Bosco. Actualmente hace  manualidades en sus tiempos libres. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de un nuevo motor para su conservadora. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Victoria es la primera persona del lado derecho viste polo verde a rayas
texts.en:
The communal bank "LA INMACULADA DE CONCEPCION" is comprised of six women entrepreneurs who are involved in different sales activities.  Victoria,  the president of the group, is 60 and married.  She runs a store that she set up in her house six years ago.  She used to work in hand weaving and taught a class at the Don Bosco Parish.  Now she does crafts in her free time.

The loan will be used to buy a new motor for her refrigerator.  The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  Victoria is the first person sitting from the right in a green and white striped top.

loans.use: To buy a new motor for her refrigerator.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie st une femme de 46 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 15 et 23 ans.  Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie, age 46, is married and the mother of four children, whose ages range from 15 to 23. She opened a restaurant that she's been running for years.

This business enables her to provide for her family. Her profits are limited by the fact that she buys the products she needs retail.

This loan is thus important to her business, since it will enable her to increase her stock of food products (sacks of peanuts, one sack of rice, and other items she needs to cook her dishes).

It will render daily trips unnecessary and lower her taxi expenses, as well as increase her profits. She will reinvest one part of her profits to expand her restaurant. The other part will help her provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food products and buy peanuts and rice

loans.name: Succet

texts.en:
Succet is 37 years old and married with one child.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Succet is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Succet has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 29 years old and has 2 children. Ayman is the only provider for the family.
Ayman owns a small garage where he repairs all types of vehicles. He established his business in 2007. Ayman gained his experience through previously working as an employee at a similar garage. Now Ayman is rapidly earning experience and fame, thanks to his affordable prices and 24-hour services.
Ayman is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent for his garage. By getting this loan, Ayman will keep growing his business and will be able to continue providing for his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his vehicle repair garage.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Lorna works hard to support her family.
She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, soap, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.
Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, soap, noodles, soft drinks, etc to stock her general store.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Xiomara, quien al recibir su credikiva compró productos de panadería y lácteos y vendió en un mayor volumen. Se incrementaron el número de clientes y así mismo sus utilidades crecieron así como sus ingresos Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva que está muy agradecida por colaborar en su microempresa y que esto beneficia su futuro. En la actualidad está entusiasmada y aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará un mayor volumen de queso y de productos de panadería.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Xiomara, who used the CrediKiva loan to buy bakery goods and dairy products and was able to sell in greater volume.  Her number of clients has increased as well as her income and profits.  She wants to tell her Kiva lenders that she is very grateful for their collaboration in her small business and this will benefit her future.

Now she is excited and applying for a new CrediKiva loan to buy larger quantities of cheese and bakery goods.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of cheese and bakery goods.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is a hard working mother who helps her husband to generate income for the sake of their family. She is 49 years old and has three children. She operates a motorcycle transport business while her husband cultivates their farm land. They aim to become financially stable in order to satisfy their necessities and give their children a bright future. For this reason, Feliciana is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy wheels, a sprocket, gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She believes that the loan will be a great help to her in improving the business.

loans.use: to buy wheels, a sprocket, gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells dry goods in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods like shirts, blouses, shorts, pants.
Yvette has been in this business for 10 years. Yvette earns additional income from a bakery.
Yvette has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like shirts, blouses, shorts, and pants.

loans.name: Nandzugu

texts.en:
Nandzugu is a married woman who is 30 years old. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Nandzugu has operated a business selling firewood and charcoal to her neighbors and restaurant operators to use in cooking. 
She cites the high cost of transportation as her major challenge in the business.
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase additional bundles of firewood and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Lilibeth quien con su credikiva invirtió en su negocio comprando ropa, sandalias y productos naturales que incrementaron sus ventas. Ahora tiene nuevos clientes y sus utilidades mejoraron. En la actualidad se dedica a tomar pedidos para responder con nuevas mercancías en el día de las madres y sus solicitudes son superiores a las necesidades de su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa femenina, calzado y productos cosméticos en mayor volumen y que hoy presentan descuentos. Esto generará una capacidad mayor de negociación y oportunidades de responder con prontitud  y a la medida de las posibilidades de sus clientes, ante de que otros comerciantes lo haga. De allí el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Lilibeth who used her CrediKiva loan to invest in her business, buying clothing, sandals and natural products which increased her sales.  Now she has new clients and more profits.  She is currently taking orders to fill with new merchandise for Mother's Days and there is more customer demand.  

This is why she is requesting a new CrediKiva loan to buy women's lingerie, shoes and cosmetic products in large quantities at discount prices.  This will give her more negotiating leverage and the ability to turn around orders quickly, before other merchants can.  This is why her CrediKiva loan is successful.

loans.use: To buy greater quantities of women's lingerie, shoes and cosmetic products at discount prices.

loans.name: Jale

texts.en: Jale is a business man who lives in Juba. He benefited from the previous by increasing his capital and being able to buy more maize flour, paying part of his children’s school fees. He is now taking another loan to increase his sales capital and buy more bags of maize flour. He is happy for this loan and the support of Kiva lenders towards his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of maize flour.

loans.name: Jaqueline Del Pilar

texts.es:
Jaqueline es una mujer de 37 años que terminó la escuela primaria y es soltera, tiene tres hijos de 13, 8 y 6 años. En la actualidad María es la cabeza de su hogar en donde tiene la gran responsabilidad de educar y sostener a sus hijos con quien vive arrendando su residencia en la ciudad de Ibarra, la capital de la provincia de Imbabura. Esta ciudad pertenece a la Sierra ecuatoriana y está ubicada en el norte del Ecuador. Su clima veraniego, sus fiestas y la amabilidad de sus habitantes, son el atractivo principal de turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Predomina el arte y la cultura, pero también muchas personas han emprendido con proyectos turísticos que ofrecen la visita a cascadas, ríos, lagunas y caminatas por lugares que muestran la cultura de esta tierra.
Jaqueline desde hace 8 años se dedica a comercializar golosinas, frutas y verduras para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar, es una mujer a quien ningún obstáculo la ha detenido para seguir luchando por el bienestar de sus hijos, pues además de tener un espacio en el mercado para hacer sus ventas, también sale a los lugares públicos cuando hay eventos que convocan a multitudes. Gracias al espíritu emprendedor que heredó de toda su familia, ella ha crecido con su negocio y le dedica 7 u 8 horas cada día y en los eventos un poco más de tiempo pues se queda hasta altas horas de la noche, pero la dificultad de obtener créditos en algunas instituciones le ha dificultado mucho su crecimiento, sin embargo, gracias a varias recomendaciones de amigos y familiares, ha acudido a Fundación Alternativa para conseguir un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de productos adicionales para cumplir la demanda de sus clientes y así poder obtener mayor utilidad con sus ventas con lo cual poco a poco podrá lograr cumplir su sueño de reubicar su negocio en un lugar más grande, amplio y cómodo tanto para ella como para sus clientes y a un plazo un poco más largo poder comprar su propia casa. Jaqueline espera que todos quienes en las diferentes partes del mundo conozcan su historia a través de Kiva, la puedan apoyar a ella y a todos quienes luchan por sus sueños a través de la microempresa.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is a 37-year-old single woman who completed primary school. She has three children, who are 13, 8, and 6 years of age. Currently Mary is the head of her family, in which she has the great responsibility of educating and providing for her children, with whom she lives in her rented home in the city of Ibarra, the capital of the province of Imbabura. This city belongs to La Sierra and is located in the northern part of Ecuador. Its summery weather, its festivals, and its friendly inhabitants are the main attractions for national and international tourists. Art and culture predominate, but many people have also launched tourist projects which offer visits to waterfalls, rivers, and lagoons, as well as walks to places which show the culture of Ecuador.

For eight years Jaqueline has sold candy, fruit, and vegetables in order to support her home. No obstacle has stopped her from continuing to fight for the wellbeing of her children. Besides having a space in the market to make her sales, she also goes out to public places when there are events on which attract multitudes of people. Thanks to the enterprising spirit which she inherited from her whole family, she has made the business grow and she spends 7 or 8 hours each day working, and a little longer when events are on as she stays late into the night, but the difficulty of obtaining loans with some institutions has made growth very difficult; however, thanks to various recommendations by friends and family, she has applied to Fundación Alternativa for a loan which she will invest in purchasing additional products to meet customers’ demands and obtain greater profits on her sales. With these profits she will be able to fulfill her dream of relocating her business to a bigger, wider, and more comfortable place for her and her customers, and further down the track she will be able to buy her own house. Jaqueline hopes that people from all over the world will hear her story through Kiva and that they will be able to help her and all of those who fight for their dreams through microenterprise.

loans.use: to purchase products for stocking her store

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: La Sra. Simona tiene 29 años tiene tres hijos de las edades de 13, 5 y 8 años que ya se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica  a la venta de te esencia, sultana y empanizado hecho con azúcar y miel de caña  tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de Senkata, La Sra. Simona es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La Sra. Simona les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara productos por mayor, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Simona is 29 years old and has three children who are 13, 5 and 8 and go to school. Simona sells "sultana" [an herbal tea made from the dried berries of the coffee plant] and "empanizado" [unrefined whole cane sugar]. Her stall is located in the Senkata area.

Simona is a hardworking person that is reaching, step by step, stability and solvency. She is also gaining popularity with customers that appreciate her kind service. With the loan, she will buy supplies in bulk. Simona says that with hard work, it is possible to grow and to get all the things needed to have and give her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tea and empanizado [unrefined whole cane sugar].

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Asuncion works hard to support her family.
She has a vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Asuncion is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables.
Asuncion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional coconuts to sell.
Haydee has been in this business for 10 years. Haydee earns additional income from selling charcoal.
Haydee has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks of combs, soap, shampoo, and other items to keep in her store. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500. Bendita is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy combs, soap, shampoo, and other items for her kiosk.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old, married and has three children who are in school.
Mary Ann is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Mary Ann has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nusula

texts.en: Nusula is married with five children and four of them go to school. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, beef, fish, sweet potatoes and rice. Ashe generates additional income from poultry farming. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, beef, fish, sweet potatoes and rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sra. Elizabeth es soltera y tiene dos hijos dos varones que están en etapa escolar, vive en alquiler donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, la  habitación es de ladrillo y el piso de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 12 de Octubre de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja de empleada en una de las entidades públicas de la ciudad de La Paz;  su trabajo consiste en la limpieza de las oficinas por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a la mensajería,  por las noches se dedica a estudiar y aprender a manejar paquetes de aplicaciones, como Excel, Word, etc.; ella trabaja todos los días de la semana.   En su casa colaboran sus hermanos y sus papas le ayudan al cuidado de sus hijos mientras  Elizabeth se va al trabajo. Ella  paga  los servicios, alimentación, vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de matrícula y continuar sus estudios,  y así poder a mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth is a single mother of two children that go to school. She rents a place with a bedroom and a kitchen, built with bricks and with a wooden floor, and located in the 12 de Octubre area of La Paz.

Elizabeth works for the government of La Paz; she cleans the offices in the morning and delivers documents in the afternoon. At night, she studies and learns how to use software like Excel, Word, etc. Elizabeth works from Monday to Sunday. Her siblings help her at home and her parents take care of her children while she is working. She pays for the utilities, food, clothes and her children’s education.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to pay for the tuition fee and continue with her studies. This will improve her income and her quality of life. This is the first time she requests a loan to IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee and continue with her software studies.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар 24 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж простой рабочий и получает маленькую зарплату. Дилбар несколько лет назад начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как она очень умелая портниха. Дилбар шьёт женские одежды со всеми фасонами,  а также по запросу шьёт мужские одежды. Она очень любит свое дело и поэтому с удовольствием делает свое дело. С бизнесом она справляется сама. Она хочет развевать бизнес и поэтому она должна купить новую швейную машинку и тканей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 400 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки и тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей увеличить доход и таким образом улучшит условию проживания.
texts.en:
Dilbar is 24 years old. She is married and raising 2 children. Her husband is a simple labourer and earns a small salary. Several years ago, Dilbar, who is a very skilled seamstress, started her own business of sewing women's clothing. She makes all types and fashions of women's clothes, and can also make men's clothing to order. Dilbar loves her work and does it with pleasure. She runs her business on her own.

Dilbar would like to develop her business by buying a new sewing machine and fabrics. She is requesting a loan of US$400 to make these purchases and is counting on your kindness. This loan will help her increase her profits and thereby improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for sewing traditional dresses

loans.name: Mohbika

texts.ru:
Мохбика   женщина возрасте 38 лет.   Она замужем имеет троих детей на воспитании.   Она очень хорошая мать и трудолюбивая женщина.   Мохбика работает в одной из столовой своего села.  Она убирает,моет посуду, обслуживает клиентов.  У нее очень тяжелая работа, она очень устает но ей приходится работать не смотря ни на что. Ей надо кормить семью и поднимать детей. 
Мохбика давно хотела отремонтировать свой дом так как ее дом нуждается в обновлении.  У нее есть накопленные денежные средства но на покупку строительных материалов не хватает.  От знакомых она узнала что Арванд дает кредиты и она решила подать заявку. 
На полученный кредит Мохбика решила отремонтировать свой дом и купить строительные материалы.  Надеется ,что в Арванде ей помогут и поддержат в реализации ее планов.
texts.en:
Mohbika is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and has three children in her care. She is a very kind mother and a hard-working person. Mohbika works at one of her village's diners, where she cleans, washes dishes and serves customers. Her work is very hard and tiring, but Mohbika has no choice but to keep doing it as she needs to feed her family and raise her children.

For a long time, Mohbika has been hoping to carry out repairs in her home, which is in need of renovation. She has some savings, but not enough to purchase the necessary construction materials. After learning about loans from MDO Arvand, LLC from her acquaintances, Mohbika decided to apply for one. She will use this loan to buy building materials and repair her home. Mohbika hopes that Arvand will help her and support her in realizing her plans.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ubayda

texts.ru: Убайда женщина, которая имеет трудную судьбу. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Ей очень трудно справляться с обеспечением 4 детей, так как ее любимый муж умер и ей не на кого больше надеется. Она очень обрадовалась, когда услышала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она с удовольствием участвовала на этом курсе и получила много новой информации об организации бизнеса. Этот курс как свет проник в ее жизнь, так как теперь она имеет возможность организовать свой бизнес и найти свой источник дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она живет в отдаленном регионе, среди гор и поэтому ее местожительство имеет хорошее условие для скотоводства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ubayda is a woman with a difficult life. She is a widow and has 4 children, caring for whom has been tough since her husband's death, which left her with no support. Ubayda was elated to hear about the course "To Get Ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women. She enjoyed participating in the course and obtained plenty of new information about starting a business. This course was a ray of light in Ubayda life, as she now has an opportunity to launch her own business and find a new source of income.

Ubayda is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase livestock for her new business. She lives in a distant mountainous area, which offers good conditions for raising animals. Ubayda is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start her new business

loans.name: Margarita María

texts.es:
Margarita de 41 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de la confección en un pequeño taller ubicado en la sala de su casa, desde hace más de  15 años. 
Con esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo, gantizandole una educación de calidad y ha apoyado económicamente a sus padres. 
Su mayor sueño es poder iniciar con su propia línea de confección y sacar una producción de camisas para dama, las cuales comercializará en los diferentes establecimientos del sector. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de tela, hilos y agujas con lo que podrá comenzar a ejecutar su proyecto generando los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 41 years old. She has been designing and sewing clothes for more than fifteen years in a small workshop she has in her house’s living room. With this activity, Margarita has raised her son and guaranteed him a good education, and has supported her parents economically.

María’s biggest dream is to launch her own clothing brand and produce women shirts to sell in different stores around the area. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, threads and needles to give her project a start and generate the resources needed to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and needles.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 41 years old and has a retail shop business in the Nairobi Eastlands area. He is married to Elizabeth, who is also a businesswoman, and they have three children. He has been in this retail business for the last 10 years and it has been profitable.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil to sell. He expects to generate more profits that he will use to pay school fees for his children.

Onesmus hopes to expand his business and open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lolly

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Lolly works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Lolly is borrowing PHP 14,500 through NWTF to  re-stock her store with foods and household goods such as soft drinks, bread, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc. 

Lolly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with foods and household goods such as soft drinks, bread, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. She earns more income from buying and selling meat.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden has progressed from her previous loans. She increased her working capital, bought more maize, and she paid part of her children's school fees. She is now taking another loan to increase her business capital. She is happy for the support that Finance Sudan and Kiva is giving.

loans.use: To buy items like cow peas, beans, maize, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some structural changes and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Michael José

texts.es:
Michel a sus 20 años de edad es un gran visionario. Después de la muerte de su padre, este joven decidió comenzar a trabajar para ayudarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Inició laborando en un supermercado los fines de semana, alternándolo con sus estudios. 
Lo que mejor lo caracteriza es su orden y disciplina en todo lo que realiza, su empuje y ganas de salir adelante lo convierten en un ser prodigioso y admirable. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de ropa para comercializar en su localidad, a fin de mejorar su condición económica y garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
20-year-old Michael is a far-sighted young man.  Following the death of his father, Michael decided to start working so that he could help his mother with the household expenses.  He started out working at a supermarket on weekends, dividing his time between work and his studies.

Michael is noted for the order and discipline he demonstrates in everything he does.  His drive and desire to make progress in life make him an incredible and admirable young man.  

Michael is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying clothing to sell in his town so that he can improve his financial situation and guarantee his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: María Ester de 58 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía por encargo, comercializa principalmente ropa para hombre, pijamas, accesorios, lencería y productos de uso personal, esta actividad la aprendió con una amiga y desde entonces le ha permitido generar sus propios ingresos con los cuales suple sus necesidades básicas y apoya económicamente a sus padres. Con el propósito de incrementar las ventas, María se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos al por mayor para reducir costos y aumentar su margen de utilidad, con ello mejorará sus ingresos y calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Ester is fifty-eight years old.  She makes a living selling custom-made merchandise, mainly men's clothing, pajamas, accessories, lingerie, and personal use products.  She learned this business from a friend and, ever since, it has allowed her to generate her own income.  This income has covered costs for her basic necessities and has allowed her to economically support her parents.

With the goal of increasing her sales, María is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of products wholesale in order to reduce costs and increase her profit margin.  This will improve her income and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (accessories, clothing, shoes)

loans.name: Myriam Del Rocio

texts.es:
Myriam de 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. 
En búsqueda de generar recursos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Myriam inicio desde hace más de dos años con la venta por encargo de mercancía como zapatos, camisas, jeans y ropa interior. Con la buena acogida que tuvo por parte de sus clientes, optó por crear una tienda de ropas y aumentar sus ingresos.
Gracias a esta actividad la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar ha mejorado. Con el fin de seguir creciendo y posicionarse en el mercado local, se encuentra solicitado un crédito para la compra de mercancía que le permitirá tener buen surtido para el día de las madres, fecha en la que se elevan las ventas.
texts.en:
Myriam is forty-three years old, is married, and has two children.  

In search of generating resources in order to sustain her children and to help her husband with home expenses, Myriam began to sell shoes, shirts, jeans, and underwear that clients had ordered from her about two years ago.  With the good reception that she received from her customers, she decided to open a clothing store in order to increase her income.

Thanks to this activity, the quality of life of her immediate family has improved.  With the idea of continuing to grow and to position herself in the local market, she is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise.  This will allow her to have a good supply for Mother's Day; sales increase on this date.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, jeans, and underwear.

loans.name: Rovelita

texts.en:
Rovelita has two children and she provides their basic needs. She is doing her best so that she can perform her duties and responsibilities as a mother well. Rovelita is selling cooked foods for her menu, like adobo (marinade or sauce), mechado (marinated beef) and pinakbet (vegetable and pork dish). 

She wants to extend her business in order to gain income and sustain her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy meat to cook and ingredients for better taste. Rovelita believes that cooking more recipes will encourage more customers and bring her a higher income as well.

loans.use: to buy meat to cook and ingredients for better taste.

loans.name: Gervas

texts.en:
Gervas is 29 years old and married to Miriam, who helps in the retail shop, contributing to the family income. Gervas has been running his business for a period of about five years with an income of about 20,000 KES a month.

He is taking a third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He was able to realize profits and improve his business due to the loans he has been getting from KADET LTD . 

He wants to use the loan to buy an extra motorcycle. He hopes to have a stable family and educate his children to the highest level of education.

loans.use: to buy an extra motorcycle.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana, de 53 años de edad, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija  .El negocio que tiene Eliana es la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, en de diversos modelos, tallas y colores. Su mercadería es enviada cada cierto tiempo desde otra ciudad por medio de una persona intermediaria. Cuando tiene la cantidad de prendas necesarias los pone a la venta de manera ambulatoria a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. Realiza sola este negocio desde hace 10 años.Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener la tranquilad y estabilidad económica que necesita y viendo el buen resultado económico que tiene desea continuar desarrollando esta actividad y seguir su camino hacia el progreso.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de prendas de vestir como polos, pantalones, blusas, y camisas para venderlos en la temporada de verano , además está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliana, 53, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in a house they own. Eliana sells clothes for women, men and children. She offers different designs, sizes and colors. Her merchandise is sent from another city every once in a while, by an intermediary. When she has received enough, she sells them as a street vendor, to relatives and friends.

Eliana has had this business for ten years and works alone. She likes her job because it gives her the peace of mind and economic stability that she needs. Now, seeing the results, she wants to continue with this activity and follow the path to success. This time, she is requesting 2000 soles [PEN] to buy garments to sell during the summer season, such as t-shirts, pants, blouses and shirts. She feels happy knowing that she has financial support, which makes her feel confident about the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell, such as t-shirts, pants and blouses.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking a loan of $1,200 to improve her business.  She is running a food stall to help generate income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her food stall.  She opened her food stall in 2006 with her own working capital of $500.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Encarnacion engages in cooking and selling banana and camote cue (sweet potatoes) in her community in order to generate income.  She is 58 years old and is now widowed.  She lives with one of her children in a rural community.  She aims to continue improving the business but she has inadequate capital.  For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of 5,000 PHP to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, oils, sugar, sticks, plastics, and charcoal.  These items are needed to prepare and cook the banana and camote cue.  She is hoping that this financial assistance will be of great help toward improving the business.

loans.use: to buy banana, sweet potatoes, oils, sugar, sticks, plastics and charcoal.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Victorine est une femme de 49 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 15 et 30 ans.  L'un d'eux va encore à l'école. Elle aussi 4 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Victorine is a 49-year old woman. She is married and the mother of 5 children aged between 15 and 30 years old. One of them still goes to school. She is also responsible for 4 other people. She has been running a restaurant for several years and it is thanks to this business that she is able to take care of her family. Having to buy food for her business at retail prices does not allow her to make much profit - this loan is therefore important to her business as it will enable her to increase her inventory of groceries; bags of groundnuts, 1 bag of rice, a pallet of fish, meats, raw vegetables and other ingredients that she needs to prepare her meals. This will help her avoid having to make daily journeys and will decrease her taxi expenses, which will also increase her profits. She plans to reinvest part of her profits into her business, and the other part will help her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food items.

loans.name: Eric

texts.fr: Eric est une homme de 31 ans fiancé père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 11 mois et 02 ans. Il a ouvert un restaurant qu'il gère depuis des années. c'est grâce à lui qu'il s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéoles d'oeufs,huile, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Il réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Eric is a 31-year-old man. He is engaged and the father of 3 children aged between 2 years and 11 months. He has been running a restaurant business for several years and is it thanks to his business that he is able to take care of his family. Having to buy his ingredients at retail prices does not allow him to make much profit. This is why this loan is important to his business; it will allow him to increase his stock of groceries - trays of eggs, oil, a bag of rice, a pallet of fish, meats, raw vegetables and the ingredients he needs to make his meals. He plans to reinvest part of his profits in his business and use the other part to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of food items.

loans.name: Jaba

texts.en:
Jaba is 26 years old. He lives in the village of Kokhi in the Kobuleti district with his 22-year-old sister and retired parents. 

Jaba requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a plot of agricultural land. They milk the cow to make dairy products. On the land mandarin and nut trees are grown. Harvested products with the dairy products are sold locally at the markets. The family total income is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Jaba requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.
