He is so anxious to make a family of his own and, at the same time, he will make sure that they will have the best standard of living possible.
He hopes to keep on expanding and developing his business toward opening a bigger factory in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials for his furniture business

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Maria de 58 años de edad se dedica a vender pupusas en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, vende por las mañanas y por las noches tiene mucha clientela ya que es muy amable y vende sus pupusas a un buen precio, vive con su esposo, su hijo y un nieto, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo han logrado salir adelante en los gastos del hogar, Doña Maria quiere mejorar su negocio pero no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder hacerlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar lo necesario como: maiz, frijoles, chicharron, quesillo, y todo lo que se ocupa para la elaboracion de las pupusas para poder seguir trabajando y tener satisfechos siempre a sus clientes y asi pueda tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran en los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar.
texts.en:
María, 58, has been working selling pupusas [grilled, filled corn cakes] at home for the last five years; she sells during the morning and at night has many customers because she’s very kind and sells the pupusas at a good price.  She lives with her husband, son and a grandson.  With the profits she earns she helps her husband and her son.  They’ve managed to handle household expenses.

María wants to improve her business but does not have sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking for a loan to be able to buy what she needs like corn, beans, fried pork, string cheese and everything else needed to make pupusas so that she can stay in business and always keep her customers satisfied thus being able to earn higher profits that will help with any household expenses that might arise.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Om-Dlal Group

texts.en:
Om-Dlal is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Dhamar, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Naem is a 35-year-old married woman and has 5 children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to buy construction supplies to use in her small house, but she suffers from a lack of money. So she is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use in her small house.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is 35 years old and she is married with four children who are in school. They all live in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia since it is the capital city of Liberia. She is a high school graduate. For five years she has been involved in the sale of shoes. Most interestingly, she has many customers because she sells quality products. She started her business with a loan from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends.

She spends eight hours a day on her business. Because the location of her shop is a bit far from her house, one of the problems she faces is vehicle traffic. Sometimes she is late in getting her shop open. She is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes (footwear) to expand her business. She plans to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes (footwear) to expand her business.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: La Señora Xiomara es responsable de una escuela publica donde asisten niños de 3 a 6 años denominados preescolares, desde hace mas de 17 años, es su segundo crédito que tiene con ceprodel y lo utilizara para compra de: materiales de construcción: zinc, ladrillos, cementos y otros materiales para realizar mejora en su casa de habitación lo cual la beneficiaria con mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
For the past 17 years, Xiomara has been the head of a public school for children 3 to 6 years old, that is, preschoolers.  

This is her second loan with CEPRODEL, and she will use it to purchase:  construction materials:  metal roofing, bricks, cement and other materials to make improvements to her home, which will provide better living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing, bricks, cement and other materials.

loans.name: Hever

texts.es:
Hever es casado y tiene una hija de 3 meses, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Las Nieves de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la recolección (compra) de material reciclable como ser: papel, periódicos, latas de cerveza, cobre, libros que la gente ya no utiliza, etc., para su venta a las fábricas que usan estos materiales.
El crédito lo requiere para  el aumento de capital; así adquirirá cobre y otros objetos de metal.
El sueño de Hever  es tener una cadena de sitios de acopio de material reciclable. De esta manera incrementará sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Hever is married and has a three-month-old daughter. They live in his parents home, which is located in the Villa Las Nieves area of the city of La Paz.

He completed a secondary level education and currently works collecting (purchasing) recyclable materials like paper, newspapers, beer cans, copper, books that people no longer use, etc. He sells them to the factories that use these materials.

He is requesting this loan to increase capital; he will acquire copper and other metal objects. Hever' dream is to own a chain of recyclable material collection sites. This will allow his income to increase. 

This is the first time he is requesting a loan through IMPRO and his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of recyclable materials to sell to the factories that use them.

loans.name: Naomi W.

texts.en:
Naomi is 33 years old. She is married, with two children who are in school and are between 5 and 12 years old. They all live in Montserrado County which is noted as the commercial city in Liberia. 

Naomi is a high school graduate. For two years now, she has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes, such as blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses. Most interestingly, she has many customers since she sells quality products. She started her business with a loan from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends 12 hours on her business since her house is closer to her shop. One of the problems she faces is transportation costs. 

Naomi is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses) to increase her sales. She plans to open another shop in the near future and to see her children out of college.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans trouser, dresses) to increase her sales.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 33-year-old from Gaza. She is married and has 8 children, five of whom go to school. She owns a shop for selling perfumes, accessories and women's clothing.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods and shelves for the store she owns. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her family's income and thus provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy goods and shelves for the store she owns.

loans.name: Finanfa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  FINANFA est formé de deux personnes qui  sont des cohabitantes. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Rosaline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Rosaline est âgée de 30 ans, est  mariée à un certain Dohou. Le couple a deux enfants,dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges du foyer. Rosaline n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a vingt ans que Rosaline exerce comme activité, la vente des plateaux d’œufs et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Rosaline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Rosaline désire acheter des plateaux d’œufs et du charbon de bois pour renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Rosaline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FINANFA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group FINANFA comprises two persons who live together. The group's representative, Rosaline, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 30 years old and married to a man named Dohou. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school; both are in their care. The couple live together and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Rosaline did not attend school. For twenty years, she has had a business selling trays of eggs and charcoal out of her home. This enables her to respond to family needs without much difficulty. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Concerned about responding better to the requirements of her customers, Rosaline would like to purchase trays of eggs and some charcoal to bolster her business. To do so, she and the other members of the group FINANFA are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and some charcoal

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 68 years old, married, and has one adult child. He is retired and lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi. Robert requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family's main source of income is Robert’s and his wife Salome’s monthly pensions. In addition, they have a commercial space, which is rented out as a grocery shop and they receive a small monthly payment. Total income of the family is so small that it is not enough to cover their monthly expenses, including food. 

Robert's loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit, being regarded as “high risk borrowers.” With the loan, Robert will purchase grocery stocks. He wants to stop renting his commercial space and use it to open a grocery shop himself. This business will be profitable as the shop is already well known by locals. He plans on reinvesting the profit and purchasing more varieties of products to attract more customers, which will significantly increase the income of the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock and open a grocery shop

loans.name: Susana Manoela

texts.es: Susana de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 13 años ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa  donde vende ropa para damas, ropa para niños y caballeros, sabanas, cubrecamas, entre otras cosas (asi como lo muestra la foto) desde hace 7 años y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias y con eso ha podido salir adelante con su hijo y a solventado los gastos que se le presentan, esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susana, 36, lives in her own home with her 13 year-old child.  She has a business selling clothing.  She's been selling clothing for men, women and children, bed sheets, bedspreads, and other items (as is shown in the photo) for 7 years.  This has given her sales experience, which enables her to obtain the best earnings.  With this business, she has been able to get ahead with her child and cover the expenses that occur.  

Susana's business is located in her home, and is well-known by the neighbors in the area.  She has gained a lot of customers.  She wants to grow the business and to make a new investment, but she needs capital.  This is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy the products she needs for her store.  This way, she will obtain the best earnings so that she can give her child a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in furniture-making and selling flowers for eight years. He is employed in both businesses to make sure that his income is good enough to cover his expenses and his family's, too, at the same time.

He believes that he is creative enough to succeed in his own business, but he has a financial problem that was stopping him from making his dream come true. Therefore, Alaa is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to start a small business of his own for additional income. He is often asked to do the flower decorations for weddings, and he is planning to expand this business to open a wedding planning company in the future.

loans.use: to start his own business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
For the past several years Sharon has operated an ice block selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Apart from that she runs a business of water distribution. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase water pipes for installing another water access point. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she thanks Kiva for their kind help.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for installing another water access point.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children and only four of her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream, relaxers, braids, hair oils and a hair dryer. She generates additional income from selling maize flour and soda. 

She works in her shop six days out of every week. Her major business challenges includes transportation, seasonality and on-and-off electricity. She is wanting to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to continue building more rental rooms. She resides in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream, relaxers, braids, hair oils and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es: La Señora Jessenia es una persona muy responsable y muy trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. ella necesita comprar materiales para cambiar y mejorar la instalación eléctrica de su casa, por lo que solicita un préstamo de setecientos cincuenta mil colones (750.000). con esto pretende prevenir un incendio en el futuro ya que actualmente se encuentra en muy malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Jessenia is a very responsible and hardworking person.  She lives with her husband and two children.

She needs to buy materials to change and improve the electricity in her house, so she's requesting a loan for 750,000 colones [CRC].  She hopes to prevent a fire in the future because currently the electricity's in very bad condition.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the electricity in her house

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 22-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is an employee getting a low salary. With great effort he collected money to start up a grocery store. He is the only breadwinner providing for his family. 

He applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery products to complete stocking his business. He hopes with this loan to increase the profit from his business, which will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to complete stocking his business.

loans.name: Sountong Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETA est responsable du groupe SOUNTONG NOOMA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école (maternelle) et elle a 07personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des céréales et  est parallèlement tisseuse depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Nassira.
 Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs d’arachides et 01 sac d’haricot.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle souhaite pouvoir stocker plus de céréales (devenir grossiste). Scolariser ses enfants et s’occuper de leur avenir.
texts.en:
Ms. ASSETA is the official of the group SOUNTONG NOOMA.  She is the married mother of two children. The oldest is 4 years old, the youngest is 2, and one of them goes to school (nursery). She has seven persons to support. 

Ms. ASSETA has been selling grains for five years and also fabrics concurrently. She gets her supplies in Nassira. Her customers include both men and women. 

She wants to purchase 10 sacks of peanuts and a sack of beans. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. She would like to be able to stock more grains (to become a wholesaler), educate her children, and take care of their future.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and beans

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 58-year-old widow and the mother of three children, whom she is taking care of since her husband passed away. She is a Syrian living in Lebanon since she got married years ago. She has operated a convenience store since 2007, and it is her only source of income. She is well known in her region with her good reputation and the hard work she does in order to please her customers and fulfill her family's needs and desires.

She is applying for her first cycle loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer offers. She is very certain that this loan will have a very positive impact on her family and business, because it will help her increase both capital and income at the same time.

She hopes to stay in good health to provide her family with a good living and to make sure that she will not need others' help as she becomes old through the coming years.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer offers.

loans.name: Malgre 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme  HAOUA représente le groupe  MALGRE 2. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 03 vont à l’école.
Elle vend du savon depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter  03 cartons de savons.
Avec ses bénéfices, Elle veut aider à la scolarisation des enfants  et réinvestir dans son commerce. Mme  ambitionne fabriquer elle-même son savon.
texts.en:
Ms. HAOUA represents the group MALGRE 2.  She is the married mother of four children. The oldest is 18, and the youngest is 6, and three go to school. Ms. HAOUA has been selling soaps for five years. She gets her supplies from the stores in her district. Her customers include both men and women. 

Ms. HAOUA wants to purchase 3 boxes of soaps. With the profits, she wants to help educate her children and reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to make her own soaps.

loans.use: to purchase soaps

loans.name: Jose Napoleon

texts.es:
JOSE tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siemra de fréjol, maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado de raza.

Con la ayuda del crédiot podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es terminar los estudios y tener una carrera profesional, mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta el deporte en especial el boly, indor y disfrutar de las festividades del Carnaval.
texts.en:
Jose, 22, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province.

The communal bank "Virgen de Banos" was formed in the community of Mama Sara de Cerritos, about 30 minutes from the office of the COOPERATIVA.

Jose is a farmer who cultivates beans and corn.  He also raises cattle.  He is requesting to a loan to buy a breed of cattle.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy cattle.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes.

Jose's dream is to finish his education and get a professional degree so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

In his free time he enjoys sports, especially volleyball and street soccer.  He also enjoys the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 55-year-old widow who works for her own living, with no one to help her in her living.

She has worked as a tailor for 26 years. She is very talented in her domain and has customers' trust and support.

Zahra is looking forward to adding new products to her business. She wants to buy blankets and towels, to make special tailoring and sewing designs on them, and then sell them with new designs that will attract customers' attention. 

That's why she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development. It will be her twelfth loan cycle for improving her business.

Her previous loans helped her a lot in expanding her business and developing it. At the same time, she was a borrower in good-standing. Zahra hopes to keep on replying to customers' needs and developing her business.

loans.use: to add new products to her tailoring business.

loans.name: Eulalia Graciela

texts.es:
La clienta  vive en Guayaquil. Siempre le gusto el arte de la belleza y se puso un salón de belleza en su casa. Ella trabaja sola, abre temprano y cierra a las 21h00 de la noche.

Su negocio es la peluquería  donde tiene tintes, accesorios,  esmaltes, etc. su dificultas  es el ruido ya que vive en la perimetral  y por la cantidad de ladrones q hay por el sector  donde ella vive.La clienta es soltera tiene una hija y estudia en colegio fiscal. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprarse una computadora para los estudios de su hija que esta estudiando en una Escuela Fiscal. Su sueño es que su hija se gradué.
texts.en: She lives in Guayaquil.  She’s always liked the art of beauty and she set up a beauty salon at home.  She works alone opening early and closing at nine at night.  Her business is barbering; she has hair dyes, accessories, nail polish, etc.  Her difficulty is noise because she lives alongside the beltway and also the number of robbers that are in the area where she lives.  She’s single and has a daughter attending public school.  She wants to use the loan to buy a computer for her daughter who attends public school.  Her dream is that her daughter graduates.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Soureya

texts.fr: Soureya vit avec son mari et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 21 et 17ans et vont à l’école. Soureya quant à elle est âgée de 38ans et revend des mais et des charbons de bois. Démarré en 2006, elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et des les villes de l’intérieur. Afin d’acheter plus de marchandises, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour revendre à ses clients. A l’avenir, elle désire devenir grossiste et contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Soureya lives with her husband and their children. They are 21 and 17 years old, and they go to school. As for Soureya, she is 38 years old and sells corn and charcoal. Starting off in 2006, she got her supplies from Lomé, the capital of Togo, and from inland cities. To purchase more merchandise, she is requesting her first loan to make sales to her customers. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler and help meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn and some charcoal

loans.name: Jacinta Flor

texts.es:
La clienta  vive en Guayaquil. Desde joven comenzó con una maquina de coser y ahora ella ya tiene su taller de confeccion, en la actualidad ella trabaja con su hija y su nuera. 

Ella tiene un taller de costura donde hace ropa para mujeres y hombres con tela, hilos, encajes etc. Su dificulta en su negocio son los ladrones que hay en el sector donde ella vive.

Ella es soltera, tiene un hijo, con el préstamo esoclar quiere comprar una computadora para su nieto. su sueño mejorar su negocio con mas clientes.
texts.en: She lives in Guayaquil.  Since she was young she started with a sewing machine and now she has a sewing workshop.  At present, she works with her daughter and daughter-in-law.  She has a sewing workshop where she makes clothes for women and men with fabric, thread, lace, etc.  Her business difficulty is robbers in the sector where she lives.  She’s single and has a son.  She wants to use the school loan to buy a computer for her grandson.  Her greatest dream is to improve her business with more customers.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 seul scolarisé, Adjo couturière de profession exerce cette activité depuis l’an 2000. Elle ouvert un atelier dans lequel il répond aux besoins des clients. Son premier crédit lui servira de s’approvisionner en marchandises (tissus et pagnes servant à coudre les habits). Elle espère à l’avenir  créer une boutique de vente des produits de mercerie et aménager sa maison.
texts.en: A widow and mother of three children, of whom one is in school, Adjo is a clothier by profession and has been in this business since 2000. She has opened a workshop where she serves her customers. Her first loan will be used to stock up on fabrics and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for making clothing. In the future, she hopes to establish a shop selling sewing supplies and to fix up her house.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to sew clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase nail polish, gloss, and a table.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Абдукариму 55 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей, две дочери, две невестки и два внука. Абдукарим со своей большой семьей проживает в городе Куляб на юге Таджикистана. Вот уже 10 лет как Абдукарим занимается животноводством. Он закупает коров и телят со скотного рынка своей деревни и близлежащих деревень, откармливает в течение месяца и затем продает с наценкой в тех же рынках. Абдукарим хочет увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для закупа и перепродажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdukarim is 55 years old, married. He has three sons, two daughters, two daughters-in-law and two grandchildren. Abdukarim lives with his large family in Kulob in South Tajikistan. For the last 10 years he has been raising cattle. He buys cows with calves at the livestock market of his village, then feeds them for a month and sells at the same market with a profit. Abdukarim wants to increase the size of his herd and he is requesting this loan to purchase more animals.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: La Sra. Karina tiene 30 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la localidad de El Torno, este préstamo es su  segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Karina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, La Sra. Karina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Karina se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina is thirty years old and works selling clothing according to the season. She has a stand located in the town of El Torno.

This is her second cycle with our institution. Karina will use this loan to purchase wholesale clothing like sweaters and jackets to stock her business. The reason why she is requesting this loan is a lack of capital. The challenges Karina faces in her business are daily competition. She will use her profit to continue improving her stand. 

She wants her business to have assorted merchandise so that she can offer her customers a variety of products. Karina is happy with our institution and appreciates the support being offered, because it allows her to advance her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing like sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is a 34-year-old, married man, with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For one and a half years, he has been a teacher and he also practices agriculture. 

He was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people and is so proud of his profession. He is determined to change his future and that of his children through education and his goal is to become a principal, after upgrading. 

Shem intends to use the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Fayiah

texts.en:
Fayiah is 45 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia, since it is the capital city. He is married, with five children, ages 3, 11, 21, 23,  and 27. 

Fayiah graduated from a school of medicine. For the past five years, he has been operating a drug store. Fayiah started this business with assistance from his friends and learned this way of selling from his friends. He enjoys his business because it helps him to save and have money for others to spend. 

Fayiah is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory (e.g., paracetamol, blood tonic, cough syrup, quinine) for his business. In the near future, he wants to expand his business into a clinic.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory (e.g., paracetamol, blood tonic, cough syrup, quinine) for his pharmacy business.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият 46 лет. Она разведена и имеет 2 детей. Она сама обеспечивает детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Хосият более 2 года занимается купле продажей продуктов питания в продовольственном магазине. Она живет в сельской местности далеко от города. Она один раз месяц ездит в центр области покупает товар и реализует этот товар на своем магазине. Ее клиенты довольны ее товарами, так как она продает высококачественные товары. Хосият хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Она должна купить дополнительный товар, но не имеет денег, так как она тратит все свои деньги для содержания детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки продуктов питания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khosiyat is 46 years old, divorced and has two children. She provides for her children on her own. Khosiya has been managing a grocery store for two years. She lives in a remote village far from the city. Once a month Khosiyat travels to the regional center to buy bulk groceries and sells them in her store. Her clients like her store as she always sells high quality items. Khosiyat wants to increase the amount of working capital she has on hand. She wants to purchase additional inventory but has not savings, as she spends all income from her business to take care of her children. She is requesting a loan of 1500 US dollars to purchase bulk groceries. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy bulk groceries and increasing working capital

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso tiene 64  años de edad, está casado, el cuenta que tiene una Despensa y carnicería en su casa de la ciudad de Encarnación.
El cuenta que se dedica al rubro hace mas de 20 años  y que  le va muy bien, tiene una importante clientela formada. Además es jubilado ferroviario  tiene un ingreso fijo mensualmente.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante y crecer como persona y como microempresario. El quiere poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana poder ampliar su negocio.
Celso solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, verduras, frutas, y también para reparar  una heladera que usa en su negocio.
texts.en:
Celso, 64, is married.  He has a store and butcher shop in his house in the city of Encarnación.  He says he has worked in the field for more than 20 years and it's going very well for him.  He has a valued established clientele.  He's also a retired railroad worker with a fixed monthly income.

He's a very hardworking person who makes an effort to get ahead and grow as a person and a micro-entrepreneur.  He wants to be able to continue growing and expand his business in the future.

Celso's requesting the loan to buy supplies for his store such as groceries, beverages, vegetables, and fruits, and also to repair a cooler he uses in the business.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages and to repair a cooler

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло 20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Шахло является студенткой 3 курса Педагогического Института. Она учится в заочное отделение. Шахло более 2 года работает в средней школе учительницей. Она преподает историю. Шахло очень умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ее коллеги знают ее как добросовестную, а ее ученики как умную учительницу. Ее родители очень гордятся ею. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для оплаты учебы в институте. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahlo is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. Shahlo is a junior Education major and attends the evening classes as she also works as a school teacher. She has been teaching history for the last two years. Shahlo is smart and hard working woman. Her colleagues know her as a conscientious person and her students love such a smart teacher. Her parents are proud of her. Shahlo is requesting a loan of 500 somoni to pay her college tuition. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her college tuition

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru: Вера добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1960 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации, так как он на родине не имел постоянное место работы. Вера окончила Металлургический Колледж. Она более 20 лет работает в металлургическом заводе контролером. Она очень добросовестно выполняет свою работу. Ее сын уехал в Россию вместе с отцом и работает там. Ее дочь является студенткой в университете. Вера должна оплатить за учебу дочери в университете, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомон. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Vera is a kind and hard working woman. She was born in 1960, and is now married and raising two children. Her husband is a migratory worker in Russia, as in Tajikistan he cannot find steady work. Vera received her bachelor's degree in Metal Processing and has been working as a controller at a metal factory for 20 years. She is a very responsible worker. Vera's son is now working in Russia together with his father, but Vera's daughter is a college student. Vera needs to pay for her daughter's education but has no savings. She is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education

loans.name: Tozagul

texts.ru: Тозагул 35-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее четверо детей. Она проживает в районе Кубадиян, на юго-западе Таджикистана. Ее муж в данный момент находится на заработках за пределами страны. Тозагул занимается растениеводством в течение 15 лет. У нее имеется земельный участок, где она выращивает пшеницу и арбуз. Кредит берет для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая арбуза.
texts.en: Tozagul is a 35 year old woman who is raising four children. She lives in Qubadiyon in south-western Tajikistan. Her husband is a migrant worker who lives abroad. Tozagul herself has been farming for 15 years. She has a plot of land where she grows wheat and water melons. She is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer for planting watermelons.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for growing watermelons

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафрузу 35 лет. Она разведена и имеет 1 сына. Его сына зовут Набичон и ему 13 лет. Дилафруз работает в местной больнице уборщицей более 8 лет и получает маленькую зарплату. Дилафруз и Набичон живут бедно.  Уже несколько лет как Дилафруз хочет отремонтировать дом, так как ее дом имеет очень плохое состояние. Дилафруз несколько лет накопила деньги, но это очень мало. Она хочет отремонтировать все комнаты. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для проведения ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilafruz is 35 years old, divorced and has one son. Her son's name is Nabijon and he is 13 years old. Dilafruz has worked as a cleaning lady in the local hospital for 8 years and earns a tiny salary. Dilafruz and Nabijon are poor. For the last few years she has been delaying repairing her home which is in bad condition. She has been saving money but her savings are not enough to pay for repairs. She needs to fix all her rooms. Dilafruz is requesting a loan of 1500 somoni to purchase building materials to improve her home. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Ave Maria Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVE MARIA est formé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Clarisse Rose, âgé 34 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Clarisse Rose, est mariée à un certain Marius. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Clarisse Rose et Marius vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Clarisse Rose n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Clarisse Rose vend des divers (sardine, sucre, lait) et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Clarisse Rose exerce cette activité depuis dix huit ans ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Clarisse Rose désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Clarisse Rose sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AVE MARIA, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The AVE MARIA group has two members, who are friends. The group representative, Clarisse Rose, is 34 years old and can be seen holding up her hand in the photo. 

Clarisse Rose is married to a man named Marius and the couple have three children. Some of the children are in school, and all of them are still dependent on their parents. Clarisse Rose and Marius live together with their children and share the various household costs. 

Clarisse Rose did not attend school. She sells various food supplies (sardines, sugar, milk) and charcoal from home. She has been running this business for 18 years and it enables her to provide for her family without too much difficulty. 

In order to better respond to customer demand, Clarisse Rose wishes to strengthen her business. In order to do this, Clarisse Rose is requesting a second loan from Alidé along with the other member of the AVE MARIA group.

loans.use: to buy various food supplies (sardines, sugar, milk) and charcoal.

loans.name: Mahugnon As Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON AS est formé de dix personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Annick, âgée de 41 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Annick est mariée à François, un cuisinier. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Annick et François vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Annick n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de vingt ans que Annick exerce comme activité, la vente de nourriture "come"(pâte faite à base de maïs fermenté ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Annick désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Annick sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO AS, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUGNON AS group is made up of ten people who live in the same neighbourhood. The group leader, Annick, is 41 years old and is shown holding up her hand in the photo. 

Annick is married to François, who is a cook. The couple have four children. Some of the children are in school, and all of them are still dependent on their parents. Annick and François live together with their children and both of them work to pay their various household costs. 

Annick did not go to school. For almost 20 years, Annick has been running a business selling “come”, a dough produced using fermented maize. This enables her to provide for her family without any great difficulty. 

In order to better meet customer demand, Annick wishes to improve her business. In order to do this, she has requested a fifth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the MAHUDJRO AS group. The previous loans have all been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy condiments and maize.

loans.name: Mariela Mercedes

texts.es:
MARIELA tiene 20 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

Mariela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de fréjol, maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado  y cerdos. solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos para las siembras, herbicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras lo realizará en Chillanes.
El sueño es terminar los estudios. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, ecuchar música.
texts.en:
Mariela is 20 years old and single, with no children, and she lives with her parents in Chillanes, a province of Bolívar.

The communal bank "Virgen de Baños" was formed in the community of Mama Sara de Cerritos, about 30 minutes away from the Cooperative's office.

Mariela works in agriculture and grows corn and beans and also raises cattle and pigs.  She would like this loan to buy seeds, compost for her plantings, and herbicides.

With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for her farming.  She will make her purchases in Chillanes.  Her dream is to finish her studies.  In her free time, she likes to watch television and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, composts for planting, and herbicides.

loans.name: Neysi

texts.es: Neysi, de 50 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 12 años respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Neysi, consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal por catálogo, tiene un espacio de exhibición en su casa en donde llegan sus clientes en busca de perfumes, talcos, cremas o algún accesorio de utilidad. Lleva en ésta actividad un promedio de 4 años, trabaja sola y gana muy bien. Le gusta lo que hace Y mantiene estable sus ganancias con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, está muy contenta por la independencia que tiene y porque puede generar ella misma sus propios ingresos para solventar los gastos necesarios en su hogar, espera seguir trabajando y expandir su negocio para continuar progresando ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de acceder a una educación de calidad a través de una carrera profesional.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500,  por lo cual agradece a quienes hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado comprará perfumes, talcos, cremas de piel, aretes, cosméticos, acondicionadores y otros productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Neysi is 50 years old, married, and has two children, whose ages are 12 and 18, respectively, and who live together with her at home.  Her work consists of sales of cosmetics and personal care products by catalog.  She has an exhibit space set up in her house where her customers come to look for perfumes, powders, creams, or other useful accessories.  She has been working in this line of business for the past 4 years, and she works alone and makes a good living.  

She likes her work and keeps a steady income through the customer base that she has established over the years.  She is very grateful for the independence that this gives her and that she is able to use her own income to cover the costs of the household.  She hopes to continue working and expand her business to continue with her advancement, since she would like to give her children access to a quality education and a college degree.  

At this time, she is seeking a loan of 1,500 Soles, for which she thanks the lenders who make this financing possible in order to further her business goals.  With the loan, she will buy perfumes, powders, skin creams, earrings, cosmetics, conditioners, and other products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty creams, perfumes, and more.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда живет в районе Рудаки. Рудаки является одним из центральных районов столицы Таджикистана. Махсуде 20 лет, она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж работает за рубежом. Махсуда имеет среднее образование. Она очень деятельная женщина. Махсуда швея, она занимается вышиванием женской национальной одежды у себя дома. Махсуда уже 3 года как занята в этой сфере деятельности. Она запрашивает кредит для покупки материалов для шитья женских платьев на продажу. Засчет полученной выручки Махсуда намерена расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Makhsuda lives in Rudaki region. Rudaki is one of the central regions in Tajikistan, near the capital. Makhsuda is 20 years old, married and has one child. Her husband works abroad. Makhsuda has a high school diploma and is a very business oriented woman. She is a seamstress and makes Tajik national dresses for women in her home. She has had her sewing studio for three years now. Makhsuda is requesting this loan to purchase a batch of fabric for making dresses. She is hoping to use the profits from this venture to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for sewing dresse

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловару 33 года. У него жена и двое детей. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Кубадиян в южной части Таджикистана. Диловар занимается растениеводством уже 5 лет. Он на собственной и арендованной земле выращивает пшеницу и бахчевую культуру. Ему помогает жена. Диловар запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая арбуза. Летом он хочет собрать богатый урожай арбуза и за счет его продажи получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Dilovar is 33 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his family in Qubadiyon region in southern Tajikistan. Dilovar has been farming for five years. He owns a plot of land as well as rents additional land to grow wheat and melons. His wife helps him on the farm. Dilovar requests a loan to purchase fertilizer for planting watermelons. He is planning to have a big harvest in summer and make a nice profit from watermelons.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for planting watermelons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, bricks, zinc roofing, support beams, and other materials.

loans.name: Nawal Group

texts.en:
The Nawal Group consists of four women who live in Aden, Yemen. They are working hard to improve their living conditions. Nawal is 50 years old, married, and has eight children most of whom are adults. Her house is very old and in miserable condition. She has accumulated some money to buy furniture for her house.  

Nawal is requesting a loan from AMB for 60,000 YER, which she will use to purchase furniture to use for her house. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Aganatia

texts.en:
Aganatia is 39 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. He has been operating a retail shop for seven years and also sells clothes. He started with 800,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings as working capital. 

Aganatia is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy clothes to sell. His hardship are high fuel and transport costs. His personal goal is educating his children while his business goal is expanding his business into a new market.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Gabriel y su esposa la señora Idalia son originarios de estado de Durango tienen ya viviendo en esta ciudad de Nuevo Laredo mas de 20 años , el señor Juan Gabriel trabaja para un empres de trasportes como mecánico y la señora Idalia realiza trabajos de limpieza  en casa particulares.  Tienen una hija de 11 años quien esta estudiando la primaria.
Están solicitando un crédito KIVA para realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda ya que le esta haciendo falta las escaleras que conectara a la planta alta de su vivienda donde tiene construido el cuarto de su hija, también desea realizarle algunos acabados al exterior de la vivienda ya que le esta haciendo falta la pintarla.
Con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo es para pagar el crédito y que su esposa con el ingreso que obtiene de sus trabajos será para los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desea mejor el patrimonio de su familia y ya que su hija esta creciendo necesita su propio espacio en la casa.
texts.en:
Juan Gabriel and his wife, Idalia, are from the state of Durango and have been living in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 20 years.  Juan Gabriel works for a transportation firm as a mechanic, and Idalia works cleaning houses.  They have a daughter who is 11 years old and studies in primary school.

They are asking for a loan from Kiva in order to make improvements to their house, since there are not yet any stairs which would connect the upper level of his house, where Juan has built a room for his daughter.  He also wants to do some finish work on the outside of his home, which he has started, but still needs to finish painting.

With the money he receives from his job, he can repay the loan, and his wife's income from her jobs will serve to cover the family's daily living expenses and schooling fees.  He wants a better place for his family and now that his daughter is growing up, she needs her own space in the house.

loans.use: to construct stairs and finish the exterior of his home.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is 32 years old from Gaza. He is married and has 2 children. He has owned a shop for selling and making perfumes since 2010. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a display Vatrina (showcase), an air conditioner and to install some shelves in his perfumery shop. He hopes that this loan will improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a display Vatrina (showcase), an air conditioner and to install some shelves in his perfumery shop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married and has five children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and sells bananas. His clients are mostly people living in urban areas. 

Patrick is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy general merchandise such as maize, cassava, sugar, and soap to sell. He hopes to build a permanent house and buy a car but he faces the challenge of limited capital.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as maize, cassava, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 27-year-old married man with one child. He has completed secondary school.  He is very hardworking and is doing his best to earn money. However, he is unable to buy some furniture and home appliances for his house because what he earns is hardly enough to cover his family's daily expenses. 

He decided to apply for a 150,000 YER loan to buy some furniture for his house. He hopes that his life conditions will improve and that he will find capital to buy and sell products.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for his house.

loans.name: Evaketi

texts.en:
Evaketi, a 50-year-old married mother of eight children, seven of whom attend school, is a cocoa farmer and also has a retail shop where she works eight hours a day. Good mother that she is, Evaketi desires to educate her children up to the university level and so set up sustainable income-generating activities for their well-being.

Evaketi has requested this loan to buy rice, sugar and salt to sell. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital pose challenges to her business growth, while her dream is to trade in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es: Arnulfo de 54 años de edad,  habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su esposa y sus dos hijos, en las edades de 15 y 16 años. Él tiene un taller de electrodomésticos, ubicado en su domicilio,  donde hace mantenimiento preventivo y repara electrodomésticos menores, como  licuadoras, planchas, estufas, abanicos, licuadoras y radios.   Desde hace 12 años data su experiencia, con la cual ha ganado una importante clientela, principalmente entre sus vecinos del sector. Su meta es tener un local más amplio, mas adelante expandir su negocio y ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos, para que en un futuro tengan el potencial de   exitosa con el que él y su esposa sueñan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bujes, bobinas, ejes y soldadura en mayor volumen, para utilizarlo como insumos en su taller y venderlos a su clientela cuando estos lo requieran,  porque su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo, para hacer sus compras y esto es o que logrará con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Arnulfo, 54, lives in the southwestern part of the city with his wife and two children, ages 15 and 16.

He has an appliance shop in his house where he does preventive maintenance and repairs small appliances such as blenders, irons, stoves, fans, and radios.  He has 12 years of experience with which he has earned valued customers, mainly among his neighbors in the area.

His goals for the future are to have a bigger locale, expand his business, and give his children a quality education so they have the potential for success of which he and his wife dream.

Currently he's applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He'll use it to buy axle boxes, coils, shafts, and solder in bulk to use as supplies in his workshop and sell to his customers when they need it.

His biggest challenge is having enough working capital to make his purchases, and this is what he'll achieve with his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy axle boxes, coils, shafts, and solder

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
Rauf is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and now lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. He is 40 years old, married, and has two daughters, a 10-year-old and a 16-year-old. Rauf's daughters go to school. He wants his daughters to become teachers of history and geography. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Rauf started his business 7 years ago, to raise cattle and to sell milk. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy calves to increase the amount of dairy products he will have to sell at local bazaars. He wants to use the money from his new business to help his family and to provide a good future for his children. In the future, Rauf wants to have a big farm for calves. This will be a more profitable business. Rauf is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en:
Dishon is a 72-year-old farmer, married to Waithera and the father of three grown up children. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past fifteen years with a monthly income of about KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. Dishon is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET customer. 

He will use the loan to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings and animal feeds. He will use the anticipated profits to renovate his house. His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings and animal feeds.

loans.name: Pororo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Pororo está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual ayuda a las mujeres cual es su situación económica, donde 13 mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero luchan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edelma quien en su encuesta mostró estar en un nivel medio, gracias al cual ayuda a su familia. Ella cuenta con un almacén en su casa, además realiza la venta de chipa, ella es una persona que gracias a su esfuerzo y las ganas que pone por salir adelante, está creciendo. Edelma quiere seguir trabajando y mejorando sus ingresos y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Edelma solicita de este crédito para poder surtirlo con la compra de bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, leche, pan y demás insumos, ya que con estos puede seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Pororo group are taking part in their first loan cycle within the Women's Committee Program.  They all work and help each other out in order to make progress.  Each member completed the poverty stoplight survey which helps women to determine what their financial situation is.  Thirteen of the women live below the poverty line but they still work hard to get ahead.

One of the members of this group is Edelma who was shown by the survey to be at an intermediate level.  As a result, she is able to help her family.  She has a grocery store in her home and also sells 'chipa' (cheese buns).  She is managing to grow her business thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead in life.  Edelma would like to continue working and improving her income so that she can continue helping her family.  She is requesting this loan so that she can stock her business with drinks, food products, canned goods, milk, bread and other products.  This will allow her to continue providing her customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food products, canned goods, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, both of whom go to school, Hadjah also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

For eight years Hadjah has been selling charcoal, and generates additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal.

Hadjah aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation difficulties and also hopes to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sakher

texts.en: Sakher is a 22-year-old married man from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2008. He asked Ryada for this Youth Loan in order to buy display refrigerators for his grocery store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income to provide his family with a good lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy display refrigerators for his grocery store.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is 30 years old, single, and has three children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Enid is a tailor and due to her good customer service and technical expertise she has a good number of loyal customers.

Enid is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She desires to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 53-year-old farmer, married to Margaret and the father of four children. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of about KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family. George is applying for his third loan term with KADET LTD after repaying his previous loans successfully. 

He will use the loan to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings and animal feeds. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farmland. His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings and animal feeds.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, 46, is married and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rehema dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the near future.

With the 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, coconuts and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable loan requirements.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, coconuts and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina comes again to you for another loan. For the past six months she has been selling charcoal from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenges of competition and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal to increase her supply. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to increase her supply.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en:
Sadress is a 32-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests solely on her because her husband does not have any sustained employment. She is a teacher, and she has been teaching for six years. 

As it has always been her desire, she has now started a bar in order to earn more income to support her family, and the business is promising. Sadress used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She intends to use this loan to buy beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Yackeline

texts.es: Yackeline de 37 años de edad habita en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 14 años. Desde hace 18 años, ella se ha dedicado a la actividad comercial, pues su padre fue socio fundador de una cooperativa y ella conoció muy de cerca su movimiento comercial.  Inicialmente empezó vendiendo chicha pasteles, y cuando estructuró su clientela, ellos mismos solicitaron nuevos productos como ropa, calzado, colonia medicamentos y   le agregó repuestos,  como desde hace 18 años lo hace. Sus ventas las realiza de lunes a domingos en las horas de la tarde. Ella otorga a sus clientes, que son conductores de vehiculos, especialmente taxistas,  créditos cortos y también ofrece artículos de contado con importantes descuentos. Su clientela espera su visita y como ella dice “funciona como una vitrina ambulante. “  En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos para automotores que le han encargado clientes que no pueden comprarlo a las tiendas automotrices de contado y por eso lo solicitan a Yackeline. Su mayor desafío es tener más dinero para responder a las necesidades y expectativas de su clientela y esto es lo que logrará con su credikiva, haciendo de esta financiación una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Yackeline, 37, lives in the town of Soledad with her spouse and two children, ages 7 and 14.  For 18 years she has worked in retail because her father was a founding member of a cooperative and she learned up close about his commercial activity.

She started selling "chicha" [corn drink] and pastries, and when she formed her clientele, they themselves requested new products such as clothing, footwear, cologne, and medicine, and she added spare parts, just as she has done for 18 years.

She makes sales from Monday through Sunday in the afternoon.  She grants short-term loans to her customers, who are drivers, especially taxi drivers.  She also offers big discounts on articles for cash.  Her customers wait for her arrival and, as she says, "she functions as a traveling display window."

Currently she's applying for her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll buy spare auto parts that customers have ordered; they can't buy them in automotive stores for cash, so they get them from Yackeline.

Her biggest challenge is having more money to respond to her customers' needs and expectations.  This is what she'll achieve with her Kiva loan, making this financing a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, de 50 años de edad, esta casado y junto a su pareja vive en su casa propia luchando por salir adelante y mantener su vida sin carencias ni complicaciones económicas.
Rafael se dedica principalmente al alquiler de su equipo de sonido y algunos otros implementos para fiestas y eventos en la ciudad. Lleva 5 años en éste trabajo, labora por lo general los fines de semana, siente que le va bien ya que su clientela se ha multiplicado y siempre es solicitado. Por las noches trabaja vendiendo comida y eventualmente también conduce su mototaxi.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo principal es que le genera buenos ingresos además de que se divierte haciendo esto ya que es algo que le fascina desde muy niño, durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta actividad aprendió muchas cosas y continuamente está capacitándose en nuevas técnicas de sonido, ha ganado muchos clientes y espera seguir con su etapa de crecimiento. Su meta principal es poner un estudio musical totalmente implementado, por lo pronto ha comprado algunos instrumentos que son necesarios para su trabajo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles, se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar con su negocio, además se siente a gusto con el asesor de crédito y con los miembros de su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado comprará algunos cables que necesita para renovar su equipo de trabajo, realizará la reparación de un parlante y comprará focos de luces a colores que necesita para alquilarlos.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 50, is married, and with his wife, they live in their own home, struggling to get ahead in life and maintain their lifestyle without any shortfall or economic complications.

Rafael works primarily in rentals of sound equipment and other supplies for parties and events in the city.  He has spent the past 5 years in this line of work, working primarily on the weekends.  He feels like it's going well, since his customers have multiplied and he's always getting asked to work.  In the evenings he works selling food, and on occasion, he also drives his mototaxi.  What he likes best about his principal job is that is makes him a good income and that he has a good time doing it, since this is a thing that's fascinated him ever since he was a small child.  In the time he's been working, he has learned a lot of things and he is always finding out new sound techniques.  He has gained many customers and hopes to continue to grow his business.

His primary goal is to create a whole music studio, for which he has already bought some of the necessary instruments for his work.  He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Soles, and he feels content and thankful because of the financial help which he is being offered to continue in his business.  He also feels good about the loan officer and the other members of his communal bank because he knows the majority of the members who are mostly his neighbors and he considers them to be responsible people.

With the loan, he will buy some cables that he needs to renovate his current setup, make repairs to a speaker, and buy light bulbs in different colors, which he needs for rentals.

loans.use: to buy cables to improve his sound equipment and other tools of his trade.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45-year-old business lady. She is a married mother of two. She has been running her retail shop for the past years with a monthly income of about KES 7,900 which he uses to support her family. Jane is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

She will use the loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour and stationery, etc. With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour and stationery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: José Dimas

texts.es: Don José tiene 35 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 8 años de edad vive en casa propia, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz y  frijoles. Además de dedicarse al cultivo también trabaja en una granja, Él es un hombre muy responsable, generoso y dedicado en su trabajo. Ha decidido cultivar la tierra,  por lo que necesita invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas, insecticidas, entre otras cosas necesarias para la siembra ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos   necesarios para realizar la inversión por eso solicita el credito, y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and their four children, who are 15, 13, 11 and 8 years old.  José's business is growing basic grains such as corn and beans.  In addition to growing his own crops, he also works on another farm.  He is a very responsible, generous man who is committed to his work.

José has decided to work the land and needs to invest in buying farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, insecticides and other products he needs for his work.  He is requesting a loan as he doesn't have the financial resources he needs to make this investment which will enable him to provide his family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (fertilizers, seeds and insecticides)

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
JOSE tiene 56 años de edad es casaso tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

José se dedica a la siembra de fréjol, maíz, mora, además se ddeica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar herbicidas, urea, semillas, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los materiales para la siembra.

Las compras las realizará en Chillanes. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos a los que s eenfrenta es la falta de oportunidades para trabajar. En el timepo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad, carnaval, fiestas del cantón y pasear.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives together with his wife and children in Chillanes, Bolívar province.

The Virgen de Baños community bank was formed in Mama Sara de Cerritos community, some 30 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.

José's business is growing beans, corn and blackberries.  He also raises livestock.  He is requesting this loan to buy herbicides, urea, seeds and fertilizers.  This loan will help him to buy the materials he needs for his farming.

José makes his purchases in Chillanes.  His dream is to improve his living conditions.  The challenge that he faces is a lack of work opportunities.  In his free time, he enjoys taking part in local celebrations and festivals. He also likes going for walks.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, urea, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zion Christian Association Group

texts.en:
Joyce, a 34-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom go to school, is a resident of Kitoro and a member of Zion Christian Association Group. Joyce has a small business frying cassava pancakes which she sells to school children and passersby. She also lays bricks to supplement her meagre income.

Joyce has requested a loan of ugx.300,000 to boost her business through the purchase of flour and cooking oil; she will also use part of it to pay the tuition balance for one of her children.

Joyce's goals are to see her children graduate and obtain good-paying jobs. She is so grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru:
Мухаё активная и позитивная женщина в возрасте 36 лет.   Она замужем и имеет четверых детей.   Мухаё очень любит своих детей и старается сделать всё, чтобы они всегда жили в достатке.   Вместе с мужем  они зарабатывают деньги для того, чтобы прокормить свою семью и дать хорошее образование своим детям.   Они мечтают о достойном будущем для своих детей.   Муж Мухаё находится на заработках в России.   И каждый месяц он присылает в семью заработанные денежные средства, что составляет дополнительный доход для семьи.   Сама Мухайё не любит сидеть без дела, она постоянно в движении, очень трудолюбивая  женщина.
 Чтобы помогать своему мужу приносить в дом доход, она начала свой бизнес.  Мухаё занимается купле - продажей национальной одежды для женщин и этим бизнесом она занимается уже более 11 лет.   Она покупает одежду в городе на большом рынке и продаёт в своём селе для местных женщин.   Это очень удобно для других женщин, так как выезжать в город они не могут и поэтому рады купить товар на месте в своём селе.   С каждым разом спрос на её продукцию увеличивается и ей необходимо больше закупать товар.   В связи с этим Мухаё обратилась в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит для покупки своего товара - национальной женской одежды.   Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhayo is an active and positive 36 year old woman. She is married and has four children. Muhayo loves her children and wants to make sure they lack in nothing. Together with her husband she earns money to feed her family and provide a good eduction for her children. She wants her children to have a promising future. Muhayo's husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Every month he sends money to his family. But Muhayo herself doesn't like to be idle, she is always in motion and is a very hard working woman.

To help her husband provide for the family Muhayo has started her own business. She sells Tajik national women's dresses and has had her business for 11 years. She purchases clothes in the city at a central market then sells them in her own village to the local women. It's very convenient for her clients, as many of them rarely visit the city and are happy to be able to buy clothes in their own village. Every time she comes back from the city the demand for her dresses grows and she needs to be able to purchase more inventory on her next trip. For this reason Muhayo has turned to Arvand for a loan which she will use to purchase a batch of traditional Tajik dresses. Muhayo is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy women's clothes

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 35 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his parents and sister. Several times, Albert requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Albert has a car. He is driving it as a taxi and he earns a small, daily income for the family. His sister is working as a stylist in a beauty salon to earn additional income. Their salaries are too small to cover the family's monthly expenses. 

Albert requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Albert will install gas equipment in his car, since it is much cheaper than petrol. He will continue driving the taxi and his profit will be significantly increased. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his taxi.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
VICTOR tiene 45 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

Victor se dedica a la siembra de fréjol, maíz, mora, además se dedica a la crianza de animales cómo el ganado, pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, urea, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo uq le hace falta para los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Chillanes.
El sueño es tener trabajo estable y salud para vivir tranquilo.

los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son falta de fuentes de trabajo. En le tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Victor is 45 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes, Bolívar province.

The Virgen de Baños community bank was formed in Mama Sara de Cerritos community, some 30 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.

Victor's business is growing beans, corn and blackberries.  He also raises animals such as cattle, hens and pigs.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure, urea and fertilizers.  The loan will help him to buy what he needs for his crops.  He makes his purchases in the city of Chillanes.

Victor's dream is to have stable work and enjoy good health so that he can live peacefully.  The challenge he faces is a lack of work opportunities.  In his free time, Victor likes taking part in sports and enjoying local festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, urea and fertilizers

loans.name: Azizaga

texts.ru:
