With the loan money, he will purchase a variety of goods, including rice, flour, milk, eggs, pulses, soap, and detergent for the store. This will help him to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children. Mr. Zahid Ali and his family are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: A 600 USD loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline used the previous loan to buy clothes. She is a 44-year-old lady living in Kagadi, Uganda. For five years now she has been selling clothes. She started as a hawker in different markets, then got capital and rented a shop. She also buys fabric and makes trendy designs. Her business is profitable. She says inadequate capital and price fluctuations are challenges affecting the business. She would like to educate her children, build a permanent house for her residence and hire employees to help expand the business. Caroline is requesting a loan to buy clothes for tailoring and resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for tailoring and resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis used the previous loan to buy shoes to sell. He is a married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years, he has been trading in second-hand shoes, and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He is also a farmer who mainly grows bananas and beans. Inadequate capital is the factor affecting the business growth, while his dreams are to trade on a wholesale basis and educate his children up to the University. Francis intends to use the loan to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man, aged 41, and a father to six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a barber shop, and has been in this business for three years. He also does motorcycle transport to supplement his business. He is currently building a residential house for his family and dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. Inadequate capital is a major challenge to his business, while his dream is to own a modern salon in the city. John intends to use the loan to buy shaving machines to use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines to use in the salon.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business for the past four years. His potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. He mentioned that two challenges for his business are stiff competition and a high cost of purchasing spare parts for maintenance.

With the loan, Omar wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future. Omar joined Yehu because of its responsiveness to customer needs. He appreciates the last Kiva loan that helped him to start a vegetable stall.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
MARIA TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA TIENE SIETE HIJOS, VIVE CON EL ESPOSO Y LOS HIJOS EN  CHILLANE SPROVINCIA DE BOLÍVAR.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

MARIA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE FRÉJOL, MAÍZ, MORA, TOMATE, CAÑA, ADEMÁS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE GANADO.
 SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSECTICIDAS, UREA, FERTILIZANTES, HERBICIDAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO QUE LE HACE MUCHA FALTA. LOS DESAFÍOS A LOS QUE SE ENFRENTA SON LOS DESASTRES NATURALES.
EN SUEÑO ES MEJORAR LAS CONDICIIONES DE VIDA, TERMINAR DE EDUACR A LOS HIJOS Y DARLES UN BUENA VIDA.
EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PASEAR, VISITAR FAMILIARES, DEDICARCE A LA FAMILIA Y DISFRUTAR DE LAS FIESTAS DEL CANTÓN.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has seven children. She lives with her husband and children in Chillane, province of Bolivar.   

The VIRGEN DE BAÑOS communal bank was formed in the community of  Mama Sara de Cerritos, 30 minutes from the cooperative's office. 

Maria works in agriculture. She grows beans, corn, raspberries, tomatoes, and sugar cane. She also raises cattle. She is asking for the loan to buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer, and herbicides. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she really needs. The challenges she faces are natural disasters.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life, finish raising her children, and giving them a good life. In her free time, she likes to go for walks, visit family and enjoys the festivals in her canton.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 42-year-old married man with eight children of which seven are of school-going age. A piggery farmer, he lives in Kagadi, Uganda, and has been in this business for five years. He also grows crops. He is also a teacher who was inspired in this business by a good lifestyle that he wanted to live compared to the poverty that he was born in. He dreams of building a good house for his family and educating his children up to the University. Joshua intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31-year-old married man with two children living in Hioma, Uganda. He describes himself as a hardworking man. He operates a produce business dealing in maize, beans, and groundnuts, and he has operated it for a period of five years now. The business is urban-based and he started it using capital from farming to enable him to get daily income to help with the smooth running of his family. He would like to expand the business to new areas and buy a vehicle for transporting his produce to the city. Peter intends to use the loan to buy beans, groundnuts, and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 38-year-old married woman with five children living in Hioma, Uganda. She sells new clothes in her shop but also takes them to specific office premises when her customers find it hard to come to her. She sells new bags, dresses, and shirts. She describes herself as hardworking and has a dream of educating her children up to the university level despite inadequate capital which hinders the growth of her business. Annet is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She is married and a mother of three children. She has been running her retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 8,900, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing client.  

She will use the loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, stationery, etc. With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children. 

Her hope and dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, stationery, etc.

loans.name: Florensia

texts.en: Florensia is now applying for a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of USD 90.  She earns a good income from her business.

loans.use: to buy sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, and soft drinks

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, aged 38 years, is married and has been blessed with seven children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a tailoring business, making dresses for women and suits for men. Her potential customers are neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inadequate capital in the business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and needles. She joined Yehu because it is responsive to customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and needles.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 22 años. El tiene una fábrica de chichas, que inició su esposa cuando preparaba chicha de arroz, entre vecinas de su cuadra. Cuando Ismael dejó de ser conductor de buses intermunicipales, observó en esta actividad, un potencial de crecimiento y de sostenibilidad en sus ingresos para beneficiar su hogar. Así fue que empezaron a hacer chichas en mayor volumen y así mismo a buscar mercados para comercializarla; sus primeros clientes fueron las tiendas de los barrios cercanos y poco a poco fueron posicionándose, vendiendo el producto por cajas, como en la actualidad lo hace. Así mismo su hermana que vive en otra ciudad y se dedica al comercio de productos lácteos, le propuso vender queso, suero y carne, y con su apoyo, pues le otorgó crédito, Ismael le compró sus primeros productos e inició la venta de estos también, en la ciudad de Cartagena; con ellos le ha ido bien, pues hace pedidos semanales y vende nuevos productos que complementan su ingreso familiar. Ismael    con su credito anterior a la Fundaci´n Mario Santo Domingo, compró carne de res y mucho pescado que vendió, porque aumentó sus inventarios y  su clientela. Ismael dice a la Funación: “Gracias por su colaboración y que siempre lo sigan haciendo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva,  con el cual comprará nuevamente carne porcina en mayor volumen pues es el producto de mayor volumen de ventas tiene y genera ingresos inmediatos, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Ismael is 56 years old. He lives in the city of Cartagena with his spouse and 3 children, aged 18 to 22. He has a chicha factory. He started when his wife would make rice chica with the neighbors on their block. When Ismael left is job as an inter-city bus driver, he observed in that activity a potential for growth and sustainability in his income to benefit his home. that was how they started to make chicha in greater quantities as well as to seek markets to sell it in. His first customers were the stores in the nearby neighborhoods. Little by little they gained ground, selling the product by the case, as they do now. His sister who lives in another city also has a business selling dairy products. She proposed that he sell cheese, whey and meat. With her support, because she made him a loan, and Ismael bought his first products from her and started selling those things as well in the city of Cartagena. It has gone well for him with these, because he makes weekly orders and sells new products that supplement the family income. With the previous loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, Ismael bought beef and a lot of fish that he sold because he increased his inventory and his customers. Ismael tells the Foundation: “Thanks for helping and I hope you continue to do it." Right now he is applying for his first Kiva loan, with which he will buy pork again in a larger quantity because it is the product that he sells the most and it generates immediate income, which will make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of pork.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en: Laurent is a 37-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a grade three teacher and has been in service for seven years. His love for community sensitization drove him into the profession despite the fact that it comes with a low salary. He wishes to venture into farming to supplement his earnings and also upgrade in his studies. Laurent intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Isledy Del Socorro

texts.es: Isledy de 62 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, los cuales debió educar y sacar adelante debido a que su esposo falleció desde hace 26 años. Con el propósito de garantizarles educación y mejores condiciones de vida, esta mujer laboró como operaria en un taller de confecciones por largos años, pero por motivos de salud se retiró y se dedicó a las labores del hogar. Desde hace un año decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancía desde su vivienda, con el fin de generar ingresos para su manutención. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos y comprar algunos encargos solicitados por sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es montar su propia tienda de ropa y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: Isledy is 62 years old and has two children, whom she raised and educated on her own after her husband died 26 years ago. With the goal to ensure their education and better living conditions, Isledy worked at a sewing shop for many years, but for health reasons she retired and dedicated herself to household activities. A year ago she decided to make a living selling merchandise from her home, with the goal to generate income to support herself. She is requesting the loan to expand her product portfolio and buy some products requested by her customers. Her biggest dream is to set up her own clothing store and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, accessories and footwear.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela, de 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño , vive en su casa propia a lado de su familia conformada por sus hermanos, sus padres,su esposo y su hijo.Angela se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir de distintos sexos, modelos, tamaños y colores principalmente para niños. De manera periódica realiza la compra de su mercadería la misma que pone a la venta entre sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y otras personas conocidas bajo el sistema de venta crediticia. Realiza el cobro de manera diaria, semanal o quincenal dependiendo del acuerdo al que haya llegado con sus clientes. Trabaja sola en este rubro desde hace 8 años generalmente por las tardes. Le agrada mucho trabajar vendiendo prendas de vestir porque le permite conocer nuevos clientes y generar sus propios ingresos en sus ratos libres, ha visto que las ganancias son muy buenas y es por eso que desea consolidar con el paso del tiempo una pequeña tienda de venta de ropas en algún local o en su vivienda con una mejor infraestructura que le ayuden a mostrar mejor todo lo que ofrece. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 800 soles, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de prendas de vestir conformada por polos, jeans, pantalones, blusas, camisas y shorts para ponerlos a la venta entre sus clientes.
texts.en: Angela is 36, married and has a young son. She lives in her own home alongside her family, which consists of her brothers, her parents, her husband and their son. Angela makes a living selling distinct styles, colors and sizes of clothing, primarily for children. She periodically buys her merchandise herself and sells it to friends, neighbors, relatives and other acquaintances through her system of credit. She has been in this trade for eight years and generally works in the afternoon. She really enjoys selling clothes because it allows her to meet new customers and generate her own income in her free time. She has seen good profits and it's for this reason she wants to consolidate the business into a small clothing store at some site or out of her home since better infrastructure will help her better display what she has to offer. Angela is requesting the loan and is very grateful for the opportunity to have the financial support she needs to make headway. She plans to purchase a batch of clothes consisting of polos, jeans, pants, blouses, shirts and shorts to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase polos, jeans, pants, blouses and other clothes.

loans.name: Arquimides David

texts.es:
ARQUIMIDES TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO NO TIENE HIJOS, VIVE CON PADRES EN CHILLANES PROVINCIA DE BOLÍVAR.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

ARQUIMIDES SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE FRÉJOL, MORA, ADEMÁS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA  DE GANADO.

SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS, UREA, HERBICIDAS, FERTILIZANTES. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRE´DITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA LAS SIEMBRAS. LAS COMPRAS LAS REALIZARÁ EN CHILLANES.

EL SUEÑO ES TENER TERRENOS PROPIOS PARA SEMBRAR. lOS DESAFÍOS A LOS QUE SE ENFRENTA SON LA PRESENCIA DE PLAGAS Y ENFERMEDADES EN LOS CULTIVOS.

EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA EL DEPORTE Y LAS FIESTAS DE LA COMUNIDAD.
texts.en: Arquimides is 25 years old, single and doesn't have children. He lives with his parents in Chillanes, province of Bolivar. He is part of the Virgen de Baño community bank in the community of Sara de Cerritos, 30 minutes from the co-op's office. Arquimides makes a living growing beans and blackberries, and also raises livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, herbicides and fertilizers that he needs for his crops. He will make the purchases in Chillanes. His dream is to have his own land to harvest. The challenges he faces is the presence of plagues and sicknesses in his crops. In his free time he likes sports and community festivals.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle repair service.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy vegetables, such as carrots and potatoes. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with working capital of $500. Maria is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has a single child. Ahmad is the only provider for his family.
Ahmad has owned a small bakery since 2010. He specializes in making bread and pastries. He has gained much experience. Ahmad has been able to hire 2 employees already and is rapidly growing with fame and respect in his neighborhood.
Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a new oven to improve his productions. Ahmad aims through this loan to improve his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new oven to improve his baking production.

loans.name: Maila

texts.en:
Maila is a teacher who teaches elementary level education in their village. She has a passion to succeed and respond immediately to her children needs.
Maila also engage herself in a piggery business. She has just started the business and wishes that her business will last a long time.
Maila is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and a care taker in their piggery business. Maila wanted to acquire a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed for the hogs. She hopes that she can manage the business well and attain her wish.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and married to Samson. They are blessed with ten children, four of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past five years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. Beatrice dreams of establishing rental houses in the future.
With the loan, she wants to expand into a transport business and purchase motorcycle for business. 
She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to use in transport.

loans.name: Aziida

texts.en: Aziida is a 38-year-old married woman with 2 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 15 years ago she decided to start a clothing shop in order to help meet the daily expenses of her family. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth, while her dreams are to trade in wholesale and educate her children to attain degrees. Aziida intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una señora soltera de 46 años, tiene dos hijos hombres con  quienes vive en el municipio de Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la producción agrícola (repollo) desde hace 7 años, eligió esta actividad porque le gusta,  ya que invierte su capital y así obtiene  mejores  ganancias,  por lo que de esta manera aporta a la economía familiar. Realiza una segunda actividad que es la compra venta de verduras.
Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para capital de trabajo para cultivo de papa con el objetivo de diversificar su producción agrícola  y de esta forma obtener más ingresos económicos. 
Su sueño es construir su casa más grande y de mejor calidad, ya que actualmente vive en 2 cuartos pequeños.
texts.en: Sabina is 46 years old, single and has two sons who live in the municipality of Sololá. She has made a living growing cabbage for the past seven years. She chose this activity because she enjoys it. She invests her capital and thus earns better profits, and in this way she supports the family finances. She also makes extra income buying and selling vegetables. She is requesting the loan to have capital to grow potatoes, with the goal of diversifying her agricultural production and increasing her income. Her dream is to build a bigger home of higher quality, since she currently lives in two small rooms.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Daysi Jhomayra

texts.es:
DAYSI TIENE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERA NO TIEME HIJOS, VIVE CON LOS PADRES EN CHILLANES PROVINCIA DE BOLÍVAR.

LA VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS ESTÁ FORMADA POR EN LA COMUNIDAD MAMA SARA DE CERRITOS, A UNA DISTANCIA DE 30 MINUTOS DE LA OFICINA DE LA COOPERATIVA

DAYSI SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAÍZ, FRÉJOL, ADEMAS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE CERDOS Y POLLOS.

SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS, UREA, INSECTICIDAS, HERBICIDAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA LA AGRICULTURA. LAS COMPRAS LO REALIZARÁ EN CILLANES.

EL SUEÑO ES COMPRAR TERRENO. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PASEAR Y VISITAR A LA FAMILIA.
texts.en: Daysi is 20 years old, single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Chillanes, province of Bolivar. She is a member of the Virgen de Baño community bank in the community of Mama Sara de Cerritos, 30 minutes from the offices of Cooperativa San Jose. Daysi makes a living growing corn and beans, as well as raising pigs and chickens. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides and herbicides, which are necessary for her crops. She will make the purchases in Chillanes. Her dream is to buy land. In her free time she likes to go for walks and visit with family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann earns a living through her hog raising business. She is a married woman and a mother of four children from Panglao, Bohol. Mary Ann is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income. Furthermore, Mary Ann wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a business from her house selling diesel and petrol. She is making a good income from selling iesel and petrol and she wants to buy more quantity with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with a working capital of $100.

loans.use: to buy diesel and petrol.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe, 58 years divorced, has been blessed with nine children all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling charcoal to her neighbours. In addition she also operates a green grocery business, which earns her extra. She cites the high cost of transportation to be her major challenge in this. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan Kwekwe wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Mrgavan village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, daughter, who is 19 years old and two sons (7 and 9 years old). Together with her husband, Anahit cultivates land and grows apricot trees. 

Anahit's husband goes abroad during the winter season and financially supports the family. Their daughter Qnarik is a student at the Armenian State Economic University and specializes in accounting.
 
As the family's monthly income is hardly enough to cover daily costs, it is very difficult for Anahit to save money for Qnarik's education.

Anahit has requested this loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition. The loan will help Qnarik to complete her education and become a good specialist. She dreams of finding a good job and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Nelly,  quien con su anterior credikiva compró materias primas, con las cuales elaboró ricos pasteles trifasicos (carne-pollo-cerdo) y como aumentó su producción, logro incrmentar su clientela. En su negocio ya no compra a crédito y su vida está muy bien, ella dice a sus finaciadores que muchas gracias porque su crédito es mas económico que en otras organizacines . Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues los colombianos celebramos tambien,  el dia internaionalde las madres y esta época es muy comercial y se aumentan los ingresos de su familia, por concepto de ventas de sus productos. Con su nuevo credikiva comprará insumos, materias primas para elaborar deliciosas comidas, a fin de que las madres y todas las  clientes estén muy felices en este dia, alimentandose bailando y disfrutando en familia con los pasteles que prepara Nelly.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Nelly, who with her previous Kiva loan purchased supplies to make her delicious "pasteles trifasicos" (pastries made with meat, chicken and pork) and increase her production and her customer base.  She still doesn't buy on credit and her life is going very well. She says thank you very much to her lenders because the loan is more affordable than through other organizations. Now she is requesting another loan since it is a festive time for Colombians with Mother's Day coming up, and this is a very commercial time period. She wants to increase her family's income by selling more of her products. With this new loan she will purchase ingredients (groceries, vegetables, pitas and bijao leaves) and supplies to make her delicious foods so that mothers and all of her customers are happy on that special day, eating, dancing and enjoying family with the pasteles that Nelly prepares.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make her delicious foods.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, 59, is a married lady and has four adult children living in Hodeida, Yemen.  She earns a living by knitting and embroidering. She will use the loan to buy fabric to make her products and also wool to knit scarves. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER to increase her investment capital.

The challenge she faces in her business is increasing her income. She is going to use her profits to invest in materials to get more orders from customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric to use for her business.

loans.name: Mchekesi

texts.en:
Mchekesi, 56, is a widow and has nine children, three of whom attend school and are still under her care. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over six months, she has operated a green grocery business, selling groceries to her neighbours and passers-by. She also sells dried fish as her other source of income. Mchekesi mentioned stiff competition as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase green vegetables, dried fish, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, dried fish, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Joanina to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy items every day.  With this loan she will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and soft drinks (fanta, coca-cola and sprite). She has been involved in business activities since 2011. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Joanina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, oil and soft drinks such as fanta, coca-cola  and sprite.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a 52-year-old mother who was gifted with five children.  Despite being widowed, she has the strong determination to improve their status of living and give her children a better life. She aims to improve her variety store by increasing her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand and to generate a higher income. Due to financial constraints, she is asking for a loan a of PHP 10,000 to buy soft drinks, frozen foods, snack foods, beverages, canned goods, noodles and seasoning to sell.  She hopes that someday, she will make more improvements to her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, frozen foods, snack foods, beverages, canned goods, noodles and seasoning to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 23 years old. She sells shoes and has been in the business for three years. She is married with one child, aged 2. With the loan, she will buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees her child.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma, aged 32 years, is married to Chimera, and they have four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwajuma operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a challenge of lack of adequate capital to expand her business.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of sugar, maize flour, soap detergents and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of sugar, maize flour, soap detergents and wheat flour.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans resides in Kitale and has four children. He has been a farmer for the past five years, producing and selling milk and eggs to the local market.

He requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo for purchasing poultry, and this will increase the level of egg production and thus, improve their level of income. He wishes to have 2,000 poultry and be the main egg supplier to the local market. His main challenge is diseases.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua operates a retail business, selling items to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the challenge of inadequate capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 50,000, which she is requesting, she wants to purchase more maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 56-year-old, married woman from Antequera, Bohol. Luzviminda operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her region. 

Luzviminda is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, rice, biscuits, soap and detergents, soda and beverages. Through this, she can attract more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income. 

Luzviminda hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, rice, biscuits, soap and detergents, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Electine

texts.en:
Electine is a married mother of five children and they all reside in Kitale, in theRiftvalley.  She has been a farmer for thirteen years growing maize and horticultural crops and selling them in the local market.  Besides farming, she has a retail shop as another source of income.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 41,600 to purchase a dairy cow.  She says that by purchasing a dairy cow the family's milk production will increase and lead to higher income and financial stability.  The challenges she faces are the risk of disease, the high cost of feed and inadequate capital.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is 56 years old. He lives in the small village of Tetritskaro District with his wife and two children. Grigol requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for Grigol's family is the monthly salary of Grigol’s wife, who works as a teacher at a local school.  She earns a total of 170 Laris (GEL) per month. It is hardly enough to pay for food for the family.  According to Credo estimates the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Grigol requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan programme envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions for the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Grigol will start a grocery store.  He will purchase a stock of groceries to open the grocery store. He already has a space, where the grocery store will be situated. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Grigol's family.

loans.use: to start a grocery store.

loans.name: Dulcina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a dulcina quien con su credikiva compró abanicos, ropa para damas, caballeros, paraguas y víveres para responder s su clientela. Con su anterior credikiva su negocio aumentó sus inventarios y se ha fortalecido. Ella está muy felíz y dice a sus finaciadores de Kiva : "Gracias por el apoyo a mi negocio" 
En la actualidad Dulcina, invertirá su credikiva en la compra de productos lácteos como queso, ropa y arroz, aceite, azucar etc, su inversión aumentará sus utilidades y hará de su financiación una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support of her Kiva loan, Dulcina was able to buy fans, women’s and men’s clothing, umbrellas, and provisions so that she could respond to her customers. Her business increased its inventory and was strengthened as a result of her previous Kiva loan. She is very happy and says to the Kiva lenders, “Thank you for supporting my business.”

At the moment, Dulcina will invest another Kiva loan in the purchase of dairy products such as cheese, as well as clothing, rice, oil, sugar, and other items. This investment will increase her profits and give her successful financial results.

loans.use: to buy cheese, clothing, rice, oil, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Doña Luz, una humilde señora, de 43 años de edad, originaria de Managua, soltera, madre de 2 hijos, actualmente estudian en la universidad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de CD, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 7 años.
Inicio en el ámbito del comercio, con capital propio, dinero que le dieron de su liquidación, fue asi como ella  decidió poner su propio negocio como es la venta de CD, luego miro que su negocio, necesitaba mas inversión, fue por eso que se vio en la necesidad de solicitar préstamo a las instituciones financieras, con el objetivo de reforzar un poco mas en su negocio. Recibe otros ingresos como es la pensión que recibe por incapacidad.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar, CD de música y CD de películas. Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar todo los CD que aun no tiene en inventario y lo mas solicitado por sus clientes, unos de sus planes futuros es poder mejorar la infraestructura  del local para una mejor presentación, su meta próxima es poder establecer otro negocio como es la librería.
texts.en:
Doña Luz, age 43, is a humble woman who is originally from Managua. She is single and the mother of two children who are currently studying at the university. Luz is a merchant who has owned a CD shop for more than seven years.

She started in the retail trade using money she received from her severance pay as capital. At that point, she decided to establish her own business of selling CDs. Upon evaluating her business, she determined that she needed more investment. Therefore, Luz figured that she needed to request loans from financial institutions so that she could gradually strengthen her business. She receives additional income from a disability pension.

Luz is requesting a loan so that she can buy music CDs and DVD movies. She believes that the loan will help her buy all the CDs that she is lacking in her inventory and that are most requested by her customers. One of her future plans is to improve the infrastructure of her shop so that it will have a better appearance. Her next goal is to establish another business, such as a bookstore.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and DVD movies.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 44 años de edad,esta casada , vive en compañía de su pareja y de su hijo de 14 años de edad, habitando su casa propia.El negocio que tiene Diana es la venta de suplementos nutricionales elaborados a base de productos naturales como café ,cacao , entre otros. Se inició hace 3 años con ayuda de una amiga quien le recomendó este trabajo y desde entonces ha podido emprender sola su camino. Vende sus productos de manera ambulatoria ya sea en cajas al por mayor y por unidad en sobres pequeños siendo su principal clientela sus amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Sus ventas las realiza al contado o al crédito.Le gusta su actividad pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones como el ayudar a muchas personas en el cuidado de su salud, también el ingreso económico y el sentirse una empresaria que cada día va progresando. Al contrario le incomoda cuando alguno de sus clientes se retrasa en el pago de sus créditos, pero aun así desea continuar y seguir adelante.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de cajas de Suplementos Nutricionales .
texts.en:
Diana is 44 years old and married. She lives in her own home with her partner and their 14-year-old child. Diana has a business of selling nutritional supplements made from natural products such as coffee, cacao, and other ingredients. She started three years ago with the help of a friend who recommended that she do this type of work. Now she manages her business on her own. Diana sells her products as a traveling saleswoman, either wholesale by the box or in small individual packets. Her main customers are friends, relatives, and co-workers. Her sales are conducted for cash or on credit. She enjoys her business because it gives her great satisfaction to be helping many people look after their health. Also, the income she earns makes her feel like a businesswoman who is making progress each day. On the other hand, she gets uncomfortable whenever some of her customers are late in paying their bills. Despite this, she is willing to continue and move forward.

Diana is taking this opportunity to request 1,500 PEN and expects to receive support so that she can follow through with her plans. The amount she requested will be invested in several boxes of nutritional supplements.

loans.use: to buy boxes of nutritional supplements.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 37 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños con quienes vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo tratando de brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida y cubrir todas sus necesidades.Delia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y accesorios femeninos como perfumes, cremas corporales, lápiz labial, cremas de manos, aretes, collares y pulseras. Toda su mercadería es enviada en grandes paquetes desde otra ciudad de marcas reconocidas. Sus clientes son sus amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo a quienes vende al contado o al crédito y la cobranza lo realiza en forma diaria, semanal o quincenal. Realiza este oficio cerca de 19 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien tiene un vehículo , el cual lo usa para trasladar su mercadería. Se siente muy satisfecha por lo bien que le va en ésta nueva etapa.Le gusta mucho tener este trabajo porque le permite disponer de su tiempo durante las horas que no está trabajando ya que puede realizar las labores de su hogar con mucha comodidad, además a aprendido a ganarse el respeto y la confianza de los clientes en base a su buen trato y su gran sonrisa.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 800 soles y agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo . Con el monto solicitado comprará cosméticos y accesorios como perfumes, cremas faciales y aretes.
texts.en: Delia is 37 years old, married and has two young children, with whom she lives alongside her husband in her own house.  Together Delia and her husband are trying to offer their children the best possible living conditions and to pay for necessities.  Delia makes a living selling make-up and women's accessories, such as perfumes, body creams, lipstick, hand cream, earrings, necklaces and bracelets.  All of Delia's branded merchandise is sent in big packages from other cities.  Delia's customers are friends family members and colleagues who pay either in cash or in installments, with Delia collecting payments daily, weekly or fortnightly. Delia has been doing this work for around 19 years and she sometimes receives support from her husband, who has a vehicle that he uses for moving merchandise.  Delia is very satisfied with how well the business is going now.  She really likes this job because it leaves her with some free time when she can do the household chores in peace.  In addition, Delia has earned respect and confidence from customers because of her good customer service and her big smile.  On this occasion, Delia is applying for 800 Nuevo Soles and is grateful to those who are providing the loan she needs to increase her working capital.  With this loan, Delia will purchase make-up and accessories such as perfumes, facial creams and earrings.

loans.use: to buy make-up, perfumes, facial creams and other products.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es una señora de 44 años quien tiene  10 hijos (6 hombres y 4 mujeres)  y tiene una relación de unión libre con su pareja, actualmente viven en el municipio de  Sololá.
Ella y su pareja se dedican  a la agricultura (producción de cebolla) y a la venta de verduras,  llevan más de 30 años realizando esta actividad, de esta manera  es como obtienen  la mayor parte de sus ingresos para el sustento familiar, realizan esta actividad ya que sus abuelos les enseñaron esta labor.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para capital de trabajo para cultivo de zanahoria.
Sus sueños son remodelar su casa para una mejor comodidad  y comprar más terrenos para cultivar.
texts.en:
Raquel is 44 years old and has ten children (six boys and four girls).  She has a partner and they live in the municipality of Sololá.

Raquel and her partner make a living in agriculture (growing onions) and selling vegetables.  They have been doing this for over 30 years and through it they have earned most of their income to support the family.  They do this work as their grandparents taught them the trade.

Raquel is applying for a loan of 5,000 Quetzal for working capital for carrot crops.

Raquel's dream is to renovate her house so that it is more comfortable and to buy more land to work.

loans.use: to invest in her carrot crops.

loans.name: Juan Ferney

texts.es:
Ferney de 25 años de edad, es un gran visionario. Su mayor sueño es crear su propia empresa y que sea reconocida dentro del sector. 
Desde hace tres años aprendió a elaborar blanqueador y fragancias gracias a un taller de emprendimiento realizado en su localidad, razón por la cual decidió dedicarse a la fabricación y venta de sus productos en su municipio. Gracias a la buena demanda que ha tenido, se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará botellas de plástico y etiquetas, lo que le permitirá aumentar el nivel de producción y generar mayores ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es crecer y comenzar a comercializar su producto en los diferentes municipios de Antioquia.
texts.en:
Twenty-five year old Ferney is a visionary.  His big dream is to create his own business and to be known in his field.

Three years ago Ferney learned to produce bleachers and fragrances in a workshop run in his town and so he decided to produce and sell these products in the municipality.  Thanks to strong demand, Ferney is applying for a loan to buy plastic bottles and labels, which will allow him to increase production and generate a higher income.

His dream is to grow and begin to sell his products in different municipalities in Antioquia.

loans.use: to buy plastic bottles and labels.

loans.name: Reina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reina, solicita un nuevo préstamo para mejorar su negocio de venta de pupusas, ya que los créditos son una fuente financiera que ayudan a optimizar los ingresos. Este le permitirá comprar tomates, maíz, chicharrón, frijoles, cebolla, repollo, entre otros insumos para elaborar las pupusas.
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar las ventas y con ello aumento la clientela. Las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado y al igual las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Reina is requesting a new loan so that she can improve her business of selling pupusas. The loans have been a financial resource that has helped with optimizing her earnings. This loan will enable her to buy tomatoes, corn, pork skins, beans, onions, cabbage, and other supplies for making pupusas.

Her previous loan allowed her to improve her sales and increase her clientele. Her family’s circumstances have become optimal, as well as her financial condition.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, corn, pork skins, beans, onions, cabbage, and other supplies.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
This loan will help Claudio expand his farming business. 

Claudio grew up farming in Mexico, but when he moved to the U.S. over 20 years ago he worked in factories and warehouses to pay the bills. However, the single father of four never lost his passion for farming and seven years ago he rented a plot of land in upstate New York and began his own business, Gonzalez Farm. 

Years later, Claudio now grows over 50 types of vegetables throughout the year and sells at six different markets and three separate CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) groups throughout New York. Claudio hopes to continue to expand his business so that one day he can support his family solely from the farm’s profits and will not have to continue working in factories for additional income. 

 He operates his business out of one greenhouse and hopes that he will be able to build at least two more within the year. The loyal father is now paying for his two oldest daughters to go to college while supporting his two youngest in middle school. He hopes to one day pass his business on to his children. 

This loan will allow Claudio to purchase more seedlings in order to expand his production and to offer new products to his clients. The loan will also help Claudio attracts more clients by allowing him to pay for labor costs at new markets.

loans.use: to purchase transplants and seedlings and to pay for labor costs in new markets.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es: Don fidel de 45 años de edad tiene un molino en su lugar de residencia tiene 10 años de tener ese negocio, vive con su compañera de vida y su hija en casa propia, trabaja de lunes a domingo y tiene mucha clientela especialmente las señoras que hace tortillas pues ahi llegan a moler el maiz, con las ganacias que obtiene ha sacado adelante a su familia y a podido mantener en pie su negocio del molino, Don fidel quiere mejorar su vivienda pero no tiene capital para poder realizarlo ya que con lo que gana no alcanza para cubrir ese gasto por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar los materiales que necesita para poder contruir su casa y poder tener a parte su negocio y su vivienda y asi puedan vivir mejor como familia.
texts.en: Fidel is 45 years old and he lives with his lifetime partner and their daughter in a house of their own. He owns a mill that is located in his house, and he has been engaging in this activity for 10 years. He works Mondays t Sundays and he has many customers, particularly women who go to his house to mill the corn they need to prepare tortillas. Thanks to the income he earns he has succeed in providing for his family, as well as succeeding in keeping his mil running. Fidel wants to make improvements to his house but lacks the money he needs to pay for them, as his income is not enough to cover these expenses as well. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy the materials he needs to have his house built, separating his mill form his house so that his family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando originally came from Peru. He is a truck driver, but has also developed interactive educational software in Spanish, which provides theoretical, mechanical, and practical education, allowing users to pass the test for class A and B commercial driver’s licenses (CDL). This license allows the bearer to operate heavy trucks, passenger buses, school buses, and tractor trailers. 

In addition to his regular job as a truck driver, Armando has been teaching, preparing and helping students to get this license. Armando’s product will make it easier to obtain a license and a job for Hispanics who do not have the financial resources needed to invest in a conventional class. After obtaining his own license, facing the high cost of tuition and language barriers, Armando decided to develop an alternative, inexpensive method of preparation for the CDL exam. The Kiva loan will be used to help Armando to finish, produce, and sell the product. 

Armando is married with grown children, and his wife is helping him in this new venture.

loans.use: to produce and sell Interactive Educational Software.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
This loan will help Carlos purchase equipment to modernize his film and TV production company.

Originally from the Dominican Republic, Carlos has always been passionate about film and the production industry. After working for the Spanish television network Univision and gaining many contacts in the Miami area, Carlos began his own business—CC Productions of Miami Inc., a film and TV production company, in 2011. His business produces commercials, novellas, and television shows in conjunction with major Latin American channels in the U.S. and abroad. 

With the film industry’s growth in Miami, Carlos now needs a loan to purchase new equipment in order to keep up with the increasing demand. Carlos has two part-time employees, and he hopes that his business can continue to grow so he can employ more individuals and further contribute to his local Miami community. 

View Carlos’ website here: http://www.ccproductionsofmiami.com/

loans.use: to purchase a camera, Macintosh computer, and software for editing.

loans.name: Philice

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Philice resides in Kitale with her husband and four children. She has practiced mixed farming for three years, producing eggs, milk, and maize.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.80,000 to purchase more poultry for her business. More poultry means more egg production and thus an increase in income and this will improve their standard of living. Her future plan is to have one thousand poultry birds and two dairy cows for more generation of family income.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos resides in Kitale, Rift Valley. He has two children. He has been in farming for five years, dealing with milk and eggs.

He has requested a loan of KES 60,000 for the purchase of poultry which will produce more eggs and thus by sale of the eggs, there will be improvement in the family business. He plans to have four thousand poultry birds and a motorbike for generating more family income. His major challenge is the diseases that affect poultry.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en: Damascene is 43 years old. He is a father of four children and they all go to school. His wife is a businesswoman and he has been in his business for 13 years. With the loan, he wants to add more types of shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 53 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y sorgo y la cosecha que recoge la va almacenando en los graneros que aparecen detras de Don Jorge en la foto. Don Jorge desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso  solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jorge is 53 years old, and he is a very responsible men when it comes to his family obligations, as giving the best to his children is one of his main characteristics. He currently lives with his wife and their 4 children. He is a hardworking person, always putting joy and enthusiasm in his job. He is a farmer and he plants corn and sorghum, and he stores his harvests in the granaries you can see at his back in the picture. Jorge would like to increase his sales and for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers and pesticides. He wishes to count on the loan he is requesting because he has no other sources of income, and this economic support will help him keeping on providing for his family with no limitations.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a resident of Kitale. He is twenty-seven years old, married, and has four children. He has been a farmer for seven years selling milk, maize and eggs. Besides farming, he has a motorbike business.

He has requested a loan of KES 90,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for the purchase of poultry. By the sale of eggs he will be able to pay school fees and improve the family business. In future, he wishes to have three thousand poultry birds and a posho (cornmeal) mill. The major obstacles are diseases and feed shortage.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther resides in Kitale. She is married and has three children. She has practiced farming for five years, producing milk and eggs for the local market.

She has requested a loan of KES 41,600 from Juhudi Kilimo for purchasing a dairy cow. Investing in a dairy cow will increase the production of milk and thus lead to a higher income which will improve her family's business and their living standards. She plans to buy four dairy cows and be the main supplier of milk to the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 38 years old, is married and has been blessed with six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Eunice has operated a business of selling dried fish and household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She mentioned competition and inadequate working capital as her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and bales of dried fish for resale. Eunice joined Yehu because of its responsive attitude to customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and bales of dried fish for resale

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik is a 21-year-old student from Aygestan village. She studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University.

Shushanik lives with her parents and is the only child in the family. Her parents work hard to earn income and cover the family's basic costs so it is very difficult for them to save money for Shushanik's education.

Shushanik has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition. The loan is very important for her to complete her education and ensure a better life for her parents.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice resides in Kitale and is married. He has been farming for five years producing milk, eggs and maize.
He has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase poultry. He says that by selling poultry products he will be able to improve the family business. He wishes to have one thousand birds and three dairy cows to allow for a greater family income. His main challenge is food shortages.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Conjesta

texts.en:
Conjesta is a resident of Kitale, where she resides with her four children. She has been a farmer for five years producing milk, eggs and maize.
She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 for purchasing poultry. This will increase egg production which will help improve the family business. She wishes to have two thousand poultry and three dairy cows to generate more family income. Her main challenge is diseases affecting the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to increase egg production.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 31 years old and she is married with children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and now she is applying for her second loan of $1.000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as milk, fish, salt, books, pans, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that they offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy milk, salt, fish, bread, books, pans, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick resides in Kitale in the Rift Valley. He is married. He has been farming for eight years producing milk, eggs and maize.
He has requested a loan of KES. 70,000 for purchasing poultry. He believes that through the sale of eggs his family’s business will improve. He plans to have two thousand poultry and be the main egg supplier at the local market. His main challenge is the diseases which affect poultry.

loans.use: to purchase poultry for egg production.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is 28 years old and lives in Samburu, Kenya. She is married and has four children aged between 2 and 9 years of age. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For over four years, she has operated a posho mill machine, grinding maize for flour. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.
With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase a motorcycle to diversify with a transport business. 
She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to diversify into a transport business.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Batchimeg is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family began living in their own house when she purchased it in 2005. Her husband has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her son is a driver at a private business entity. She herself has been working as a nurse at a privately owned hospital for six consecutive years. Since the day she purchased her house, the house has never received any repair and update. So she is requesting a loan of 6,900,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, fiber glass and cements. Using those materials, she can repair her house thus enabling her family to live in a more comfortable and warm place. More importantly, the renovated house will preserve heat efficiently, needing less coal for fuel, and as a result emit less smoke and that will contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as planks, bricks and fiberglass to repair her home.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita is a 48-year-old widowed mother. She was gifted with six children and they live happily in a rural community. She owns and manages a small beauty parlor beside the public market. Being a kind and friendly mother, she has been able to win more customers. In this regard, she aims to improve her parlor and provide better services to her customers. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 7,000 to buy cosmetics and other materials needed in the beauty parlor. She believes that this financial assistance will help her improve the business and hopes that she will make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other materials needed in her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Mt Meru Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her mid-30s, is single with two kids (a boy and a girl) who are both in school. She has had a grocery business selling soft drinks, water, beer and spirits. She has been in this field for a period of four years and through this work Janeth is able to cover all her family's  basic needs together with school fees. She works from 3 p.m. to midnight daily and she is able to make a good profit every month.

This is Janeth's 17th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she managed to purchase more business stock and opened a new business branch in another place. With the profit received, she paid home expenses and school fees for her kids together while also reinvesting back into her project. She plans to expand her business. She will use this loan to restock more drinks with new brands. She dreams to build a nice house . 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mt Meru, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan .

loans.use: to restock drinks and expand her selections.

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: Don Jose vive con su esposa y su hija de 1 año de edad, se dedica a la agricultura siembra los principales granos basico como: maiz y frijol y tambien tiene cosecha de yuca, él comercializa sus productos con los comerciantes de su lugar de residencia y con las ganacias que obtiene de las ventas ha salido adelante con su familia, ahora él esta solicitando un credito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para sus cosechas como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, entre otras cosas y asi darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cosechas de maiz, frijol y yuca, y seguir obteneindo mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Jose lives with his wife and their 1-year-old daughter. He is a farmer and he plants the main kinds of basic grains such as corn and beans, and he also plants yucca. He sells his products to traders of his community, and provides for his family thanks to what he earns from selling his products. He is currently requesting a loan to buy everything he needs for his crops such as manure, fertilizers an seeds, in order to provide better care to his corn, beans and yucca crops, as well as to keep on increasing his earnings in order to offer a better economic stability to his family.

loans.use: To manure, fertilizers an seeds.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is married and has three children attending school. His wife is engaged in a retailing business, while Reynaldo runs a business raising hogs for breeding. Reynaldo started the business with four head of hogs for fattening. When he realized that his earnings were insufficient to sustain his children's needs in school, he decided to grow hogs for breeding. Now, Reynaldo has five heads of pigs for breeding in addition to the hogs he fattens. 

Reynaldo's greatest dream in life is for his children to finish their college education. He works hard to respond quickly to his children's needs. In this regard, Reynaldo is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. He is doing his best for the continued growth of the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a 46-year-old married woman and mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She has a food-vending business selling home cooked foods to the people in her area. She is also farms with her husband.

Lucrecia is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients like flour, meat, and seasonings. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and earnings.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients like flour, meat, and seasonings

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, 48, lives in Samburu, Kenya. She is married to Mwachende, who is a businessman, and they have five children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam operates a food stall business, cooking food and selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenges of stiff competition and the high cost of food for her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the business. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase utensils, chairs and wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She joined Yehu because it is responsive to customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, chairs and wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one semester's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Deo-Gratias Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DEO-GRATIAS est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Séraphine est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Victorin. Séraphine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Séraphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Séraphine vend depuis dix ans, du maïs et du poisson à son domicile. Séraphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Séraphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DEO-GRATIAS, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Deo-Gratias group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Seraphine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Seraphine is 31 years old and married to a certain Victorin. Seraphine did not go to school. The couple has four children, of whom some go to school and all are under their care. Seraphine lives together with her husband and children. The couple shares the household expenses. 

To contribute to her various family needs, Seraphine has been selling corn and fish from her home for ten years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. This business allows her to meet her [family's] needs without much difficulty. In the quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and earnings, Seraphine is asking, together with the other members of the Deo-Gratias group, for a fourth loan with Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy corn and fish

loans.name: Clerence

texts.en:
Clerence is appyling for a second loan to support his last semester of studies at Maharishi Institute. He will graduate in December 2013. When asked about his progress since the first Kiva loan, Clerence reports:

"I have been doing pretty well on the academic side. I have passed all the subjects I did since I joined MI. Since I got the first Kiva loan, it has been helpful to me because I am able to come to school every day with no stress or money problems."

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nievel

texts.en:
Nievel is appyling for a second loan to support his last semester of studies at Maharishi Institute. He will graduate in December 2013. When asked about his progress since the first Kiva loan, Nievel reports:

"Since the first loan I have accomplished to further my studies. Now I'm busy with my Business Administration degree. I'm doing Business Communication."

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa is coming to Yehu again for another Kiva loan of Kes 50,000. With the loan, she wants to purchase retail shop goods like wheat flour, maize flour and rice. Her previous loan had a great impact as she was able to increase her monthly profits. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the near future. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase retail shop goods like wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Gatama

texts.en: Gatama is 38 years old. He sells shoes and has been selling shoes for the past 12 years. He is very experienced businessman; he would like to request the loan to buy more shoes for sale while he continues to make more shoes to earn more. He has been successful with the previous loans which helped his stock to increase in volume of shoes sold. The profits from the business will be used to buy more land for use.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Glendi

texts.es: Glendi es madre de dos niños, ha trabajado en restaurantes en los últimos dos años, lo cual le ha permitido adquirir experiencia en el negocio de venta de comidas. Actualmente le ofrecen la oportunidad de tener un negocio propio dedicado a la venta de batidos (bebidas eleboradas a base de frutas), actividad que en la región es muy acogida por la población, ella nos comenta que esta es una manera de obtener mejores ingresos y salir adelante con  todos los gastos del hogar. La alegría de Glendi según nos comenta ella se debe a que este ha sido su sueño de siempre, el de tener su negocio propio.
texts.en: Glendi is mother to two children. In the past two years, she has worked in a restaurant which has given her experience in the business of food sales. Currently, she is being given the opportunity to have her own business selling smoothies (drinks made from fruits), an activity that is very well received by people in the area. She tells us that this is a way in which she can make better income and cover all the household expenses. As Glendi tell us, she is very happy because this has been her lifelong dream: to have her own business.

loans.use: to buy a smoothie-maiking franchise (a fruit-based drink).

loans.name: La Grace De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA GRACE DE DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Chantal Clotilde, âgée 45 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Chantal Clotilde ne vit plus avec son mari. Chantal Clotilde a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Les enfants ne sont plus à la charge de Chantal Clotilde. Chantal Clotilde vit seule et fait face à ses besoins seule. Chantal Clotilde a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Chantal Clotilde exerce cette activité depuis près de vingt cinq ans. Parallèlement, Chantal Clotilde vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Chantal Clotilde désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Chantal Clotilde sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA GRACE DE DIEU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The La Grace de Dieu group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Chantal Clotilde, is 45 years old and is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. She has three children, who all go to school. She no longer lives with them [though, nor] her husband. She lives alone and must take care of herself. She stopped school at the secondary level and went on to learn to be a hairstylist. 

Chantal Clotilde has been a hairstylist for almost 25 years. At the same time, she [also] sells hair extensions and cosmetics in her shop. This allows her to meet her needs without too much difficulty. 

In order to better serve her customers, Chantal Clotilde wants to build up her business. To do this, she is asking, with the other members of the La Grace de Dieu group, for their first loan with Alide.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Akouegnon 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKOUEGNON 2 est formé de deux personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Dina, âgée de 39 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Dina est mariée à Jacob. Le couple à quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Dina vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Dina et Jacob assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Dina a fréquenté jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de dix huit ans que Dina vend des chaussures à son domicile et ce par la technique de distribution; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Dina désire acheter des chaussures pour renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Dina sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKOUEGNON 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Akouegnon 2 group is made up of two people who live together. The representative of this group, who is named Dina, is 39 years old and is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Dina is married to a Jacob. The couple has four children, all who go to school and are under their care. Dina lives with her husband and children. Together Dina and Jacob take care of their different household expenses. Nina attended school until the secondary level. 

It has been almost 18 years now that Dina has been selling shoes from her home. This form of sales has allowed her to respond without great difficulty to the needs of her family. In order to better respond to the needs of her customers, DIna wants to buy shoes to increase her business. To do this, Dina is asking, together with the other member of the Akouegnon 2 group, for a second loan with Alide. Their first loan was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge de 43 años de edad, es un hombre humilde al que le ha tocado guerrearse la vida a fin de generar el sustento para vivir. Por su bajo nivel educativo el subempleo fue su única opción para generar ingresos. Se dedica a prestar el servicio de reparación de sombrillas, electrodomésticos y a la venta de detergentes, labor que realiza diariamente recorriendo las calles de su localidad en búsqueda de nuevos clientes. 
Su mayor sueño es fortalecer su negocio en la venta de detergentes y dedicarse a esta actividad tiempo completo, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compasa de insumos para su elaboración. 
Asegura que su mayor dificultad es caminar arduas horas bajo el sol, situación que le ha produce dolores de cabeza continuos, por lo cual desea adquirir un local, pero es conciente que esta será un proyecto a mediano plazo. 
Su familia es su mayor motivación y la razón por la que busca mejorar su condición económica y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
43 year old Jorge is a humble man and he has had to fight to generate enough livelihood to survive. Because he has little education, working in the informal sector has been his only option to generate income. He has worked offering repair services for umbrellas and electrical goods and selling detergents. He does this work everyday, traveling the streets of his area in search of new clients. 
His greatest dream is to strengthen his business selling detergents and work full-time on this activity and so he is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making them.
