His greatest difficulty is walking long hours under the sun, which has given him continuous headaches. For this reason, he wants to get a stall. But, he knows that this is a medium-range goal.
His family is his greatest motivation and the reason why he is looking to improve his economic condition and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make detergents.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita, de 30 años, es una mujer muy risueña, carismática y emprendedora, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a sus padres y su hermana, diariamente trabaja para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Sarita se dedica a la venta de comida como guisos, arroz chaufa, Juanes , chorizos y diversos platos típicos que caracterizan la comida peruana.  Tiene su puesto de ventas instalado en un reconocido centro turístico de la ciudad. Su labor empieza en su casa desde muy temprano con la preparación de los potajes que luego traslada hasta su punto de ventas, todo culmina cerca de las 4 de la tarde y se traslada a su casa para descansar luego de su ardua jornada. Empezó en este negocio hace 10 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana. Le gusta mucho su trabajo por varios motivos, uno de ellos es la ganancia económica que percibe por ello, otro esta orientado a la alegría y el continuo movimiento comercial que hay a diario en el sector donde trabaja y finalmente le agrada observar continuamente el paisaje y la naturaleza ya que su puesto de ventas está ubicado al borde de una de las lagunas mas hermosas de su pueblo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600 soles para comprar utensilios y ingredientes como arroz, carnes y condimentos con los que prepara sus comidas.
texts.en:
30 year old Sarita is a smiley, charismatic, and hard working woman. She is single and does not have children. She lives in her own home along with her parents and her sister. She works everyday to improve her quality of life. 
Sarita works selling food such as stews, fried rice, Juanes (a dish of rice, chicken, and hard-boiled eggs), chorizos, and various other typical dishes that characterize Peruvian cuisine. She has a stall in a well-known tourist center in the city. She begins work in her house very early with the preparation of the stews which she later takes to the point of sale. Everything finishes around 4 in the afternoon and she goes home to rest after her hard work. 
She began in this business 10 years ago and works with the help of her sister. She very much likes her work for various reasons, one of them being the income that she makes from it,  another being the joy she gets from the work and the continuous busyness of the area where she works, and, finally, she likes to continually observe the scenery and nature as her stall is located next to one of the most beautiful lagoons of the town. 
She is requesting $250 to buy utensils such as rice, meat, and condiments, with which she will prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients such as meat, rice, and condiments.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 62 años de edad,es viuda y vive en su casa propia con su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieto.El trabajo que realiza Nelly es la venta de repuestos de motos y mototaxi, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa. Su tienda es una de las más concurridas de la localidad. Lleva en esta actividad un promedio de 25 años de edad el cual inició con su difunto esposo, Actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo y su nuera para la atención al público, además de un ayudante a quien paga  semanalmente para realizar los trabajos pesados de carga de cajas, atención al público y otros.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el ingreso económico que le permite mantener  su hogar . En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 2500 soles, se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que viene recibiendo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos de motos y mototaxis al por mayor, como llantas, faros y cascos de manejo.
texts.en:
62-year-old Nelly is a widow.  She lives in her own home together with her eldest son, daughter-in-law and grandson.  Nelly's business is selling spare parts for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.  She has a specially-adapted space for this business within her own home.  Her store is one of the busiest in town.  Nelly has been in this line of work for approximately 25 years and started her business together with her late husband.  She currently has the help of her son and daughter-in-law in serving her customers.  She also has the help of a member of staff who she pays weekly to carry out heavy work such as loading crates, serving customers, etc.  What Nelly likes about her work is that it makes her income with which she is able to support her household.

On this occasion, Nelly is requesting a loan for 2,500 soles.  She feels very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  She will invest the sum she has requested in buying spare parts wholesale for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.  She will buy items such as tires, headlamps and driving helmets.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis such as headlamps, tires, etc.

loans.name: Maria  Trinidad

texts.es:
Maria Trinidad, 38 años de edad, es de la comarca Las Canoas, casada, tiene  una hija de 20 años quien está estudiando una carrera técnica de cajera también tiene dos hijos varones de 14 y 13 años quienes estudian la secundaria y un niño de 4 añitos de edad y una hija adoptiva. Maria tiene una pulpería donde  vende de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, pan y snacks aquí en su casa de habitación, negocio que inicio hace 1 año con dinero propio, ya que el marido quien trabaja como operador de máquinas de soldar le dieron una liquidación la cual  entre los dos decidieron invertir un poco en el negocio que hoy es la pulpería, recibe mucho el apoyo de su hija además recibe siempre el apoyo económico de su marido quien trabaja siempre como operador de máquinas de soldar.
 
Maria dice que poco a poco ira ampliando más su pulpería  hoy solicita este crédito ya que quiere surtir un poco más su venta comprando camisetas chinelas, gaseosas, jugos pollo, arroz, azúcar para reforzar un poco más su pulpería. Maria también dice que con este nuevo crédito que obtenga podrá levantar un poco más la venta ya que hace falta dinero para invertir pulpería pues desea convertirla en una miscelánea bien surtida de nuevos productos comestibles y para el hogar.
texts.en:
38 year old Maria Trinidad is from the region Las Canoas, She is married, has a 20 year old daughter who is studying a technical course, and also has two boys who are 14 and 13 years old who are in secondary school, and one little boy who is 4 years old, and an adopted daughter. Maria has a grocery store in her home where she sells rice, sugar, beans, ham, bread, and snacks. She started this business one year ago with her own money as her husband, who was working as a welding machine operator, received a settlement payment. Together, they decided to invest a little in what became their grocery business. She has had a lot of support from her daughter in addition to always receiving economic support from her husband who always works as a welder. 
Maria says that, little by little, she is going to grow her store. Today, she is requesting this loan so that she can supply her store more and buy t-shirts, slippers, sodas, juices, chicken, and rice to bolster her store a little more. Maria also says that, with this new loan, she will be able to increase her sales a little as she has lacked the money to invest in groceries and she wants to turn the store into a well-supplied general store that has new edible products and home goods.

loans.use: to buy shirts, slippers, soft drinks, juices, chicken, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Willian René

texts.es:
Willian es un señor de 28 años esta casado y tiene 1 hijo quienes viven en Sololá.
El se dedica a la compraventa de Implementos Deportivos  como también confecciona prendas de vestir siempre relacionado a lo deportivo. Lleva 10 años realizando este tipo de negocio ya que le genera ingresos aceptables y los vende en el mercado local de donde vive.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 9,000.00 para comprar una maquina de estampado en productos como plástico y cristal.
Su sueño  es tener otro local para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Willian is a 28 year old man who is married and has one son. He and his family live in Sololá.
He works trading sporting goods and also makes sporting clothes. He has been working in this sort of business for 10 years as he can make a reasonable income and he sells in the market near where he lives.
He is requesting a loan of $1175 to buy a machine that can print on products such as plastic and glass. 
His dream is to have another branch so he can grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a machine that prints on products such as plastic and glass.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran, who is from the village of Arjut in the Lori region, studies at the Vanadzor branch of Armenian State Agrarian University. Along with his studies, Tigran is involved in cattle breeding, keeping cows, sheep, pigs, chickens, turkeys and four colonies of bees. Tigran lives with his parents and works hard to sustain their living.

Since the main source of family income is agriculture, and the only breadwinner of the family is Tigran, it is very difficult for him to save money for his education. He has therefore requested this loan to pay for his university tuition. This very important loan will help him to complete his education and enlarge upon his agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en: Ebrahim is a 29 years old. He is a married man and has one child who lives in a bad situation in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a teacher who has received a low salary for the past five years. He has applied for a youth loan of 259,999.92 YER from AMB to purchase furniture and a bed. Purchasing these items will improve his standard of living. He is responsible, honest, and hardworking. He deeply cares for his child and contributes to his education by paying his school fees.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and a bed

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 41 years old. He is a cobbler and has been in this business for the past ten years. With this loan, he wants to buy more leather to use in making shoes. With the profits from the business, he will buy a house. He is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped greatly with his business.

loans.use: To buy leather to use in making shoes.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex operates a motorcycle transport business, transporting customers from door to door and also at the market. He also operates a vegetable selling business which is his other source of income. Especially during the rainy season it can be hard to operate his motorcycle transport business. 

With the Kshs 90,000 he wants to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business. Alex dreams of expanding and hiring more employees in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Maria Manuela nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 65 años de edad y es padre y madre para sus ocho hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ella tiene sus terrenos de cultivos donde siembre mayormente papa y ella lleva a vender la papa a la ciudad de Pilcopata y de regreso compra hoja de coca para luego venderlo en la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar hojas de coca.
texts.en:
Maria Manuela was born in Jajahuana community and still lives there.  Jajahuana community is located in Challabamba district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.

65-year-old Maria is both father and mother to her eight children.  She belongs to the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana community bank and is a responsible, entrepreneurial woman.  Her business is farming and raising livestock such as guinea pigs and hens.  She has farmland where she mainly grows potatoes.  She takes her potatoes to sell in the city of Pilcopata and, on her return, she buys coca leaf which she later sells in the city of Cusco.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy coca leaf.

loans.use: to buy coca leaf

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Ileana, originaria de la comunidad San Lorenzo en las afueras de Boaco, madre de 5 hijos de los cuales solo 1 estudia ella es de oficio agricultora, se dedica a sembrar chile desde hace 20 años. Esta actividad la inicio junto con su esposo, ya que él trabaja sembrando tomate, chiltoma, maíz, este oficio lo realiza junto con sus hijos. 
Hoy en día Ileana siembra chile de exportación tiene 2 años de dedicarse específicamente a este cultivo. Una de las cosas que más disfruta es que ha aprendido nuevas técnicas de siembra que le  han ayudado  a mejorar su producto. Cuando no está sembrando se dedica a la venta de leche. 
Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar gasolina para la bomba de riego , fertilizantes y abonos para sembrar chile. Pues parte de sus planes futuros es ampliar sus áreas de siembra de chile.
texts.en:
Ileana is from the community of San Lorenzo, on the outskirts of Boaco.  She is the mother of five children, only one of whom is in school.  Ileana is a farmer who has been growing chilis for 20 years.  She started the business together with her husband who also works growing tomatoes, chiltoma peppers and corn.  Their children also carry out this work.

Ileana is currently growing chilis for export.  She has been focusing on this particular crop for 2 years.  One of the things she most enjoys about her work is learning new growing techniques which help her to improve her product.  When she is not farming, Ileana sells milk.

Ileana is requesting this loan to buy gas for her irrigation pump.  She will also buy fertilizers and manure for her chili crops.  One of her future plans is to expand the area of land on which she grows her chilis.

loans.use: to buy gas, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 24 years old. She lives in the village of Dzegvi, in the Mtskheta district of Georgia with her husband Robinzon and two infant children (1 and 2 years old).  Tamar has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Her husband Robinzon works at the local supermarket as a warehouse worker and receives a small monthly salary. This is the only income for the family and it’s not enough to feed them especially when there are two infants in the house.
 
Tamar has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-start credits with easy conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products as they are considered “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Tamar will purchase 40 chickens and maize seeds. Robinzon will plant the maize on the small agricultural plot of land that they own. Tamar will look after the chickens and sell the eggs along with the harvested maize among the villagers and at the local markets. With the profit from this Tamar will be able to look after her children better.

loans.use: To purchase 40 chickens and maize seeds

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is from Baghramyan village in the Ararat region of Armenia. She studies at the Armenian State University in the Philosophy department and is in her last course of study.

Sona has requested a loan from SEF International last year to cover her university tuition of this final course.

Sona needs this loan to pay for her university tuition. The loan is very important for her to complete her education, find a good job and help her parents to sustain the family.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives in Samburu, Kenya. He is married and has been blessed with six children, four of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over ten years, Salim has operated a business of selling herbal medicine. He sells from home to those who are sick. He dreams of expanding his business and hiring people to help him in the business. 

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to purchase herbs for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of its favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase herbs for his business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged 32 years, lives in Samburu, Kenya. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a posho mill business for grinding maize for sale from home. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. Josephine dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase water pipes and a water tank to install piped water to establish a water distribution business. Josephine joined Yehu to save and access loans.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and a water tank to install piped water to establish a water distribution business

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha, aged 30, is married and has two children, only one of whom goes to school. A seller of shoes, Josepha has requested a loan to buy more shoes for sale, and she has already planned to reinvest the profits to improve her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old tailor. She is single. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the last three years. She also does embroidery to supplement her income. She earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Jane is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced recently by a KADET staff. She intends to use the loan to purchase more fabric materials and sewing threads. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and add more stock. Her hopes and dreams are to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric materials and sewing threads

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. Rubina owns and operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place.

Rubina is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, candies, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income. Rubina believes that through hard work and perseverance, she will be able to make her business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, candies, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha, 54 years old, lives in a small village in the Sachkere District with his wife, two children, daughter-in-law and mother. Gocha works as a truck driver and earns a small monthly income. His wife works as an accountant, and his mother is provided with a retirement pension. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Gocha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His requests were consistently rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Gocha's request for a loan from Credo to start a family business was approved within the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up loans with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the loan, Gocha will purchase a pig and a milking cow and start a husbandry business. He will sell piglets in the future. His wife will milk the cow and produce dairy products, which will be sold at local markets. This will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and a milking cow to start a husbandry business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Beatriz, quien con su anterior credikiva compró al por mayor y de contado materiales como caucho, fique, plantilla deportiva # 9 y tela para empaque, con lo  que fabricó el calzado que vendió oportunamente. Su credikiva le permitió aumentar su capital de trabajo, se incrementaron las ventas y así mismo su negocio tuvo más utilidades. Con esta motivación está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante Kiva,  para comprar en un mayor volumen caucho, fique, plantilla deportiva # 9 y tela para empaque y elaborar  el calzado que comercializará, a propósito del día internacional de las madres, época en la cual las mujeres, madres o que cumplen esa función, se reúnen,  reciben regalos y se visten elegantes para celebrar en familia, esta amorosa y digna labor. Así Beatriz no dudará en tenerles a sus clientes, los mejores diseños para que todas disfruten del calzado, que le han encargado y pasen las familias momentos muy satisfactorios al lado de sus seres queridos, mientras ella genera ingresos que benefician su hogar.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Beatriz who used her previous Kiva loan to buy materials such as rubber, fique fiber, insoles and packaging material wholesale and for cash.  She used these materials to make footwear which she later sold.  Her Kiva loan allowed her to increase her working capital, increase her sales and make more profit from her business.  Motivated by this experience, she is now applying for a new loan through Kiva.  She will use the new loan to buy larger quantities of rubber, fique fiber, insoles and packaging materials which she will use to make more footwear to sell for Mothers Day.  This is a time of year when women and mothers get together, receive gifts and dress up to celebrate the loving and worthy work they do, together with their families.  Beatriz will have the best designs available for her customers so that they can all enjoy the footwear that they have ordered from her and have a wonderful time together with their loved ones.  Beatriz, meanwhile, will make income which will benefit her household.

loans.use: to buy rubber, fique fiber, insoles and packaging material

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 34 years old. She lives in the Chiatura district with her husband, brother, aunt and retired grandmother. Marine requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a plot of land. On the land different kinds of vegetables are grown. They milk the cow to make cheese and sell it with the harvested products locally at the markets. Marine’s husband works at the railway station and her aunt is trading with fruits and vegetables. They both get small monthly salaries, which is not enough to feed a five-member family. 

Marine requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Marine will start trading with clothes. She will go to Turkey, purchase clothes at the wholesale price and bring them to her district. She will be selling clothes among her villagers with a price markup to earn a good profit. She will reinvest part of the profit in their field and bring home more clothes in order to develop the business. Another part will be used for purchasing household goods and improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading with clothes.

loans.name: Cenit

texts.es: Cenit, de 52 años de edad, esta casada y vive en compañía de su esposo, sus dos hijos mayores y ayuda a cuidar a uno de sus nietos, su casa es propia.Cenit se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, agua mineral y bebidas energizantes. Ha consolidado su negocio en su propia casa y ahí atiende diariamente a todas las personas que acuden para saciar su sed. Su local de ventas lo comparte con un pequeño restaurante que le permite vender aun más bebidas y tener clientes a todo momento, sobre todo los fines de semana. Ambas actividades le generan ingresos económicos y los desarrolla a la par. Lleva en este negocio más de 5 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su cónyuge.Su trabajo le genera ganancias considerables por semana lo que le sirve para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y destinar otra parte al ahorro para alguna situación fortuita, es por ello que ha decidido continuar desarrollando este trabajo pero además desea implementar su negocio de comida y de esta manera espera que su economía se vea favorecida por el bien de su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 2000 soles, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará bebidas gasificadas, cervezas y agua mineral para aumentar la variedad y la calidad de los productos que ofrece a su clientela. Asimismo comprará todos los ingredientes necesarios para continuar con su negocio de venta de comida como pollos, arroz, huevos, aceites entre otros.
texts.en:
Cenit is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband, her two older children, and helps to care for one of her grandchildren in the home she owns.  

Cenit works selling drinks such as soda, beer, mineral water, and energy drinks.  Her business is located in her home and she opens every day to all the people who come to quench their thirst.  She shares her store with a small restaurant, which allows her to sell more beverages and have customers all the time, especially on weekends.  Both activities generate income and are equally developed.  She has been doing this work for more than 5 years and she works with the help of her husband. Her work generates substantial profits each week, which covers their basic needs.  Another part is saved for some fortuitous situation, which made her decide to continue improving her business.  She wants to implement her food business and hopes that her financial situation is favorable for the good of her family.

She is requesting 2,000 soles.  She is grateful to all the people who make her loan possible so that she can firm up her plans.  She promises to make her repayments punctually.  She will use the money requested to purchase soda, beer, and mineral water to increase the variety and quality of the products she offers to her customers.  She will also purchase all the necessary ingredients to continue with her food sales business such as chicken, rice, eggs, oil, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beers, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nokuthula

texts.en:
Nokuthula is appyling for a second loan to support her last semester of studies at Maharishi Institute. She will graduate in December 2013. When asked about her progress since the first Kiva loan, Nokuthula reports:

"I was able to come to school every day and not miss important lessons because of transport. The first loan has been very helpful."

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Thiselani

texts.en:
Thiselani is appyling for a second loan to support her last semester of studies at Maharishi Institute. She will graduate in December 2013. When asked about her progress since the first Kiva loan, Thiselani reports:

"I have been progressing since I started getting the Kiva loan, since I was sometimes struggling with money to come to school."

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Porter

texts.en:
Porter is appyling for a second loan to support her last semester of studies at Maharishi Institute. She will graduate in December 2013. When asked about her progress since the first Kiva loan, Porter reports:

"The Kiva loan helped me a lot because I've never been absent from school. It helps me to pay my transport fee."

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Golden

texts.en:
Golden is very pleased to have fully repaid his first Kiva loan. The loan helped him to grow his business, he was able to purchase a new computer to make his transactions much faster. Golden says the loan he got from Kiva also helped him to increase his profit margins. He has saved enough money from his profits to open two more shops in the Kawambwa and Kashikishi districts of Zambia.

Golden is taking out a second loan so that he can purchase two trading booths for his new locations. He has already trained two people to start working in the locations and is convinced that the two outlets will be successful, because there is a high demand for people to send and receive money safely. Expanding the business will help to improve Golden's standard of living. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To buy two trading booths.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and married to Veronica who contributes to the family income. They have three children, age 15, 7 and 6. He has been growing commercial crops for about seven years with an income of about KES 4,100 a month. His wife runs a food stall.

John is taking his first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy agrochemicals, seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to be a horticulture farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en: Placidie is 43 years old. She sells shoes and has been in the business for fifteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. She has been lucky with the last loan she got because it has helped in increasing the volume of shoes she has been selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mutiso

texts.en:
Mutiso is 44 years old and married to Monica, who contributes to the family income. He has been running his mechanic shop for about 11 years with an income of KES 4,000 a month. He also has a farm which the wife helps him manage. They have three children 15,13 and six years old. 

He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy spare parts for his shop and buy farm inputs. He hopes to be a leading mechanic in Oloitoktok.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old, has six grown up children and has a small business of raising hogs to sell in the future. Through her income, she was able to give allowances to her children when they were still studying. 

She is still hoping for healthy hogs to gain more income. Teresita is now asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustenance. She hopes to continue nourishing her hogs. 

She is hoping for continuous progress in her hog raising business to achieve a full-grown business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine appreciates the previous Kiva loan. For over eight years she has owned rental houses, and tenants are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of competition because of the increase in real estate investors. She dreams of expanding her real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cement and sand to add more real estate houses. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to add more real estate houses.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 50 years old, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband earns a living working as a driver. Hue supports her family through the income she earns from running a general store. She began this business fifteen years ago. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hue intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a variety of different goods such as sugars and cooking oils to sell to her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different goods such as sugars and cooking oils to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc is a 57-year-old woman. She has three sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living as a worker. Ngoc has been running a business selling clothes for twenty-six years. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: 02.04.02 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Dung is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has two dependents.

Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling nem chua (fermented cured pork). She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2011, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 02.04.02 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make nem chua.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make nem chua (fermented cured pork).

loans.name: Chung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhâm works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is 58 years old and married with one child. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the "01.05.11 Đông Sơn solidarity group". She lives with her one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Nhâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her child to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 56, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local company.

Thanh has been running a general store in front of her house for twenty years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different types of beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more different types of beverages to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Teli

texts.en:
Teli lives in Shaghap village in the Ararat region with her husband and 22-year-old daughter. The whole family is engaged in agriculture. They keep 4 cows, 5 calves, cultivate wheat, barley, tomatoes and onions and grow apricot trees. Teli milks cows and makes dairy products that her husband sells in the local market. They also work hard to gather a good harvest from their cultivation of the land. 

Realizing that agriculture helps them to have a stable income, Teli would like to expand her farm. She has requested this loan to purchase tomato seeds and to cover cultivation costs. This will enable her to increase cultivation and gather more harvest.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds and to cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 44, is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a business of making and selling jelly to the people in her community. She started this business 15 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of jelly-making ingredients to increase her production of jelly. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of jelly-making ingredients to increase her production of jelly.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

She has business of selling used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works six days a week. She generates additional income through a beauty salon. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves.

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: 3.1.270.02.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Đào  is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents because her children are grown up.

Đào  works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Đào has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Đào is the group leader of the 3.1.270.02.Thiệu Phú  solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Đào's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

With her business profit, Đào hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 40, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a mason. Phuong earns an income running a business of making and selling jelly to the people in her community. 

She started this business three years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy tools for making jelly and to pay for her child's school fee.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy tools for making jelly and to pay for her child's school fee

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti, aged 27, is a married woman and has been blessed with three children. They live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling cooked food to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenges of stiff competition as well as theft due to the lack of security in her place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a 49-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has eight children. The youngest child is 6, while the oldest is 21.

She owns and operates a variety store. She sells basic commodities like canned goods, noodles, soaps, toiletries and condiments. She has been selling basic commodities for two years already. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, soft drinks and dry goods. In the future, Anabelle would like to invest in another business to support her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell like canned goods, soft drinks and dry goods.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old and married with three children, aged 7, 5 and 2 years old. He has been managing his farm for about nine years with an income of approximately 4,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) a month. He also has a food stall, which is being operated by his wife.

He is taking a first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy farm inputs and foodstuffs for his food stall. He hopes to be a horticultural farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and foodstuffs for his food stall.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 40 years old. He is a married man and has three children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a teacher getting a low salary. He is trying to do everything so that his family will not need for anything.

Inadequate capital and inflation mean he may not achieve his children's desires. He intends to buy some things for his house, so he applied for a loan of 300,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy furniture to use for his house.

Because his salary isn't enough, he hopes to open a grocery store to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Maria, quien con su credikiva compró una máquina fotocopiadora y de inmediato sus ventas se incrementaron, porque los clientes se sintieron muy bien atendidos y regresaron. Como sus ingresos aumentaron, hizo mejoras locativas a su vivienda y esto la dejó satisfecha. Ella dice hoy a sus financiadores: “Estoy muy agradecida y deseo para ustedes y sus familiares muchas cosas buenas. “  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual hará adecuaciones en las instalaciones de  su negocio, para lograr un ambiente más confortable, por su mayor comodidad que finalmente atraerá  clientes y hará que esta inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Maria. With her Kiva loan she bought a photocopier and her sales increased immediately because her clients were pleased with the service and returned. Because her income increased, she was able to renovate her home. This left her feeling very satisfied. Today she says to her financial backers: “I am very thankful and I wish you and your families the very best." 

She is currently applying for a new loan that will be used to upgrade her business' facilities to create a more comfortable atmosphere. This way she will attract customers and will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to make upgrades to her business

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es: Ynes, de 62 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Ynes se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir como polos, faldas, blusas y camisas para niños y niñas así como también prendas interiores femeninas en diversos modelos, tallas y colores que se encuentran mas solicitados por sus clientes en cada temporada. Toda su mercadería lo distribuye entre sus vecinas y amistades. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 6 años y actualmente cuenta con muchos clientes gracias al trato personalizado y cordial que muestra cuando realiza sus ventas. Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico con el cual poder tener un sustento para su familia, se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos, tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1000, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad brindad de poder contar con un préstamo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos .Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa interior femenina en diversos modelos, tallas y colores para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en: Ynes is a 62 year old widow who lives with her two children in their own home. Ynes sells children's clothing such as polos, skirts, blouses and t-shirts as well as women’s undergarments in the different styles, sizes and colors that are in the highest demand for each season. She sells all of her merchandise to her neighbors and friends. She has been doing this for more than 6 years and, because of her personalized and friendly customer service, she currently has many customers . What she likes most about her job is that it generates an income with which she can provide for her family. She feels happy and satisfied as this work has helped her to overcome financial hardship. She wants to continue working and expand her business so she is requesting a loan for S/ 1000 to purchase more women’s undergarments in different styles, sizes and colors. She is very happy that she has been offered this opportunity and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase women's undergarments.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is a married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been operating a small grocery store for more than three years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Stephanie is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Stephanie hopes to expand their business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: 3.1.271.02.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vàn works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Vàn is 50 years old and she is married with two children. Vàn is the group leader of the 3.1.271.02.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent; another child is grown up.

This is Vàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Vàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vàn hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, cultivando maíz, frijoles y hortalizas; aprendió de sus padres esta labor.  Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en la ciudad que esta a 35 kilómetros y tarda dos horas y media el viaje.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar una bolsa de maíz y ocho quintales de fertilizantes. Con la inversión, comprar los insumos de una sola vez sin realizar tanto viaje ahorrándose tiempo y dinero. Además, de cosechar en el tiempo oportuno. Su deseo es que sus hijos estudien, comprar más terreno y cultivar más cantidad de hortalizas ya que en la zona donde vive es muy fértil en este cultivo.
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. Since his youth, he has made a living doing farm work: growing corn, beans, and vegetables. Maximiliano's parents taught him how to grow these crops. He buys the supplies he uses in the city, 35 kilometers (two-and-a-half hours) away.

Maximiliano is requesting this loan from Fundacion Campo in order to buy a sack of corn and eight hundred-pound bags of fertilizer. With this investment, he will purchase all of his supplies at once, saving himself the time and travel expenses of making multiple journeys. This loan will also let him plant all of his crops at the best time to do so.

Maximiliano's goal is to provide his children with an education, buy more land, and cultivate more crops since the area he lives in is very fertile.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn and eight hundred-pound bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es: Doña Braulia de 56 años vive en una casa que alquila con sus 3 hijos los dos hijos menores estudian actualmente y la hija mayor es quien le ayuda con el negocio ya que Doña Braulia se dedica a la venta de tortillas hechas de maiz asi como se muestra en la fotografia desde hace 5 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela vende de lunes a domingo y con las ganancias que obtiene logra sacar adelante a su familia, ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario como: maiz, leña, gas, entre otras cosas para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Braulia, age 56, lives in a rented house with her three children.  Her two youngest children currently go to school.  The older daughter is the one that helps her with the business.  

Braulia has been selling corn tortillas, as shown in the photograph, for five years.  She has her business at her house, and she has a lot of customers.  She sells Mondays through Sundays.  With the income that she gets she manages to get her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to allow her to buy everything that she needs.  She will buy things like corn, firewood, and gas, among other things.  She will do this in order to continue with her business and to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to make corn tortillas.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is 27 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Her husband is a good man, and he helps her with business. They have two children they love very much who are non-adults. They live together in a big house. Her husband’s parents also live with them.

She sells a variety of food items. She stores her merchandise in a local market. She acquires her products in shopping centers in the city. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way over 11 years ago because she needed to earn money.  As a result of the good results she is having, she wishes to increase her business by selling more food items. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy food items for increasing her working capital.

This is her first loan with IMON, and she promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, a 32-year-old seller of Pampers and soft drinks, is single and has no children. Her income is derived solely from the sale of drinks, which has enabled her to take care of herself.

Eunice's main challenge is the inability to buy enough drinks to meet customers' demand. She has therefore applied for a loan of 1,500 GHS (Ghana cedis) from ID-Ghana for this purpose. She will buy Pampers and Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Malta and fruit drinks.

Eunice aspires to having the biggest drinking spot in the area within the next two years, and graduating to the distribution of drinks to retailers.

loans.use: to buy enough Pampers and Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Malta and fruit drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Don Oscar de 55 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 24, 22, 15, 10 y 8 años de edad es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas ha podido salir adelante con su familia y solventar los gastos que se le presentan, Don Oscar esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra ya que es su unica fuente de trabajo con ese credito podra tener mejores ganancias y podra darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Oscar is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and five children ages 24, 22, 15, 10, and 8. Oscar is a farmer who has made a living growing corn and beans for many years. With his profits from the sale of these crops, he has been able to help his family get ahead and to pay the expenses that come up. 

Oscar is requesting this loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, compost, seeds, insecticides, and others. These are necessary items for his crops. Farming is Oscar's only source of income, so it is important for him to increase his earnings in order to provide his family with what they need.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (fertilizer, compost, seeds, etc.)

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 29 years old. He is married to a businesswoman, and they have one child, aged 3. He sells shoes and has spent five years in the business. With the loan, he would like to add more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es: Katiuska, de 28 años, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Katiuska consiste en la decoración de fiestas infantiles. Para ello compra diferentes muñecos, letreros decorativos, telas y otros accesorios que usa para desarrollar su labor. En ocasiones ella misma compra los materiales para elaborar todo lo necesario dependiendo del gusto del cliente, del motivo de la fiesta y de la edad de la persona a quien agasajará. Trabaja con ayuda de su hermana o su prima. Sus clientes llegan a ella por recomendación o por conocimiento del trabajo que realiza. Tiene buen gusto para armar figuras llamativas y eso se refleja en todo el ambiente que crea en los eventos que trabaja. Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 2 años y le va muy bien. Anteriormente vendía prendas de vestir a crédito pero la irresponsabilidad de sus compradores al momento del pago terminó por derrumbar su actividad.Ahora le va muy bien y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la satisfacción que siente al ver el rostro de sus clientes contentos por todo lo que puede crear aún en espacios pequeños, además es un trabajo muy flexible que le permite atender a su pequeño hijo, ahora quiere implementar su negocio con la compra de telas y sillas que se requieren en las fiestas para brindar un mejor servicio y generar otra ganancia por el alquiler de los mismos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 500, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará muñecos de corcho, adornos, telas, globos, siliconas y otros materiales que usa para decorar.
texts.en: Katiuska is 28 years old. She is married and has 2 small children who live with her in their own home. Katiuska decorates children’s parties for a living. To do this she buys different dolls, decorative signs, fabric and other accessories to decorate. On occasion she will buy custom decorations depending on what the customer wants, the theme of the party, and the age of the person. Her sister and her cousin help her. Her customers know her work or they have heard about her through word of mouth.  She has an eye for decorating and this is reflected in the atmosphere she creates for her events. She has been doing this for 2 years and things are going well. She previously sold clothing on credit, but she had too many customers who failed to pay her so she had to quit this activity. Things are going well for her now and the thing she likes most about her job is the satisfaction she gets when she sees the look on her customers’ faces when they see what she has created in small spaces. She also likes that this job is very flexible and allows her to take care of her youngest child. She now wants to buy fabric and chairs that she needs for her business in order to give her customers better service and generate more income by renting these items. She is requesting a loan of S/ 500. She is grateful to those who will make this loan possible and for giving her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her goals. With the amount requested she will buy cork dolls, ornaments, fabric, balloons, silicone decorations and other materials that she uses to decorate.

loans.use: purchase ornaments, cork dolls, balloons, fabric and silicone decorations.

loans.name: Karol Ninoska

texts.es:
Karol es una mujer de 32 años de edad joven, luchadora, emprendedora, soltera con un grado de educación secundario completo graduada de Perito Mercantil y Contador Publico y vive con sus padrastros y sus hermanos; pero no pudo continuar por falta de apoyo económico. Desde muy pequeña fueron ellos los que la apoyaron con sus estudios y en todo lo necesario para que ella pudiera sacar una carrera y tener un conocimiento estudiantil; como también fueron ellos los que le enseñaron la actividad de la agricultura la siembra y cultivo de pimienta y granos básicos como ser maíz frijoles y café.  Ella junto a su familia se dedican al cultivo y siembra de pimienta hace más de 6 años por lo que ha sido un negocio prospero para su familia durante mucho tiempo y lo sigue siendo en la actualidad. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por ella misma en las diferentes aldeas y zonas aledañas como también por medio de algunas instituciones privadas que le brindan el apoyo necesario para comercializar su producto en pequeña escala. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 50 metros de su casa de habitación por lo cual le permite mantener sus cultivos sanos y darles el debido mantenimiento.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para poder comprar productos especiales para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de pimienta ya que es delicado y su desafió es mantener sanos esta siembra.

Su meta es poder dar asistencia y el mantenimiento necesario a sus cultivos para poder sacar una excelente cosecha para los meses de agosto y septiembre ya que sus deseos son poder apoyar siempre a su familia de la misma forma como lo hicieron ellos.
texts.en:
Karol is a 32-year-old young woman. She is very hardworking and entrepreneurial. She is not married and has a high-school education from Perito Mercantil y Contador Publico. Karol lives with her stepfather, mother, and her siblings. Since she was young, her parents have supported her studies and taught her how to grow pepper and other basic plants such as corn, beans, and coffee. 

Currently, she works alongside her family growing pepper. For the last six years, this has been a profitable business for Karol. She sells her plants in neighboring towns and through some private institutions that offer her the support necessary to market her plants. She grows these plants 50 meters away from her house, so she is able to give them lots of attention.

Karol is requesting this loan in order to buy products that will help her pepper plants grow. Pepper is a delicate crop and she hopes to keep hers healthy. Karol's goal is to take good care of her crops so that they are plentiful and healthy come harvest time in August and September. She hopes to be able to support her family just as they have always supported her.

loans.use: to buy special products to help her pepper plants grow.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, a 42 year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Huong requests a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoos to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoos to stock her store

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger, de 47 años de edad, esta casado con Elita y vive en su casa propia en compañía de su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos.Roger se dedica a la venta de comidas principalmente menús como guisos y comidas regionales. Su negocio esta establecido en el frontis de su casa en una zona muy transitada lo cual le permite tener su clientela asegurada .Tiene una mesa y los utensilios necesarios para atender muy bien a sus clientes, al comienzo trabajaba él solo pero ahora recibe la ayuda de 2 personas más. Lleva en esta actividad 5 años y le va muy bien.Le gusta ese negocio pues comenta le gusta mucho cocinar, pues aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó los secretos de una buena sazón, con eso espera poder ganarse la preferencia y aceptación de sus clientes. Además tiene planes de crecer y en un futuro abrir un restaurante más grande en alguna zona comercial de su ciudad.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas como arroz, papa, aceite, condimentos y verduras.
texts.en:
Roger, 47 years old, is married to Elita and lives with her and their three children in their own house. Roger makes a living preparing and selling regional foods. His business is located in front of his home in a very busy zone, which guarantees him customers. Roger has a table and the necessary utensils to serve his customers. At first, he worked alone, but now he has the help of two other employees. Roger has been working in this business for five years and it has gone very well for him.

Roger is very happy with his business because he enjoys cooking, a skill he learned from his mother. He hopes the secrets she taught him will earn him a good reputation and loyal customers. Roger plans to expand his business in the future: to open a bigger restaurant in the shopping district of his city. 

Roger is requesting a loan of 800 Peruvian soles in order to keep working toward his goals. He will invest this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, potato, oil, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, potato, oil, and others.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old and married with four children, aged 18, 16, 12 and 7 years old. She has been managing her farm for about 10 years with an income of about 4,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) a month. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD., and she wants to use the loan to purchase more stock of farm inputs. She hopes to be a horticulture farmer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of farm inputs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, es casada y tiene dos hijos que estan en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona, Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja  como empleada por más de ocho horas al día y con lo poco que gana debe ayudar con los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de la operación de su hija y los gastos de hospital ya que tuvo que ingresarla de forma inmediata por un quiste en su estómago y la cliente no cuenta con efectivo.
El sueño de Teresa es mejorar sus ingresos y hacer construir más habitaciones para dar mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia , de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a Impro y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Teresa is married and has two school aged children. She lives in her own two bedroom brick home with a cement floor. The house is in the area of Alto Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

Right now, she works as a maid for more than eight hours a day. What little she earns is used to pay for food, education and basic utilities for her family. She is going to use the loan to pay for surgery and hospitalization expenses for her daughter. She had to hospitalize her because of a cyst she has in her stomach, and she has no cash.  

Teresa's dream is to improve her income and build two more rooms so her family will be more comfortable and safe. This way, she will improve her quality of life. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an operation to remove a cyst from her daughter's stomach.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en: Tai is requesting a new loan to expand his business by buying many kinds of products, such as detergents and cooking oils, to sell as a complement to his existing gas business. Tai's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business further, attract new customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products, such as detergents and cooking oils to sell

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is a 37-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two children. Hung and his wife earn a living running a store of drinking water, which they have done for four years. Hung would like to take loan to buy a greater quantity of drinking-water cans to stock his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan, his business will generate a higher income, help him to improve his family's living conditions, and enable him to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of drinking-water cans to stock his store.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao, 41, is married and has two children, a son and daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a worker at a local company. Dao has been running a business of selling soy milk to people in her community for 3 years.
She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of soybeans to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of  soybeans to stock her store and produce soy milk to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old and married with two children in school. She has been running her second hand clothing business for two years, earning an income of about 9,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) a month. She also has a grocery shop. 

Caroline wants to use the loan to buy more stock of second hand clothes for her business. She hopes to give her children a quality education and buy her own plot of land one day.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sung

texts.en: Sung is a 58-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Minh City. For the past six years, she and her husband have supported their family by running a business of selling sticky rice in front of their house. Sung would like to get a loan to buy a greater variety of foods such as rice, beans and meat to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of foods such as rice, beans and meat to better meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Lazara

texts.es: La Sra. Lazara trabaja como intendente de limpieza desde hace mas de 10 años, es casada y con 3 hijos ya casados. Ella siempre ha trabajado para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, ya que el  ganaba muy poco dinero en su trabajo. La Sra. Lazara siempre quiso darle lo mejor a sus hijos, se ocupó principalmente de que pudieran terminar la educación básica. Con los gastos en su familia y educación, Lázara y su esposo no habían tenido la oportunidad de arreglar su humilde vivienda. Actualmente sus hijos ya son independientes y es algo que a la Sra Lázara le da mucho orgullo. Ahora que no tiene que gastar en sus hijos, ella y su esposo han decidido comenzar a hacer algunos arreglos en su vivienda y han acudido a credituyo en busca de apoyo para su proyecto. Con el dinero del crédito, Lázara piensa adquirir materiales como cemento, arena y block para arreglar el cuarto de baño ya que tiene grietas y se moja cuando llueve y la temporada de lluvias está por venir en su localidad. A ella no le preocupan los gastos de mano de obra ya que su esposo con ayuda de sus hijos se encargarán de realizar el trabajo por sí mismos.
texts.en:
Lazara has worked as a manager of a cleaning company for over 10 years. She is married and has three children who are all married also. Lazara has always worked to help her husband with the family's expenses since his job does not pay very well. Lazara has always tried to give the best to her children, as a result, they all have a basic education.

With the expenses of daily life and putting their children through school, Lazara and her husband have neglected some needed repairs to their modest home. Lazara is very proud that her children are grown and independent. Now that she does not have expenses for her children, she and her husband have decided to begin to do some repairs around their home. They have turned to a Credituyo loan in order to finance this project. 

With this loan, Lazara plans to get materials such as cement, sand, and cinder blocks to remodel the bathroom that currently has many cracks and leaks water each time it rains. The rainy season is approaching so Lazara needs to do these repairs now. She is not worried about the cost of labor, since her husband will work with the help of her children to do the repairs themselves.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children, and six of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 17 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy vaccines, feeds and feeding utensils. Her major business challenges are transportation and poultry diseases. Her goals and aspirations are to own 4000 chickens and to buy a plot of land to expand her poultry houses. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feeds, vaccines and feeding utensils.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 52-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local company. Tuyet has been running a food stall for nearly four years. She sells sugar cane juice to people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of sugar cane and soft drinks to meet her customers' demand.
She hopes that through this loan she can earn more money with her current business and save an additional amount for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of sugar cane and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 71 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos; pero ya son independientes solo vive con ella un nieto de 18 años de edad y su compañero de vida.  Ella se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas, ya que de ahí obtiene el grano para su consumo y para la venta la otra parte. 
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizantes y una ternera para alimentarla con el rastrojo que le quedo de la cosecha anterior. Ella menciona que mientras tenga vida seguirá trabajando para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 71 years old.  She has a partner and three children, but they are now independent adults.  Currently living with her are her partner and one 18-year-old grandson.  Teresa makes a living doing agriculture work, which gives her food to eat and a product to sell.

She is applying for a loan from "Fundación Campo" to buy corn seeds, fertliser and a calf to feed with the leftovers from the last harvest.  Teresa tells us that she will continue to work to support her family as long as she lives.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertliser and a calf to feed with the leftovers from the last harvest.

loans.name: 3.1.272.01.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
Hương is 43 years old and she is married with 4 children.
Hương is the group leader of the 3.1.272.01.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.
Two of her children are grown up so Hương supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Hương’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. Darlyn is engaged in fishing, together with her husband for more than 6 years now. This is their source of income.
Darlyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Hangoma

texts.en:
Hangoma is 24 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her life partner is kind man, and they have a child. They live in the house her husband has succeeded in building thanks to his great dedication.
She is one of the successful business women of her village. She has been busy with selling clothes and perfumes. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop this business and improve their living conditions. She manages the business alone. She wants to develop the business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan of 7500 TJS to buy clothes and perfume to stock her store.
This is the loan she is requesting from IMON and she promises to make the payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes to stock her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is a 56-year-old woman with two daughters. Her husband is a mason and she lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a business selling clothes for two years. Huong would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract new ones. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and this will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 55-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. To support her family, Huong earns an income by running a general store. She started this business two years ago. 

Huong would like to take a loan to expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy a greater variety and quantity of foods and household items that will enable her to attract additional customers. 

Huong hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of foods and household items.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, aged 22 years, lives in Samburu, Kenya. She is married and a mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight months, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her products. Monica dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Wanjiku

texts.en: Wanjiku is a 51-year-old single mother with one child who is seven years old. She has been selling porridge for about six years and earns an income of approximately 4,000 KES a month. She is taking her first loan, of KES 10,000, from KADET LTD, and she wants to use it to buy wimbi (millet) flour, milk and sugar in bulk for making porridge. She hopes to open a hotel in the future and to give her child a quality education.
