loans.use: to buy wimbi (millet) flour, milk and sugar in bulk to use in making porridge..

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 50 years old. She is married and has five children. Only three of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for 19 years. With the loan, she will buy more bananas, rice and beans for resale, because these items are in demand these days. She would like to pay for the children’s school fees with the profits she makes from the business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 46, is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a driver. Thuy runs a business making and renting wedding clothes and accessories in front of her house. 

She started this business eight years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business to employ staff and buy materials to make more wedding clothes and accessories, to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to employ staff and buy materials to make more wedding clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 34 years old. She sells shoes and has been in the business for 16 years. She has requested the loan to add more styles of used shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: 3.1.273.01.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to use in meals she sells.
Hương is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Hương is the group leader of the 3.1.273.01.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.
Hương supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Hương’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that is of concern to her is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to use in her foodstall.

loans.name: 3.1.274.12.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
Tuyết is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Tuyết is the group leader of the 3.1.274.12.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.
Tuyết supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Tuyết’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Tuyết has been involved in this business for 6 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.
With her business profit, Tuyết hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 37 years old. She is married with four children, all of them go to school. She sells fish and has been in the business for ten years. She has requested the loan to buy more fish. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en: Hipolita is a 51-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has three grown children. She engages in farming, growing rice. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Her husband is also a farmer. She applied for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, pesticides and more rice seeds, to increase the volume of her harvest and her sales. In the future, Hipolita would like to expand her business to support her family, and also to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds to increase her harvest.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira sews wonderful national Tajik women's dresses. She is a 32-year old married mother of three children and her husband is a kind man who is a working migrant in Russia. They try their best to provide their children with all modern conveniences because they see that the fast development of the modern world makes their children more progressive. Zamira wants to provide them with a better quality of life and three years ago she began her own sewing business. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she started her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. 

Zamira now wants to build a new house as her old one is in bad condition. She does not have enough savings as she spends her money on providing her children with the things they need. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Tajik somoni (TJS) to buy building materials such as wood and cement. She promises to make her loan payments on time and she eagerly awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for a new house, such as wood and cement

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus has successfully paid back his previous loan, and his clothing and bags business is doing well. He managed to expand his stall and restock both the clothing and handbags section.
He has acquired a second loan of KES. 80,000 which will facilitate further expansion of his business by restocking his inventory of used clothing and handbags.  This inventory will also be used to setup similar stalls in Narok town.
He hopes to use the increased profits to purchase a motorcycle which will ease the transportation of his wares. He hopes to grow his business to a large clothing outlet, and to become a landlord as opposed to being a tenant.

loans.use: to restock his inventory of used clothing and bags.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 33 years old. She sells shoes and has been in the business for eight years. She has requested a loan for buying more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings. She is very happy with the last loan which helped in upgrading the business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members, her mother and father. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She earns additional income from selling charcoal. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, rice, beef, ground nuts, cooking oil, and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and fluctuating food prices. Her goals and aspirations are to open up a hotel in future, build her own house and also to educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, rice, beef, ground nuts, cooking oil and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Barakwa

texts.en: Barakwa  is a 36 year old businesswoman. She is married to Mustaf. They are blessed with two children. Barakwa has been selling clothes for the past four years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,700, which she uses to support her family. Barakwa is applying for her first loan term from KADET. She will use the loan to buy more shirts, skirts, blouses and trousers.  With the anticipated profits from the business, she will start saving for her children’s future school and plough the rest back into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a good, stable business.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, skirts, blouses and trousers for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 44 years old and married to Beatrice, who contributes to the family income. He has been farming for a period of the last four years with an income of approximately 4,750 KES (Kenyan shillings) a month. They have four children, aged 15, 12, 7 and 4 years.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD., and he wants to use it to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting. He hopes to expand his hotel and be a horticulture farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed, 36 years old, is a married man and has three children, in Sana`a, Yemen. He is distributor of mobile recharge cards who works to sell them in the local market. With this work, he has been able to earn income that has helped him cover personal expenses. He has completed his degree but has been forced to work in this field because he couldn`t find a job. His primary goal is to have a suitable store to expand his capital. He is currently applying for a loan of 199,999.92 YER from AMB to buy mobile recharge cards to increase his sales, and this will slowly allow him to grow his business and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy mobile recharge cards to increase his sales.

loans.name: Elsy Margarita

texts.es:
Elsy tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cinco hijos (tres varones y dos hembras); pero solo dos viven con ella. Ella junto a su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas y a la crianza de animales. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar dos terneras, para la crianza y engorde. Posteriormente las podrá vender a un mejor precio lo que le permitirá recibir ganancias mayores que le ayude al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Elsy, 51, is married and has five children (three males and two females) but only two live with her.  She and her husband make a living farming and raising animals.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two calves to raise and fatten.  Later she'll be able to sell them at a better price and earn more profit to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy to calves

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop that she rents at the market .She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, flour and rice, jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap. 

Her major business challenges are electricity and the fluctuating prices of commodities in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked shop and also to build rental houses. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, flour and rice, and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gulnora works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in Tajikistan; she has had this business for nine years and earns money in this way. 

Gulnora has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from the Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, she hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

Gulnora is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy children's clothes to widen her goods assortment. In this way, her house will be safer and her standard of living will improve, so that she will continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “To be [a] rich lady.”

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for widening the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, rice, snack foods and confectioneries,to stock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as sugar, rice, snack foods and confectioneries, to stock her general store

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Loi is requesting a new loan to purchase new furniture and a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store

loans.name: Jose Elvis

texts.es: Don Jose de 42 años vive en una casa que alquila con su esposa y su hija de 15 años quien estudia actualmente, él se dedica a la venta de verduras: tomates, cebollas, chiles y pollos ya que tiene una pequeña granja tiene 5 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio. Don Jose es un hombre responsable y trabajador con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventrar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, quiere hacer una nueva inversion pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas verduras y comprar lo que necesita para seguir criando a los pollo y asi seguirle dando una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Don Jose is 42 years old and rents a home with his wife and his 15 year old daughter who is currently in school. He makes a living selling vegetables: tomatoes, onions, chilies, and chicken, since he has a small farm and has been dedicated to this activity for 5 years, and so, he has gained a lot of experience in sales which helps him to make higher profits. The place where he sells his crops is strategic and is frequented by many people, and he already has a large clientele who prefer his produce because it is fresh and sold at a fair price. Don Jose is a responsible and hard working man and with the earnings he makes from his sales he has been able to settle all his household costs. He wants to make a new investment in his business, but he doesn't have enough money to do so, which is why he is asking for a loan that would allow him to purchase more vegetables and to purchase what he needs to raise chickens and to be able to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: purchase vegetables like tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento PIO XII  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varones,  la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Martha tiene 68 años,  casada con tres hijos que ya son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes y variedad de artículos ofreciendo sus productos de manera ambulante, ya tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes como  arroz, azúcar y fideo  por mayor para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra. Martha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, La Sra. Martha se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse, La Sra. Martha se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The bank PIO XII is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Mrs. Martha, who is 68 years old, married and has three children who are grown and independent. She makes a living selling a variety of basic necessities like groceries and a variety of items she sells as a street vendor. She already has customers that put in requests and this is her second loan in a sequence with this institution. Mrs. Martha will use this loan to purchase a variety of groceries like rice, sugar and beans in bulk in order to stock her business and to be able to offer a wider variety of items to her customers. Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business. Mrs. Martha will use the loan to continue purchasing products and improving her earnings as she has a lot of demand in this season. Her hope is to have her own store and to be able to provide a better service to her clients. Mrs. Martha is happy for the opportunity given her since this is the only economic activity that allows her to continue to support herself. Mrs. Martha is happy and grateful that this institution has given her so much support as well as for the support given to her partners. 

 .

loans.use: purchase groceries.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 29 year old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. Her husband earns a living working in a motor cleaning service. Thuy has been running a general store for 4 years. 
Thuy would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods, confectionery, and soft drinks to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and confectionery

loans.name: Assia

texts.en: Assia is 29 years old. She is married with one child. She works with her husband who sells shoes but for her she has decided to sell vegetables.  Assia now sells vegetables but in her previous loan she sold shoes together with her husband. With the loan, she will add more onions and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to create a savings.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 36-year-old married woman with six young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing and oyster business together with her husband for more than 15 years now. Elena is asking for a loan to buy screen nets, bamboo sticks, buckets and other materials for fishing. 

Through this loan, Elena will be able to improve their fishing business and make it sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy screen nets, bamboo sticks, buckets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Hussan Group

texts.en:
Hussan is a 40-year-old housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and five children. Her husband is a taxi driver, and this is the only source of income for their family. 

Currently, her husband is in need of money to change the tires of his taxi as the old tires are unusable now, and he can’t drive the taxi properly with the old tires. Hussan, as a member of two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy new tires for his taxi. He would also do some repair work in his taxi. This would increase the monthly income and savings of her husband, and in the future, he would buy a new taxi with the profit amount.
 
As this taxi is the only source of income for her family, this loan is very important and beneficial for her. She desires to educate her children in good schools, and she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

Note: In the picture, Hussan is raising her hand.

loans.use: repair a taxi.

loans.name: Consuelo Marisol

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 44 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la agricultura, ya que toda su familia realiza la misma actividad. Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere a 65 kilómetros de distancia de su casa.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, para trabajar su cosecha a tiempo y que le permita obtener una buena producción para consumo y para la venta. Su sueño es conocer otros países y vender su cosecha aun precio más rentable.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 44 years old and has a son.  Since 18 years ago she has worked in agriculture, since her entire family works in the same business.  She acquires the agricultural inputs needed 65 kilometers from her home.

The loan she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is for buying seeds and fertilizers so she can harvest on time and obtain a high quality product for consumption and sale.

Her dream is to spend time in other countries and sell her harvest at a more profitable price.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers so she can harvest on time and obtain a high quality product for consumption and sale.

loans.name: Lodu

texts.en:
Lodu is a 38-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 14. All of them go to school. Lodu runs a manufacturing shop, and has been in business for seven years. He has one employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more metals and many other items. He has no other source of income.

In five years Lodu would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Lodu says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more metal for making doors, windows, etc.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a bar in a shop on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more Jerycans of local gin, crates of beer, soda and other soft drinks. 

Her major business challenges are defaulters, electricity and thieves. Her goal and aspirations are to own a fully stocked bar and also to educate her children up to university. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerycans of local gin and crates of beer, soda and other soft drinks.

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en:
Dorjsuren, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. Seven years ago he made some adjustments to his house in order to utilize it as a grocery store. Now his wife runs the grocery store while he sells clothes by renting stall at trade center. He imports all his clothes from a China border city and he himself goes to China. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some repair and expansion. So he is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, cement and bricks. Using these materials, he can repair and expand his house. 

The renovated house will enable the family to live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, the family will began to reduce coal consumption thus decreasing carbon emission and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as bricks, planks and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials – iron corrugated sheets, iron rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Betania Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Nancy mujer de 30 años de edad , soltera  tiene dos años de dedicarse a vender zapatos a domicilio y por encargos, sus productos son variados para todos los gustos y marcas, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos, zapatos colegiales, sandalias, zapatos de niñas etc. Rosmery tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y María tiene 44 años su negocio es un taller de carpintería y realiza muebles, sillas, mesas etc.
texts.en: This group is composed of three female entrepreneurs. Nancy is one of them: she is 30 years old, she is single and she has been engaging in selling shoes door to door and by order for two years. She offers different products form every Brand to satisfy every taste. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, school shoes, sandals and girls’ shoes. Rosmery is 20 years old and she sells cosmetics; María is 44 years old and she runs a carpentry where she produces furniture items such as chairs and tables.

loans.use: el credito  lo invertira en la compra de zapatos, zapatos colegiales, sandalias, zapatos de niñas etc.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 31 años,esta casada pero vive en la casa de sus padres ya que en su terreno propia tiene otro fin.El trabajo de Liz  consiste en el alquiler de cuartos por eso ha establecido en su terreno 4 cuartos que alquila para uso diario, semanal o mensual a precios cómodos. Para la construcción de estas habitaciones contó con el apoyo de su padre y de su esposo quienes le brindan su ayuda desinteresada. Recién lleva en esta actividad un mes, ya que anteriormente vendía pollos, pero la demanda de este producto ha disminuido es por eso que ha decidido cambiar de rubro. Ahora se encuentra en pleno acondicionamiento de algunas de las habitaciones, por lo pronto se encuentra en la etapa de pintado para que se vean mejor, a pesar de ello ya tiene clientes que están a la espera de ocupar los cuartos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1500, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual .Con el monto solicitado comprará mallas para cubrir las ventanas de los cuartos que alquila, además acondicionará un cuarto más con todo lo necesario para alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Liz, 31, is married but lives in her parents' house because she has another goal for her own plot of land.  Liz's job is renting rooms, so on her property she has set up four rooms for daily, weekly, or monthly rental at reasonable rates.  To construct these rooms she had the support of her father and her husband, who generously help her.

She has only one month of experience in this work because previously she sold chickens.  Demand for that product has decreased, however, so she decided to change fields.  Now she's in the middle of refurbishing some of the rooms and soon she'll be painting them so they look better.  In spite of that she already has customers who are waiting for rooms.

Currently she'll request 1500 soles [PEN].  She's grateful to those who make it possible for her to get this loan because with it she'll feel more certain of getting ahead with her job.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she'll buy netting to cover the windows of the rooms she rents and she'll fit an additional room with everything necessary to rent it.

loans.use: to keep up the rooms she rents

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 34 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos de 14, 11 y 5 años respectivamente. Desde hace 15 años ella se acompaño y desde entonces trabaja cultivando maíz, frijoles y maicillo; también engorda pollos y cerdos que posteriormente los vende a las personas de la comunidad. Gracias a su madre ella ha aprendido estas actividades, ya que siempre le inculco el trabajo y la responsabilidad. Francisca no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela; pero lo que mas desea y por lo que se esmera mucho es que sus hijos asistan a la escuela. Ella ayuda también a su madre con sus gastos. Además, vende productos de lencería desde hace cinco años de casa en casa. 

Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en la ciudad que esta a una hora de su casa; pero para llegar ahí debe caminar por veredas hasta llegar al punto de autobuses; debido a que en ese lugar no hay transporte publico. Ella es acompañada por uno de sus hijos o a veces sola, ya que su esposo trabaja en el campo y por las noches trabaja como seguridad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar teja, vigas y mejorar el techo de su casa ya que se aproxima el invierno y le urge realizar estas reparaciones sino se mojaran y comprar arena y cemento para reparar el piso de la galera donde están los cerdos.  Esto lo hace con el objetivo de sus hijos vivan más seguros y no se enfermen y cuidar a sus cerdos en un lugar limpio y cómodo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 34 years old. She has a partner and three children aged 14, 11 and 5. For the past 15 years she has been with her partner and since then has worked cultivating corn, beans and millet. She also fattens pigs and chickens to later sell to people in her community. Thanks to her mother she has learnt these activities, as she always instilled the need to work hard and be responsible in her. Francisca did not have the opportunity to attend school; but her greatest desire and the thing she works hardest for is that her children can go to school. She also helps her mother with her bills. Apart from this, for the past five years she has sold underwear from house to house.

She buys her farm supplies in the city which is an hour away from her house; and to get there she must walk along country lanes until she reaches the bus stop, as where she is there are no buses. She is sometimes accompanied by one of her sons or she goes alone, as her partner works in the fields and also at night as a security guard.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy tiles and rafters to improve the roof of her house as winter is approaching and she urgently needs to carry out these repairs otherwise they will get wet. Also she wants to buy sand and cement to repair the floor of the pig sty. She does this so that her children can live safely and not get sick and to care for her pigs in a clean and comfortable place.

loans.use: to buy tiles, rafters and to improve the roof of her house as well as buying sand and cement to repair the floor of the pig sty.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is a kind person who is married and does not have any children. She is 29 years old. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than four years. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Little by little, with the passing of the time, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to her animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large number of customers for her business. Her husband helps her with the business.

Hafiza is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She is asking for a loan of $1900 US to buy cattle for developing her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for developing her business

loans.name: Saman Group

texts.en:
Saman is 30-years-old, and a diligent and hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and three daughters. Her husband is a carpenter and his income is insufficient to pay the educational expenses of their children and other household expenses.

Saman is helping her husband by reselling cloth in her house which she has done for 4 years. She wants to purchase large quantities, and good quality cloth, from other cities and then sell for a profit. For that purpose she has requested a loan from kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan, as a member of two person group, so that she can expand her business. This could increase her net income and savings and she is very hopeful for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of cloth.

loans.name: Dixon L.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, to request for a loan of 6,600,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire team.

With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. Dixon who is pictured in the middle is the featured leader of this group. Born in Gooh, the 49-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children – 4 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Dixon has been a professional teachers 29 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Elga

texts.es:
Elga tiene 30 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, vive en su casa propia junto a ellos y su cónyuge a quienes les otorga todo lo necesario para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.El trabajo de Elga consiste en la venta de carbón. Realiza este oficio en su casa, ahí instala una mesa en donde coloca las bolsas de carbón que ha adquirido en otra ciudad. Inicialmente compra al por mayor, en sacos grandes que le generan mas de 50 bolsas pequeñas que luego ella pone a la venta. Compra aproximadamente 5 sacos por semana invirtiendo alrededor de 100 soles en cada compra,  lleva en este negocio más de 4 años y le va muy bien.Le gusta su trabajo porque puede generar sus propios ingresos en la comodidad de su hogar, está pendiente de las labores que tiene que realizar en su casa y ha aprendido a complementar muy bien ambas funciones, anhela implementar su puesto brindando mayor cantidad de bolsas de carbón para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado comprará 2 sacos de carbón para venderlos en este período.
texts.en:
Elga is 30 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in a home of her own with her children and husband.  Together they do what they need to provide the best quality of life.  Elga sells charcoal.  She works from her home, where she sets up a table for her bags that she has acquired from another town.  She buys in large sacks that provide her enough for more than 50 small bags that she resells.  She buys approximately five sacks per week, for about 100 PEN each time.  She has had this business for more than four years and things are going well.  She enjoys her work because it generates an income of her own from the comfort of her home where she can also do the work necessary to care for her home.  She has learned to do both.  She wants to set up a larger location so she can have more bags of charcoal and improve her income.  She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN and is grateful to those who make this loan possible so that she can complete her goals.

She will use the money to buy two sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Bernarda

texts.es: Maria habita en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 19 años. Ella genera ingresos a través de un pequeño almacén, donde vende artículos para el hogar como ollas, juegos de vajillas, electrodomésticos menores y últimamente ha agregado víveres, para lograr el máximo aprovechamiento de su local. Su idea de negocio la desarrolló poco a poco con su propia experiencia de hace 10 años, en los que pasó de tener una miscelánea en su casa a un pequeño almacén, cuando alquiló un local en un espacio mucho mas comercial, que generara mayor movimiento entre clientes y el incremento potencial de sus ventas,así como ocurrió. Hoy sus compras las hace en diversos municipios de la costa y sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito. En la actualidad el volumen de su clientela ha crecido y requiere tener más capital de trabajo, para hacer compras en mayor volumen. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará electrodomésticos menores y víveres, para aumentar sus inventarios, en respuesta a las necesidades de su clientela y esto es lo que justamente hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
María lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and two children, ages 11 and 9.  She generates income with a small department store where she sells household items such as pots, sets of dishes, and small appliances.  Recently she has added provisions to make the most advantage of her store.

She developed her business plan little by little with her own experience in the last 10 years.  During this time she went from having a shop in her house to a small store when she rented a space in a more commercial space so she could generate more customers and increase sales potential, which is what happened.  Now she makes her purchases in various towns on the coast and she makes sales in cash and on credit.

Currently her clientele has grown and she needs to have more working capital to make bulk purchases.  This is why she's asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

She'll buy small appliances and provisions to increase her inventory to respond to her customers' needs.  This is exactly what makes her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy small appliances and provisions

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells charcoal at the market on both wholesale and retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to help with transportation and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, iron rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela de 40 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 17 años. Ella tiene un restaurante en compañía de su esposo, y también produce productos de panificación. Su negocio inició hace 15 años cuando capitalizó la idea de su esposo, de ser independiente mediante una microempresa.  Durante todos estos años han logrado tener una buena clientela, especialmente entre los miembros de la policía nacional, pues su negoció se encuentra ubicado justo al frente de esas instalaciones. Además de estos negocios también tiene un café internet, donde ofrece servicios de comunicaciones y de fotocopiaje, aprovechando el potencial de su clientela.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, para poder atender la demanda de los trabajadores de una construcción, que están haciendo frente al restaurante y requieren alimentos. En el mediano plazo planea convertir su negocio en un autoservicio, con aire acondicionado y un mayor confort, aunque su mayor desafío es la competencia fuerte que hay en el sector, pero la enfrenta exitosamente con un servicio de calidad e imagen de empresa y de empresario y con mucha disciplina de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ángela is 40 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and two children, aged 14 and 17. She owns a restaurant together with her husband and also produces bakery products. Her business started 15 years ago when she capitalised on her husband's idea of becoming independent by means of a micro-finance institution.

During all these years she has managed to build up a good clientèle, especially within the members of the national police service, as her business is located just in front of their buildings. 

Apart from this business she also runs an internet café, where she offers communication and photocopying services, making the most of the potential of her clients. At present she is requesting a loan, her first loan cycle with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy food stocks in order to be able to meet the needs of construction workers, who are working in front of the restaurant, and need feeding.

In the medium term, she plans to convert her business into a self service, with air conditioning and greater comfort. However, her biggest challenge is the strong competition that exists in her area. She deals with this effectively by offering quality service and a good business image. She is a good businesswoman and is very disciplined.

loans.use: to buy food stocks in order to prepare food.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo que es agricultor; ella posee una pequeña tienda donde vende golisinas de todo tipo, juegos, entre otras cosas, tiene muchos años con su negocio, lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión para poder surtir con productos su pequeña tienda pero necesita de capital ya que con las ganancias que obtiene solo alcanza ha solventar sus gastos familiares por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su pequeña tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Eugenia is 62 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, who is a farmer. She owns a small shop where she sells all types of sweets, games, among other things. She has had her business for many years. It is located in her house and is well known by her neighbours.

Eugenia wants to extend her business and invest in order to be able to stock her small shop but she needs capital as the only earnings she receives just about cover the family expenses. This is why she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy necessary things for her small shop. She states that she will pay back the loan and trust that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sweets, juices, etc.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es:
Delfin, es casado y tiene dos hijos que estan en colegio , viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Ajlla de la localidad de Achacachi de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz.
Delfin estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche, además es acopiador de una de las empresas que recolectan leche en el área rural de La Paz  en la localidad de Achacachi.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de ganado mejorado (tres vacas), de esta manera mejorará  su producción de leche y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Delfin es tener su propio centro de acopio.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Delfin is married and has two children who are in high school. They live in their own home which is located in the Ajlla community of the town of Achacachi in the Omasuyos province, department of La Paz.

Delfin went to school up to the secondary level and right now he works in milk production. He is also a collector for one of the businesses that collect milk in the rural area of La Paz in the town of Achacachi.

He needs the loan to buy better quality cattle (three cows). This way, he will improve his milk production and thus improve his quality of life. 

Delfin's dream is to have his own collection center. This is the third time he has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows of better quality to increase high quality milk production.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE – 26 está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales cinco son mujeres y tres varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Lupe tiene 28 años,  tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años ella confecciona ropa de trabajo, overoles,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona del Achachicala, la Sra. Lupe va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que ella tiene contratos con empresas a los que entrega el producto terminado,  como también entrega a distintas ferias donde venden ropa de trabajo,   la Sra. Lupe enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes,  la Sra. Lupe es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE – 26 communal bank is made up of eight members, five women and three men. THey work in different activities. The president of the bank is Lupe. She is 28. She has two children who are school aged. She has worked making clothing for several years. She makes work clothes and overalls. Her workshop is in her house. located in the Achachicala area. Lupe is going to use this loan to buy fabric wholesale to make clothing. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her investment capital, since she has contracts with businesses to which she delivers the finished product. She also delivers to different markets where they sell work clothes. Lupe faces challenges in her business, such as increasing her income. She is going to use her profits to invest in buying sewing materials to make good quality clothing and thus have more orders from her customers. Lupe is a very hardworking person who is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has given.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Hamadi, who is in his late 50s, is married with two children who go to school.  He has been running a retail shop for two years now. He works from 6:30 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hamadi's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the retail shop and has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and started building his house. He will use this loan to restock the missing items in the retail shop. His dream is to one day be able to continue building and finish his house.

Hamadi will share this loan with his loans group "Jaguar" consisting of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in their retail shop.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Bonifacia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and its harvest. In the future, Bonifacia hopes to make her business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Mkrtich

texts.en:
Mkrtich is 40 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe District with his parents, two children and wife. Mkrtich requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Mkrtich’s father serves the local people as a taxi driver and gets a small monthly income, and his mother is provided with a retirement pension. Mkrtich has a grocery store locally. There is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Mkrtich will purchase a stock of groceries for his grocery store. After the stock is purchased he will be able to offer more varieties of products to his customers. As the customers will be more satisfied, he will increase his income and will reinvest in the same business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries for his grocery store

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa, es soltera y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la Urb. 16 de febrero  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primario y actualmente se dedica al comercio de condimentos (ají de varias calidades, comino, pimienta, etc.) en la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para refacción de su vivienda (necesita arreglar las paredes que son de adobe, comprar estuco para planchar las paredes)de esta manera tener una mejor calidad y nivel de vida.
El sueño de Felipa es terminar de construir su casita.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Felipa is single and does not have any children who depend on her. She lives in her own house which is located in the estate 16th February in the city of El Alto. Felipa studied up to primary level and currently makes a living selling spices (various types of chili, cumin, pepper, etc.) in the city of El Alto.

She is requesting this loan to renovate her house. She needs to fix the walls which are made of mud and buy plaster to smooth the walls. This will give her a better quality of life.

Felipa's dream is to finish building her house.

This is her first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy plaster to renovate the mud walls of her house.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 26 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe District with his 26-year-old wife and two children, who are going to school. Revaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Revaz has his own car washing service. He is working there and washes cars to earn a small income for the family which is not enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Revaz requested a loan from Credo to restart a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Revaz will start trading clothes and household goods. He will purchase the products from the big market at the wholesale price and resell them among the villagers with a price markup. Revaz used to have this business before, and he is very experienced in this field. This will help him to restart up his business and make it successful. He will earn good profit which will be used for reinvesting and developing the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start trading clothes and household goods

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 40-year-old, hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a government employee, and Rani has a part-time business of a photo studio in her house. Rani wants to educate her children in good schools, and that’s why she is running a photo studio to generate an alternative source of income for her family.

Currently, Rani is in need of purchasing new digital cameras and some accessories like batteries, etc., so that she can run her business more appropriately and satisfy her clients more professionally. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She will also renovate her photo studio with the loan which will attract more clients. With the profit, she wants to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase cameras for a photostudio

loans.name: Fredesbinda

texts.es: Fredesbinda, de 47 años de edad ,esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia con quienes comparte el mismo amor por el trabajo y el anhelo por lograr una buena calidad de vida.Fredesinda se dedica al cuidado de niños pequeños. Ha establecido en su vivienda una guardería con los elementos básicos para la protección y tranquilidad de los niños. Su labor consiste en cuidarlos mientras sus padres trabajan brindándoles momentos de recreación con juegos didácticos, alimentación y educación. Lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 5 años. Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y bebidas energizantes. Su trabajo le genera ganancias considerables por semana lo que le sirve para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y destinar otra parte al ahorro para alguna situación fortuita.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles , por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado comprará juegos didácticos, materiales educativos y sillas pequeñas para seguir recibiendo más niños para su cuidado.
texts.en:
Fredesbinda is 47 years old, married and has three children. She lives in her own house together with her family, who share the same love for their work and the desire to obtain a good quality of life. Fredesbinda makes a living caring for young children. She set up a nursery in her house with the basic elements necessary for the safety and tranquillity of the children. Her job consists in looking after them while their parents work. She gives them moments of free play time with didactic games, food and education. She has carried out this activity for more than five years. If necessary, she makes a living selling fizzy drinks and energy drinks. Her job generates considerable earnings every week, which helps her cover their basic needs and put some money away as a saving for when needed.

On this occasion she is requesting 1500 PEN and would like to thank all the people who make this loan possible so she can go ahead with her plans. On the other hand, she is committed to making her loan payments on time. With the amount requested she will buy didactic games, educational materials and small chairs so she can continue caring for more children.

loans.use: to buy didactic games, educational materials and small chairs.

loans.name: Anaiz

texts.es:
Anaiz de 56 años de edad, es madre cabeza de familia de siete hijos. Laboró durante 18 años como fotógrafa en el departamento de Caquetá, Colombia, pero debido a los desastres naturales ocurridos en esta región se vio en necesidad de desplazarse, debido a que perdió su vivienda y su negocio, el cual era su única fuente de ingresos. A raíz de esta situación se ubicó en la ciudad e Medellín en donde comenzó a vender fritos y tamales, para la supervivencia de su familia. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, lo cual resulta más conveniente por su actual estado de salud.
Con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación, Anaiz se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de una vitrina que usará como exhibidor de mercancía.
texts.en:
Anaiz is 56 years old. She is mother to seven children and head of the household. She worked as a photographer in the department of Caquetá, Columbia for 18 years, but due to natural disasters in this region she was forced to move. She lost her house and her business, which was her only source of income. In the wake of this situation, she settled in the city of Medellín, where she began to sell fried foods and tamales to help her family survive. Presently she makes a living selling products by catalogue, which is more convenient for her present state of health.

With the aim of improving her economic condition and ensuring her children receive a better quality of life and education, Anaiz is requesting a loan with which she will buy a display cabinet where she will display her products.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, es casado y tiene Un hijo que está en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa adela Amigo Chaco  de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como chofer asalariado, en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, fierro. Así podrá construir una tienda para su esposa donde ella pueda comenzar un negocio de venta de abarrotes.
El sueño de Juan Carlos es tener su casita construida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is married and has a son who studies at a state school. He lives in his own house, which is located in the area Villa Adela Amigo Chaco in the city of El Alto.

Juan Carlos studies up to secondary level and is currently working as a paid chauffeur in the city of La Paz.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials: cement, bricks, iron. In this way he will be able to build a shop for his wife, where she can start up a business selling food stocks.

Juan Carlos' dream is to finish building his house.

This is his first loan cycle with IMPRO and his first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and iron to build a shop in his house.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Мубораку 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муборак вместе семьей живет в сельской местности и поэтому ее местожительство весьма благополучный для скотоводства. Муборак после участие в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин решила организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Она имеет опыт выращивание скота, так как она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству. Муборак планирует купить скот, присматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке по более высокой цене, чем она купила. Сын Муборака будет помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота. Этот займ поможет ей организовать новый бизнес и таким образом найти нового источника дохода. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muborak is 50 years old, married and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in a rural area that is very good for cattle.  After taking the course To Get Ahead, offered by the Association of Business women, she decided to start her own business buying and selling animals.  She has previous experience in this field since her childhood when she helped her parents with their livestock.  Muborak plans on buying cattle, fattening them for a few months and then reselling them at a local market at a higher price then she paid for them.  Her son will help her driver conduct this business.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 KGS.  This loan will help her start her business and begin a new source of income.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a father of four children ranging in age from 14 to 20 years, operates a construction business located in a busy area, where he deals with cement customers. He also earns income as a farmer.

Having repaid his previous loans, Peter, an intelligent and honest man, is requesting his third one from SMEP DTM for Kes 80,000 to upgrade his construction business through the purchase of a grinding machine. He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay house rent and school fees for his children. Peter sees himself as a supplier in five years' time, and hopes to offer his children a quality education.

loans.use: to upgrade his construction business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes , vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Juliana   de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente es prensista de imprenta independiente y realiza trabajos para varias imprentas.
El crédito lo requiere para al pago al Hospital donde se encuentra internada su esposa ya que tuvo una operación.
El sueño de Antonio es tener su propia imprenta.
Es la terceravez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Antonio is married and has no dependent children. He lives in his own house, which is located in the area Villa Juliana in the city of El Alto.

He studies up to secondary level and is presently working as a printer in an independent printing factory where he carries out various printing jobs.

He is requesting a loan to pay the hospital where his wife is admitted as she has had an operation.

Antonio's dream is to have his own printer.

This is his third loan cycle with IMPRO and his first time with KIVA.

loans.use: pay the hospital for the operation his wife received.

loans.name: Action Women Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Action Women” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Seibatu. Seibatu is age 32. She was born in Kailahun Town in eastern Sierra Leone. She is currently residing in Kenema City, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman. One of her children is attending primary school and the other one is not of school-going age. For many years now, Seibatu has been selling fish. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Hanifamo

texts.ru: Ханифамо женщина с доброй душой. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ханифамо 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Муж Ханифамо трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и поэтому Ханифамо справляется с домохозяйством сама. Ханифамо более 2 года заниматься купле продажей индустриальных товаров на местном рынке. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов, и год за годом развивает бизнес. Ханифамо должна увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получать больше дохода, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США для покупки товара как нитка, иголка, зеркало и т.п. для увеличения оборотного капитала. Это ее первый займ, и она надеется, что этот займ поможет ей развивать бизнес и таким образом принесет радость в ее дом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hanifamo is a 42-year-old, hardworking woman with a kind soul.  She's married and is raising 3 children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, so Hanifamo handles the household by herself.  She has more than 2 years experience selling industrial goods at a local market.  She has regular customers and each year she expands her business.  Hanifamo wants to increase her working capital and, in turn, increase her income since she is in need of money.  She's asking for a loan of $1050 to buy more goods like thread, needles, mirrors, etc., to achieve these goals.  This is her first loan and she hopes that it will help her develop her business which will bring joy to her home.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy home products to increase turnover

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Икромчон женатый молодой человек. Ему 27 лет. Он живет у родителей в районе Шахритус на юго-западе Таджикистана. Теплый и даже жаркий климат района благоприятствует здесь развитию сельского хозяйства. Икромчон намерен начать новый бизнес и выбрал животноводческую деятельность. У него имеется сарай для содержания скота, корм для скота и к тому же скотный рынок находится недалеко от его дома. Икромчон нуждается в кредите, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Он запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ikromjon is young, married man, 27 years of age.  He lives with his parents in Shahrituz region in southwestern Tajikistan.  The warm and even hot climate of the region is conducive to agriculture.  Ikromjon is going to start his own business and has chosen the livestock industry.  He has a barn to keep the animals, feed for them, and a livestock market is found not far from his home.  Ikromjon needs a loan to start this business buying and selling cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо 49 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 21 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей продукты питания как конфеты, печенье и т.п. в продовольственном магазине. Она справляется с бизнесом одна, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и ей не на кого надеется. В последнее время у нее мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и она не может придерживать своих клиентов, которые делают покупки в новых магазинах. Зебо должна срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zebo is 49 years old, married and is raising 1 child.  She is a very hardworking person and has more than 21 years of experience in business.  She buys and sells food products like candy and cookies in a store.  She handles her business alone since her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and she has no one to lean on.  The last little while, she has had few clients because of intense competition.  She is unable to hold on to her clients who shop at new stores.  Zebo urgently needs to expand her assortment of goods in order to bring back her clients.  She is asking for a loan of $3,000 in order to buy bread, butter, sausages, canned goods, beverages and dairy products.  She depends on you and your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items as bread, butter, milk products and etc to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es: Graacias por apoyar a Luis, quien con su anterior credikiva compró mercancia con la cual respondio a las expectativas y necesidades de su clientela; el con su credito pudo apalancar su negocio, incrementar sus ventas, utilidades y capital de trabajo y esto se reinvirtió en que se pudo mejorar sus condiciones de vida, viajó a otra ciudad con su madre y se reencontró con su familia. Su negocio ha crecido y está muy fortalecido por eso envia el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadoes de Kiva " es de infinitos agradecimientos, y gratitud, por la labor de apoyar a las personas como yo, de escasos recursos, y que gracias a los préstamos podemos tener la oportunidad de progresar. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará mercancias variadas, y hará mantenimiento y reparación de vitrinas y del local comercial para darle una mejor presentación y así su mercancia exhibida será mas apetecida por su clientela., lo cual es el factor de éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Luis.  With his previous Kiva loan he bought merchandise in response to his customers’ expectations and needs.  With his loan he was able to leverage his business and increase his sales, profits, and working capital.  He used this to reinvest, and he was able to improve his living conditions.  

He traveled with his mother to another city, and he reunited with his family.  His business has grown and is much stronger.  That is why he sends the following message to his Kiva lenders, “It is with unending gratitude that I thank you for your work of supporting people like me with scarce resources.  Thanks to the loans we are able to have to opportunity to progress”.

He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan.  He will use the loan to buy varied merchandise.  He will also perform maintenance and repair the display cases at his place of business in order to give it a better presentation.  This way, his merchandise on display will be more appealing to his clientele.  This is the factor that will make this investment successful.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise, to perform maintenance, and to repair the display cases.

loans.name: Aiten

texts.en:
Aiten is 36 years old. She lives in Marneuli District with her parents. Aiten requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays, the family is out of a source of income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Aiten requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Aiten will renovate a commercial space and open a clothes shop. After the commercial space is renovated, she will purchase clothes. Aiten hopes that this business will be profitable; she will do her best to satisfy the needs of her clients. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate a commercial space and open a clothes shop.
